Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	Thus begins the words of Albucasim.
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	O, sons, when I have completed this book for you, which is the last of the science of medicine, by its completion in it, and by its expositions and declarations, it has become clear to me that you will complete with this treatise, which is a part of the action by hand, i.e., surgery.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	For the action by hand is prohibited in our realm and in our time is deprived of all prestige, while greatly risking the science of it, and its traces are obscured; and nothing remains of it except a few small descriptions in the books of the Ancients, which they altered and led to those errors and hesitations that closed their minds to it and diminished its strength and skill.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	And it has become clear to me that I will animate this through the arrangement of this treatise in that second way of exposition and declaration and abbreviation; and so that it might come with the forms of the tools of cauterization and other instruments of the work as is fitting for addition of the declaration, and for preparation of it, which cause is necessary.
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	But the cause for which there is no good craftsman by hand in our time is because the art of medicine is long, and that its practitioner must be practiced beforehand in the science of anatomy, which recognizes Gaulish in that it knows the joints of the members and their forms, and the connection and separation of them; and have the knowledge of bones, nerves, and tendons, and the number of those, and their emanation.
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	And so Hypocras says that by name is much, but in the work is little, and especially in the art of the hand.
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	But we have already said that in the introduction to this book; for whomever is not learned what we have said of anatomy, it is not permitted that they might fall into error by which men will die, as I have seen too many of those, for some are formed in this science and throw themselves from it without experience.
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	For I saw a foolish and experienced physician pierce a scrophula on the neck of a woman, and piercing some arteries of the neck so that much blood flowed and the woman died in his arms.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	And I saw another physician who extracted a stone from a man who had proceeded in his state, and the stone was large, and he came to him and drew out that stone with a piece of the bladder, and that man died on the third day.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	And I had called to extract it, and I saw that for the size of the stone and for the disposition of the patient over him that he would die.
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	And I saw another physician who took stipends from a duke of our land for surgery, and there came to him a broken black slave; and preparing with his ignorance, he extracted the fracture over the plague with powders and splints with strong compression, and did not allow the wound air.
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	And then he discharged it according to his desires, and then bound it, and then let it remain for some days and commanded that we loosen the dressing; and it became so that the thigh and leg were pustularized, and came to ruin.
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	And I was called to him, and prepared to loosen the dressing, and achieved tranquility and eased of his pains.
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	But however, corruption was confirmed in the member, so that I could not restrain it and the corruption did not cease wandering in the member as the patient perished.
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	And I saw another physician who pierced a cankerous ulcer, and was ulcerated for some days, as the wickedness of it increased with its lord.
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	The cause of which is that the cold choler is pure, and then it does not come to him from iron at all, but that there be some member suffering from it.
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	And so, sons, it is necessary for you that the action by hand be divided into two divisions: one is in operation to him who is associated with health, and the other is in work with which there is peril in the major dispositions.
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	And I have already discussed that in every chapter of this book in which there appears operation in which there is error and fear; so that it is necessary for you to guard against that and leave it, so that the foolish might not hinder your way and disgraced you.
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	And thus take up your arms with solicitude and the protection of God, and your patients with gentleness and firmness.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	And use the better way by the grace of God and to bring about health and praiseworthy success, and lay aside the terrible diseases of difficult cure, and take up your arms from what makes you fearful so that solicitude in your faith and in your name does not escape you: for it remains to your glory, and more in the world and beyond to your saintliness.
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	Gaulish has already said in some of his books:
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	"Do not heal evil ill, so that bad physicians are not named."
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	And I have divided this book according to three chapters.
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	Begins the division of the book, and first of the first part.
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.	The first chapter ordered from the head into feet, in the forms of the instruments and the tools of cauterization, and what is necessary in the operation.
La divisio de la segonda partida.	The division of the second part.
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.	The second chapter, of bleeding and piercing, and of cupping, and of plagues, and of extraction of arrows and like things, all chaptered and ordered from the forms of the instruments.
Divisio de la tersa partida.	Division of the third part.
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.	The third chapter, of restoration and of dislocation, and of cure of torque and like things; chaptered from the head into feet, and of the forms of the instruments.
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	Of cauterization by fire and by acute medicine and reminiscence of the operation.
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	With that begins the treatise of all the book.
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	We will say the quality of the humors of that cauterization and of the pains of it, and in what condition cauterization is prohibited.
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	So I say that the speech of the quality of the humor of cauterization and the pain of it is long speech and prolix, and subtle by science, and secret hidden; and many have spoken greatly of it, and from it are disagreed, and for me a little of their speeches suffices, fearing prolixity.
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	And so I say that cauterization confers to all universal complexions, which are by matter or without matter, excepting two complexions, which are complexions of phlegm without matter.
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	In the complexions phlegmy and dry with matter discorded; for some said that cauterization is beneficial to it, and others said the contrary of that, that cauterization is not convenient in ill of which is by quality and dryness, for the nature of fire is quality and dryness, and inconvenient that ill of which is phlegmy and dry be healed.
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	And he said the contrary of that, that by cauterization is made humor in all ill which is phlegmy and dry that one sees in the bodies of men, for when you compare the body of man and his humors to the complexions of fire, you rub the body of man dry.
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	And I say by the speech of that, that experiment that to me some times have discovered.
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	However, let the one who comes to this topic not be ignorant of what is already written and practiced in the chapter on cautery by various authors, and has understood the diversity of human complexions and the disposition of diseases in their bodies, and their causes, and their accidents, and the space of time of them.
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	But in other complexions you should not be afraid, especially in wet and damp diseases, for all doctors have agreed about them and are not in disagreement that cautery is beneficial for those.
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	And know, children, that the secret of healing by cautery with fire and its goodness is that cautery with burning medicine is that fire is simple, whose action only affects the part being cauterized and does not affect another part except for a little harm.
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	But the action of burning medicine reaches all parts, and strongly brings about a difficult-to-cure disease in the part it affects, and strongly helps it.
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	But fire, by its subtlety and the goodness of its substance, does not do that except that it expels the surplus. And it is known to us through experiment and through the length of service in the study of art upon the truth of causes; and because of this I am excused from the length of speech. And if it were not that my free time was not read in this pause, a secret hidden from you by fire, and the quality of its action on bodies and its expulsion by which you expel diseases, with philosophical speech demonstrated, which would be acute in your minds.
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	And know, children, that they disagree on the time when it is convenient to perform cautery, and pause in the best time of spring.
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	And I say that cautery is convenient at all times, in order that the harm by the accidental time is submerged in the benefit of what is drawn by cautery, and especially if cautery is for pains or necessary pains, strong and feverish, which do not endure delay so that malice does not come, which is greater than a little harm due to the passage of time.
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	And therefore do not wonder in your minds, children, that this is not considered except by the common people and foolish doctors; it is that for that disease which is healed by cautery, there is no reduction of time at all, and they pause in that consequence.
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	And the cause is not as they think, for cautery is not but in the place of medicine which alters the complexion and dries up the moisture which are the cause by which pains come.
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	But cautery surpasses medicine in power of its strength and value of its action, and greatness of its lord.
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	And it is possible that the disease may return at some time according to the complexion of the patient and the location of his disease, and the strength of it, and what is prepared in his body from the aggregation of surpluses in him, and what comes to him in his acquisition in food and likeness of these causes; unless the disease for which cautery was administered was a subtle disease in a part of few surpluses and moisture, so that cautery for pain and its likeness in it, it is possible that the pain will not return in him, but this happens in small things.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	But the vulgar saying is that cautery is the last remedy of medicine, and it is a true saying, not to what they understand about it, for they believe that there is no cure that benefits from medicine or any other cause except cautery.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	And the cause is contrary to that; and the intention that cautery is the last remedy of medicine is not but when we administer remedies in some diseases, and those medicines do not confer, and at the end of the cause we administer a man cautery, and it benefits for that.
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	And from here we understand that cautery is the last remedy of medicine, not according to the intention which the vulgar and foolish doctors understand.
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	And the ancients said that cautery with gold is better than cautery with iron, and they did not say this except for the equality of gold and subtlety of its substance.
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	And they said that the place of cautery does not do that, unless it is absolutely true, for I have already proven and proven to you that this is not but in some bodies without the others, and cautery with it is good and better than with iron as they said; but when you perform cautery with fire with gold, it is not declared to you, for it is ignited according to the quantity that you want due to the redness of gold, and because it prepares to receive friction; and if you apply an igniter over it, gold melts by the fire, and some sheets fall into the fire so that the craftsman catches them due to the occupation of that.
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	And for this, cautery with iron is done more lightly and closer to the rightness of operation.
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	And I have ordered this chapter on cautery according to chapters, and I have ordered those of the head among the feet, so that I may ask for what I want from him.
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	Of cautery of headache by coldness and moisture.
Le capitol primier.	The first chapter.
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cauterization confers to moisture and coldness above the servile accident of which there are two causes, it is the cause of soda and multitude of fluxes, called headache, from the parts of the temples and ears flowing, and multitude of sleeping, and toothache and of the jaw, and generally of all disease that comes by frigidity, as well as paralysis, stroke, and likeness in those diseases.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The form of this cauterization is this, that first of all you command the patient to be evacuated by laxative medicine, the head being washed clean, for three or four days according to the strength of the patient and his age and habit.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	And then command him to shave his head with a razor, and then let him lie between your knees on a low bench and let him lie on his feet.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	And then pause the edge of your palm palm up to the point above the nose between the eyes.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	But however, when your middle finger's location is reached, signal that location with the tip of the thumb and then ignite the olive cautery of which this is the form:
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	And then pause it on the marked location, in such a way that it descends, and your hand be constrained little by little, and you revolve it.
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	And then lift your hand lightly and look at the location, and if you see that some quantity of the head is already uncovered, as well as the quantity of hair, then lift your hand again, and if it has not returned to its original location with that iron, with another one, if it is cool, enter until it is seen by you that which I have said to you.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	And then take a little salt and dissolve it over the location and let it be for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	And then pause on it cotton dipped in vinegar and let it be on it until the scar of the fire is destroyed.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	And then heal the location with four-part thuốc long into it has healed.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	And they said that when the Roman plaster is open, so many honeys are put in it, because it is better and more beneficial.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	And they said that the jaw should be cauterized within the bone, and the cautery should be applied until some part of the substance of the bone is burnt.
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	And then scrape off what is burnt and then heal it.
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	Others said that the cautery arrived at the end, passing through the strong bone while the bone collapsed, and this is the form of small alphecati.
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	And they believe that from that place, the vapors of the head expire.
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	And when there has been a wound open for a long time and it is cured while still unhealed,
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	But I have never seen these two species of cautery in anyone, except some people according to the way of fear; and that person, for me, is better off healthy than ill, because the head is devastated by the solution of its continuity with it as we have testified in other members, and especially when the patient's head is of a foul nature.
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	And the first kind of cautery is more safe and better for me; and that person uses it and works on that with health.
Capitol segon.	Chapter Second.
Del cauteri del cap.	Of the cautery of the head
Quan en tot le cap accideys dolor cronica e longua e aquo es en le malaute prolonguat, e usa de gerras e de cochias e de capipurges e de emplaustres e de guatz e de cadels e de gualinas e de semblantz, e majorment si ja es cauterizat am un cautere le qual recontam e no aprofieyta a lu deguna de aquelas causas, lahoras considera quar si le cap del malaute es de fort creacio en la sua natura; e no es freul et atroba mot gran freg, lahoras aquel cauterisa am autra cauteri dejos aquel un pauc.	When in all the head there is chronic and long-lasting pain and this is prolonged in the patient, and he uses lances and cupping glasses and head purges and plasters and poultices and hot stones and bandages and similar things, and especially if he has already been cauterized by a cautery which did not help him for any of those causes, then consider that if the patient's head is of strong creation in its nature; and it is foul and finds great friction there, then cauterize it with another cautery under that one a little.
E aprop cauterisa aquel sobre le corn del sieu cap am cauteri entro que la codena es partida.	And if it is necessary to cauterize under the head and it benefits him another form of cautery by which the wound is held, then cauterize with a cautery on the crown of his head where the scalp is split.
Incisa la codena e sia descuberta del os la quantitat la qual havem recontat e cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en la partida deriera del cap en le loc le qual es apelat vas, — e es aquel loc en le qual es pausada ventosa.	The scalp is split and the amount we have measured is uncovered from the bone and that is cauterized with a cautery in the back part of the head at the place which is called a vein — and it is the place where the ventouse is placed.
Et alleuja la tua ma en aysso, e no descobras le os, quar le malaute per aquo atroba mot gran dolor diversa de la dolor de totz les autres cauteris del cap.	And put your hand on it, and do not uncover the bone, because the patient through that finds much more pain than from any other cautery of the head.
E yeu diyre aquest cauteri en son loc, quar cove que·l cauteri am le qual so cauterisatz les corns del cap e le occiput es pus subtil cauteri que aquel am le qual es cauterisat le mieg loc del cap; e aquesta es la forma de lu.	And I say that this cautery is in its place, because the cautery by which they cauterize the horns of the head and the occiput is more subtle cautery than that by which the middle part of the head is cauterized; and this is how it is done:
Capitol ters.	Chapter Third.
De cauterisacio de emigranea no-antiqua.	Of the cautery of non-ancient migration.
Quan endeve en la partida del cap dolor sodo, o es stenduda dolor entro al uelh, sia evacuat am medicinas le cap mondificantz, e sia aministrada l’autra curacio, la qual yeu he dita en las devesios de las malautias; e tot no aprofieyta, lahoras cauterisacio en lu es en dos manieyras: o cauterisacio am medicina acuta comburent, o am ferr.	When a sudden pain is in the front of the head, or pain is stretched into the eye, the head must be evacuated by cleansing medicines, and other treatment must be administered, which I have written about in the beginnings of illnesses; and if all this does not help, cauterization of it is in two ways: either by acute burning medicine, or by iron.
Mays cauteri am medicina comburent es que tu prenguas una dolsa de alh, e escorgas aquela e abcindas las extremitatz de lu de amdos les caps.	But a cautery by burning medicine is that you take an onion, and cut it up and season the ends of it on both sides with salt.
E aprop incideys le loc de la dolor en la templa am una lanceta lada entro que sia en lu feyt loc dejos la codena, entro que sia occultada.	Then pierce the place of the pain in the temple with a pointed lance so that it penetrates under the scalp and is hidden.
E aprop strenh sobre lu am stopada per descent constreccio, e layssa aquel per le spazi de tres horas; e aprop deslia le e tratz le alh, e laysa la plagua per dos o per tres jorn, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto submergit en boder entro que le loc fassa brac.	Then tighten it with a binding bandage so that it presses down strongly and leave it there for three hours; then remove the onion and treat the wound with ointment, and leave the wound for two or three days, then put your hand over the place while immersing it in warm water so that the place becomes swollen.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Then cure it with ointment until it is healed.
E si tu voys, fe aquo am alcunas medicinas comburentz las quals yeu he scriutas en le douse tractat de medicinas comburentz.	And if you want to do this with some other burning medicines which I have written about in the two tractates of burning medicines.
Mays la cauterisacio am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: igneys per cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	But the cauterization by iron according to this way: heat up an iron cautery and this is how it is done:
e es apelat claus clavilhs, quar le cap de lu es ayssi cum forma de clavel en le qual es alcuna curvitat, e·n le mieg loc de lu es eminensia petita.	And it is called closed claw nail, because the head of it is like a nail with some curvature and in the middle part of it there is a small prominence.
E aprop pausa sobre loc de la dolor, e rete la tua ma — per que no sia adhurida la arceria la qual es dejos — e revol le ferr petit a petit am velocitat.	Then put your hand over the place of the pain — so that the iron which is underneath is not burned — and move the iron little by little quickly.
E si la quantitat de lu que es adhurida per la specitut de la codena ayssi quo la maytat de lu, e elava la tua ma per so que la arteria no sia adhurida la qual es dejos, per so que no vengua flux de sanc.	And if the quantity of it which is burned by the thickness of the scalp is according to the size of it, and raise your hand so that the artery underneath is not burned which is underneath, so that there is no flow of blood.
E aprop enbibeys coto en aygua de sal e pausa aquel sobre le loc, e layssa aquel per tres dias; e aprop pausa coto mulhat am boder, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Then dip the wound in salty water and put it on the place for three days; then put a bandage moistened with wine on it and cure it with ointment until it is healed.
E si voys, cauterisa am la extremitat del cutellari segon cauteri, e guarda te de incisio de arteria en aquesta emigranea propriament no-antiqua.	And if you want, cauterize with the tip of the scalpel according to cautery and beware of incision of artery in this non-ancient migration.
Capitol quart.	Chapter Fourth.
De cauterizacio d’emigranea antiqua.	Of the cautery of ancient migration.
Quan tu curas emigranea am aquo que havem dit de la curacio precedent, e aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias, e no aprofieyta la curacio, e vezes per la malautia que no abasta a lu aquo que havem dit del primier cauteri am medicina o del cauteri am foc, lahoras cove que tu igniscas le cauteri cutellar entro que sia albificat, pus que significas sobre le loc de la dolor am linha de longuesa de la qual sia la maytat del dit, o quays aquel; e depausa la tua ma per una veguada e strenh aquela entro incidiscas la arceria e pervengua entro al os.	When you cure migration with what we have said about the previous treatment and what we have said in the divisions of illnesses, and the treatment does not help, and you see that for the illness which is not sufficient to it what we have said about the first cautery by medicine or the cautery by fire, then wherever you ignite the cautery-scalpel so that it turns white, measure on the place of the pain a length of line of which the size of the finger is, or whichever, and put your hand aside for a while and tighten it so that you pierce the artery and it comes into the bone.
Empero necessari es a tu que guardes de la continuacio de la mandibula, la qual es mauguda deves la masticacio, e que le lacert no sia adhurit e le nervi le qual mau aquela, e que no s’endevengua espasme.	However it is necessary for you to guard against the continuance of the jaw, which is worn down because of mastication, and that the vein not be burned and the nerve which controls it, and that no spasm come upon it.
E si es sobre la custodia e cautela de flux de sanc de l’arteria que es abciza, quar en la abcizio de lu es temor, e majorment ad aquel le qual ignora aquo que fa e no es studios e esproat; e layssa la operacio en lu al comensament.	And if it is about the custody and caution of flow of blood from the artery which is split, because in its splitting there is danger, and especially to him who ignores what he does and is unskilled and inexperienced; and leave the operation at the beginning.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio del regiment de flux de sanc accident de la arceria segon la sieua manieyra, en le sieu loc de aquest libre.	And I will come with remembrance of the regimen of accidental flow of blood from the artery according to its way in this free book.
E si veses de aquesta malautia que no abaste aquest cauteri e veses le cors del malaute tollerable, cauteriza aquel en le mieg loc del cap ayssi cum havem recontat, e cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	And if you see that this illness does not help this cautery and you see the body of the patient tolerable, cauterize it in the middle part of the head as we have measured, and cure the wound until it is healed.
E si voys, aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le capitol de streccio de arceria am cauteri havent dos cotels, e es milhor cauterizacio aquesta e mays conferent.	And if you want to administer the cautery which we have said in the chapter of stretching of the artery with cautery having two points, and this cautery is better and more certain.
Capitol .v.	Chapter Fifth.
De cauterisacio de las dolors de aurelhas.	Of the cauterization of pains of auricles.
Quan en la aurelha ve dolor per freg e es curat am causas lacsativas e am l’autra curacio la qual he dita en la divisio, e no es remauguda la dolor, lahoras igneys le cauteri, e es aquest le qual ha nom puncta, del qual aquesta es la forma:	When in the auricle there is pain because of friction and it is cured by lancing and by the other treatment which I have said in the division, and the pain is not relieved, then ignite the cautery, and this is that one which has the name puncta, and this is how it is done:
E aprop puncta aprop la ignicio, e sia menat al enviro de tota la aurelha ayssi cum roda es revolguda, o en le circuit de quascuna essemps si la dolor es en quascuna.	Then pierce the ignition and let it be carried around all of the auricle as it is turned, or in the circuit of each of them if the pain is in any of them.
Alonga te am le cauteri de la razit de la aurelha pauc a pauc pus que aias senhat le loc am tenta.	Apply the cautery at the base of the ear slowly, little by little, until you have felt the area with the tip.
E si le cauteri de detz puntz en tota aurelha, e quays aquela, e aprop cura les locz entro que sian sanatz.	And if the cautery makes points on the entire ear, and he feels that, then cure the places inside which are healthy.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter VI
De cauterizacio de turtura.	Of cauterization by torture.
Turtura la qual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las quals veno per flecma, segon que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.	Torture which is cured and treated with cauterization is only of the humors which come from phlegm, as we have said in the divisions of illnesses.
Esquiva cauterizacio de la specia que endeve per siccacio o per spasme del nervi.	Avoid cauterization of the humors which come from dryness or from nervous spasms.
Quan tu curas aquela specia de turtura am jerras e capipurgi e guarguarismes, e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas le malaute am tres cauteris: la i deves la razit de la aurelha, e·l segon un petit dejos le sieu templar, e le ters deves la conjunccio de doas labias.	When you treat that kind of torture with poultices and clysters and washes, and your treatment doesn't work, then you should cauterize the patient in three places: the first at the base of the ear, the second a small spot below his temple, and the third at the junction of two lips.
E pausa lo tieu cauteri per le contrari de la partida malauta, quar mollificacio no ve sino en la partida que apar sana.	And apply your cautery against the direction in which the illness is traveling, because softening will not come except through the part that appears to be healing.
E la forma de cauterisacio es que cauterizas aquel am le cauteri en le dreyt de la extremitat de la aurelha pus sobirana un petit sobre le corn del cap, e en le templar autre, la longuesa del qual sia segon la longitut del dit pous, e depausa la tua ma am cauteri entro que sia comburida la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena.	And the way of cauterization is that you cauterize it with the cautery at the right side of the highest part of the ear, a little above the horn of the head; another at the temple, the length of which should be according to the length of the finger nail, and apply your hand with the cautery inside until the amount of the half of the size of a peppercorn is burned.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri, e es specia del cutellari, la forma del qual es denant mesa.	And this is the form of the cautery; it is a kind of scalpel, the shape of which is in front like a table.
Mays empero pus subtil es que aquel un pauc ayssi co vesas; e cove que cotel en lu de superflua groceza un pauc.	But indeed more subtle is that one little bit here and there; and where it cuts through excessive thickness a little.
E aprop cura le loc am aquo que es denant procezit entro que sia sanat.	And then cure the place with that which is in front processed until it is healed.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter VII.
De cauterizacio de apoplextia antiqua.	Of cauterization of old apoplexy.
Quan apoplextia es antiquada e curas aquela am aquo que havem dit e no confereys la tua medicacio e le malaute no ha febre, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris: sobre totz les corn del sieu cap; e am cauteri e le mieg loc del cap, ayssi cum havem dit; e am cauteri en le coguot.	When apoplexy is old and you treat it with what we have said and your treatment doesn't work and the patient doesn't have a fever, then cauterize that in four places: especially on all the horns of his head; and with cautery and the middle part of the head, as we have said; and with cautery in the groin.
E la manieyra del cauteri es fayta segon que es desus dit.	And the way of cauterization is done according to what is above the finger nail.
E ja es cauterizat sobre la boca del estomac; e es mays derier; e aprop sia curat am aquo que procezeys.	And indeed it has been cauterized on the mouth of the stomach; and that is the most rear; and indeed let it be cured with what processes.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter VIII.
De cauterizacio de obblivio fayta per flacma.	Of cauterization made for oblivion caused by phlegm.
Cove que sian donatz al malaute en le comensament jerras grans e pilulas le servel mondificantz.	Let the patient be given in the beginning large poultices and purging pills, the servant cleansing agents.
E aprop ras le cap tot del malaute e pausa sus le coguot de lu emplaustre de cetre descrit en le tractat dels emplastres.	And then scrape the entire head of the patient and apply over the groin a poultice of cedar described in the treatise on poultices.
E pausa aquel alcunas veguadas, quar aquel es manieyra de cauteri.	And apply that several times, for that is the way of cauterization.
E fay aquo segon aquel meteys orde le qual ja he dit.	And do that according to the order of which I have already said.
E donc si per aqueles sanat bo es; e sino, lahoras fay a lu tres cauteris en la deriera partida de sieu cap, les quals sian deysendentz de la partida pus sobirana del cap entro a la partida pus dejos del col.	And if he is healed by those, well and good; and if not, then do to him three cauterizations in the rear part of his head, which descend from the highest part of the head to the lowest part of the neck.
E pausa entre quascun cauteri la grossetut del dit, e aprop cura lo cauteri am aquo que es procedit.	And apply between each cautery the thickness of a finger nail, and then cure the cautery with that which it produces.
Mays si tu vos addicio e le malaute es aquo tollerant, lahoras fay a lu cauteri en le mieg loc; e si voys major addicio, lahora cauteriza aquel sobre les dos corns.	But if you feel an increase and the patient can tolerate it, then do to him cauterization in the middle part; and if you feel a greater increase, then cauterize that on both horns.
Aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat; e sia le cauteri olivar segon la forma denant donat.	Then cure that until it is healed; and let the cautery be olive-colored according to the shape given before.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter IX.
De cauterisacio de parazili e de mollificacio de tot le cors.	Of cauterization of parasites and of softening of all the body.
Cove que tu procesiscas en mondificacio del cap am jerras e am aquo que havem dit; e aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap, e am cauteri sobre totz les corns del cap, e am cauteri sobre la deriera partida de lu, e am tres cauteris sobre les spondils del col.	Let the patient be cleansed in cleansing of the head with poultices and with that which we have said; and then scrape the head of the patient, and then cauterize that with cautery in the middle part of the head, and with cautery on all the horns of the head, and with cautery on the rear part of him, and do to him three cauterizations on the spine of the neck.
E si es necessari en la malautia de mollificacio del cors de trops aquel e les malautes tollerantz e la malautia es fort, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e dererament am cauteri entro que sia comborit de la codena mot de lu, e aleva la tieua ma.	And if it is necessary in the illness of softening of the body of trops and the illnesses tolerate that and the illness is strong, then cauterize that with four cauterizations on the spine of the neck, and lastly with cautery inside until the peppercorn mot of him burns, and raise your hand.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat, e aquest sia cauteri olivar.	Then cure that until it is healed; and let that be cauterized olive-colored.
Capitol .x.	Chapter X.
De cauterisacio de epilemcia.	Of cauterization of epilepsy.
No es cauterizat le epilemtic sino aquella epilemcia es per flecma.	An epileptic is not cauterized unless that epilepsy is caused by phlegm.
E donc cove que mondifiques le cervel de lu al comensament de lu am yeras e am l’autra curacio la qual havem dicta en la divisio quan le malaute es gran e es tollerant la exceperacio de las medicinas.	And therefore let the brain of him be cleansed at the beginning of his illness with herbs and with the other cure which we have said in the division when the patient is large and can tolerate the exception of medicines.
E si es enfant le qual no sufferte las medicinas, lahoras aministra guarguarissmes e mastiguatoris le servel mondifican, denant aquo per motz dias, am bonifficacio de las viandas.	And if the patient is a child who does not suffer medicines, then administer to him washes and masticables, the servant cleansers, before the days pass, with the benefit of foods.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en le mieg loc del cap segon la manieyra precedent, e am autre cauteri en le occiput de lu, e sobre quascun corn del cap sieu cauterisa.	And then scrape the head of the patient, and then cauterize that with one cautery in the middle part of the head according to the previous way; and with another cautery on the back of his head, and on each horn of his head cauterize it.
E si le malaute es fort e es tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteris les quals he ditz, en havent paraliticament e mollificacio del cors sobre les spondils del col e les spondils del dos.	And if the patient is strong and can tolerate it, then cauterize that with cauteries which I have said, having paralysis and softening of the body on the spine of the neck and the spine of the back.
E sia cauteri olivar segon qu’es precedit.	And let it be cauterized olive-colored according to how it was before.
Mays si le malaute es enfant, lahoras pausa cauteri subtil segon aquesta manieyra.	But if the patient is a child, then apply a subtle cautery according to this way.
Capitol .xi.	Chapter XI.
De cauterizacio de melencolia.	Of cauterization of melancholy.
Quan las causas de melencolia so humiditatz corrompudas e flacma gros, lahoras cauteriza aquel am les cauteris les quals havem ditz en le havent paralisi.	When the causes of melancholy are corrupted humidity and phlegm, then cauterize that with the cauteries which we have said in the case of paralysis.
E si la causa de melencolia es superfluitat declinant a melencolia, e le cors del malaute es humit, lahoras da ha beure aquo que mundifica le cervel de lu segon aquo que ha precedut en la divisio.	And if the cause of melancholy is excess of decline into melancholy, and the body of the patient is humid, then let him drink that which cleanses the brain of him according to what has preceded in the division.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop fay tortora decentment fayta de li sobre le cercle, e aprop depausa aquela en le mieg loc del cap.	And then scrape the head of the patient; and then make a turpentine decently made of pine resin over the circle, and then apply that to the middle part of the head.
E le malaute sia sesent cayrat, e sia tengut de tota partida.	Let the patient be in seclusion for sixty days, and let him be kept in all parts.
E aprop pausa liniment; et es pus digne de boder antic de ovelhas.	And then apply a poultice; and it is also worthy of being bled from the ear of sheep.
E escalfa aquel sobre le foc per calefaccio temprada per mesura, le qual le dit sufferta quan es mes en lu.	And scorch that over fire with moderate heat according to measure, which he endures when it is within him.
E aprop vuo’ aquel en le mieg loc del cap de lu en le cercle, e leysa lu entro que sia enfregidat.	And now you will tie it in the middle of the head, in the circle, and loosen it so that it is relaxed.
E fay aquo am le malaute en tota semmana una veguada, am le autre regiment de lu bo entro que sia sanat; o si vols, cauteriza aquel fazen petitz puntz segon lo mays de lu, sino que tenguas la ma am un cauteri ayssi ordenat: aquesta es specia de cauteri la qual humecta le cervel am equalitat.	And do this to the patient once a week, with the other treatment until he is healed; or if you wish, cauterize the area by making small points according to his pain, unless you have your hand on a cautery in such an order: this is a special cautery that moistens the brain equally.
E aprop pausa aquel coto enbegut en boder o en grays de gualina.	Then put that cut in a soft bandage or gauze.
Capitol .xii.	Chapter 12.
De cauterisacio de aygua descendent en le huel.	Of cauterization of water descending in the hole.
Quan a tu es declarat le comensament de aygua en le huel per les senhals les quals yeu he ditz en la divisio, lahoras comensa e dona en beure al malaute aquo que mondifique le cap de lu, e guarda aquel de totas humiditatz.	When to you is shown the beginning of water in the hole by the signs which I have said in the division, then begin and give the patient to drink that which purifies the head of him, and guard that from all moisture.
E fay aquel suzar en banh en degu per alcus jorns.	And do that sweat in a bath for a few days.
E aprop comanda a lu que raza le sieu cap, e cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap; e aprop cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre dos templas si es le comensament de ysement de aygua en dos huels, o de la un latz si es comensamen de l’aygua en un huel.	And now command him to wash his head, and cauterize that with a cautery in the middle of the head; and now cauterize that with two cauteries over two temples if there is the beginning of water in two holes, or on one side if there is the beginning of the water in one hole.
Incideys am cauteri totas las venas e arcerias las quals so dejos la codena; e sian les cauteris en aquela lonh en la latitut de las templas.	Cut with a cautery all the veins and arteries which are below the collar bone; and let the cauteries be in that length in the width of the temples.
E guarda te de fluxs de sanc quan es cauterizat; e si veses de lu fluxs de sanc, osta le am alcuna medicina, la qual es a tu possible.	And guard you from flows of blood when he is cauterized; and if you see flows of blood from him, stop it with some medicine which is possible to you.
E yeu vindre am savieza la qual es en extraccio de arcerias e am abscizio de aquelas e cautela de fluxs de sanc.	And I come with wisdom which is in extraction of arteries and with incision of those and cauterization of flows of blood.
E alcunas vetz es cauterizat en le cervitz dejos dos osses am dos cauteris dererament produzitz.	And sometimes he is cauterized in the neck below two bones with two cauteries recently produced.
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter 13.
De cauterizacio de lacrimas antiquas.	Of cauterization of old tears.
Quan lacrimas dels huels so antiquas assuduament e per las venas e arterias las quals so en le loc manifest del cap defora e es verificat que aquo es superfluitatz frejas flecmatiquas, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri le qual havem recontat en le capitol de comensament de aygua cazent en les huels, e am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos templas, e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos osses.	When tears of the holes are ancient frequently and by the veins and arteries which are in the manifest location of the head outside and it is verified that this is superfluous flowing phlegmatic, then cauterize that with a cautery which we have recounted in the chapter of beginning of water falling into the holes, and with a cautery in the middle of the head and with two cauteries in the neck below two temples, and with two cauteries in the neck below two bones.
E si indigeyses de addicio, lahoras cauteriza aquel en tot latz de la coa del huel sobre la extremitat del sobrecilh am petit cauteri.	And if there is need of addition, then cauterize that in all sides of the hole's mouth on the end of the eyebrow with a small cautery.
Capitol .xiiii.	Chapter 14.
De cauterizacio de fetor de nas.	Of cauterization of stink of nose.
Quan tu medicas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no aprofieyta la tua medicacio, lahoras tu aparelha e dona en beure al malaute las cochias per tres noytz; e aprop ras le cap de lu, e cauteriza le am cauteri migier am cauteri olivar.	When you heal him with that which we have said in the division and your healing does not help, then prepare and give the patient the clysters for three nights; and now wash his head, and cauterize it with an olive cautery.
E aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri clavelh am dos cauteris sobre les dos sobrecilhs dejos les cabels un petit.	And now cauterize that with a cautery of cloves with two cauteries over the two eyebrows below the hair one small.
E guarda te de la arceria que no incindas aquela.	And guard you from the artery, lest you light it.
E del cauteri clavilh aquesta es la forma.	And of the cautery of cloves this is the form.
Capitol .xv.	Chapter 15.
De cauteri de mollificacio de palpebras dels huels.	Of cauterization of softening of eyelids of holes.
Quan la palpebra del huel es mollificada per malautia o per humiditat, lahoras cauteriza aquela palpebre1 am un cauteri am aquest cauteri lunar; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When the eyelid of the hole is softened by illness or by moisture, then cauterize that eyelid with one cautery with this lunar cautery; and this is its form.
E si vos, cauteriza aquel sobre les dos sobrecils un petit am dos cauteris en tota partida, e sian elonguatz de las timporas.	And if you, cauterize that over the two eyebrows one small with two cauteries in all parts, and let them be elongated from the temples.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la quantitat del sobrecil.	And let the length of each cautery be according to the quantity of the eyebrow.
E no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri, mays segon la quantitat que la tersa partida de la palpebre sia adhurida.	And do not press too much with your hand with the cautery, but according to the quantity that the third part of the eyelid is inflamed.
Capitol .xvi.	Chapter 16.
De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	Of cauterization of the eyelid of the hole when the hair is turned to the parts inside and it pinches the hole.
Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent.	When the hair of the hole is turned to the parts inside so that it pinches the hole, cauterize in those according to two methods; for cauterization there is with fire or with burning medicine.
Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.	If you cauterize it with fire, command the patient to look at his hair as they cut them so that they are elongated and singed; and if he pinches that, then you strengthen his holes with a bandage so that they are not wounded until the hair is born.
Donc cum siran nascutz e engualhatz, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop senha sobre la palpebre dels huels de lu am tenta, am senhal le qual sia segon la figura de fulha de merta, e sia le comensament del senhal prop dels pels.	Therefore when they are born and singed, then put the head of the patient in the hand, and now sign over the eyelid of the holes of him with a tent, with a mark which is according to the figure of a dead leaf; and let the mark be near to the hair.
E aprop pausa coto enbegut en album de huou o en mucillatge de ptilli sobre le huel.	Then put soft bandage in alum of wool or in poultice of poppy over the hole.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu.	And now heat the cautery, of which this is its form.
E aprop cauteriza sobre la figura la qual as senhada, petit a petit, em motas veguadas, entro que sia comburida la superficia de la codena la qual es ayssi cum fuelha de mirta, tota aparent propriament.	And now cauterize over the figure which you have marked, bit by bit, in few turns, until it is burned the surface of the collar bone which is as if with a leaf of myrrh, all appearing properly.
E senhal de sanetat de la tieua obra es que tu vegus la palpebre de l’huel ja esser contrayta e·ls pels de lu esser elevatz deves la punctura del huel.	And sign of health of your work is that you see the eyelid of the hole already contracted and the hair of it elevated from the puncture of the hole.
E donc eleva la tua ma e laysa aquel per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eredicada la scara.	And therefore lift up your hand and lay him for three days, and now put over him a bandage with linen until the scar is healed.
E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And now heal that with ointment until it is healed.
Mays si retorna per les pels alcuna causa aprop lor naysement e la palpebra es mollificada, lahoras fay autra vetz le cauteri sobre aquel tot ayssi cum avias fayt primieyrament.	But if the hair returns for any cause then let its opening and the eyelid is softened, then do another time the cauterization over that all as you did first.
Mays si les pels so en la palpebra dejos, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que sia elevada al sieu loc natural e sia engualhat e que les pels no punhan le huelh.	But if the hair is in the eyelid below, then cauterize that until it is elevated to its natural location and singed and let not the hair pinch the hole.
Mays le cauteri am medicina comburent aquest es que comandes al malaute que leyse les pels entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz, e aprop sia fayta de carta de drap la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	The cautery with burning medicine that you command the patient to look at his hair so that they are elongated and singed; and now let it be made of linen the form of leaf of myrrh.
E aprop pren de sabo conogut e de caus viva ana unc. .i., o quays aquo, e aprop mescle3 aquelas causas be, e fay aquo am festinacio per so que no sia enfregidat; e aprop expandeys de aquo sobre la carta la qual es fayta ayssi cum forma de fulha de mirtra, e pausa aquel sobre la un huel od amdos; e pausa dejos le huel coto enbegut en album de huou, e el cap del malaute sia en le tieu se.	And now take of soap mixed with honey and of oil of castor bean one unc. .I. Take that, and now mix those causes together, and do that with fomentation so that it is not cold; and now spread of that over the linen which is made thus with the form of leaf of myrrh, and put that over one hole or both; and put under the hole a soft bandage in alum of wool, and let the head of the patient be in its hand.
E pausa le dit sobre le medicina e prem aquela un petit e no la mauguas entro que lo malaute senta la mordicacio de la medicina, quar mordicacio es en lu ayssi cum de foc.	And put it over the medicine and press that one bit and not wound him until the patient feels the bite of the medicine, for bite is in it as if with fire.
E donc cum percevera aquo que el atrobo mordicacio, lahoras leyssa la medicina e mau aquela am le tieu dit; donc cum cessa la mordicacio, lahoras remau la medicina he lava le huel am aygua; e lahoras considera si vezes la palpebra ja es levada ayssi cum es lavada deves la costriccio am foc o am incisio, quar lahoras esta be; e si no torna sobre aquela de la medicina sobre le loc en le qual no ha empremut la medicina e no se denigra entro que sia engualhada la tua operacio e sia contrayt le huel.	And therefore when you perceive that the hole is bitten, then look at the medicine and take it away with your hand; therefore when the bite ceases, then remove the medicine and wash the hole with water; and now consider if he sees the eyelid already lifted as it is washed after constriction with fire or with incision, for then let it be; and if he returns to that of the medicine over the location in which the medicine has not acted and not become black until its action is done and is contracted.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eradicada la codena de la adhustio, e aprop cura aquel am enguent deafinicon o am autre entro que sia sanat.	And now put over it a bandage with linen until the collar bone of the constriction is healed, and now heal that with ointment dafinicon or other until it is healed.
E es necessari a tu, deves la tua operacio que guardes am pervigil diligencia que en le huel no caia re de la medicina, e si la palpebre aprop alscus dias es mollificada e alcuna causa dels pels punh en le huel, lahoras itera la tua medicina sobre aquel loc le qual de la palpebre es mollificat, e propriamen ayssi quo as fayt al comensament, e aprop enaviro lu entro que sia sanat.	And it is necessary for you, in your operation, to guard with diligent vigilance that nothing of the medicine falls into the eye, and if the eyelid becomes swollen after a few days due to some injury from hair in the eye, then apply your medicine again to the place where the eyelid is swollen, and proceed exactly as you did at the beginning, and gradually improve until it is healed.
E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	And this is the form of the myrrh poultice.
E sapias que les huels dels homes son diversificatz segon la magnitut e la parvitat, e donc segon aquo es fayta la tua contraccio.	And know that men's eyes are diverse according to their size and smallness, and therefore your incision should be made accordingly.
E no sira amaguada la via de rectetut ad aquel al qual es studi en aquesta art.	And do not hide the path of rectitude from him who is being taught this art.
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter .xvii.
De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	Of cauterization for a fistula that is in the tear duct of the eye.
Quan tu curas fistula am aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquela segon aquesta manieyra: comanda al malaute que pause le cap sieu en le tieu se, e tengua le cap de lu alcun ministre entre las tieuas mas en tal manieyra que no sia maugut ni agitat am le sieu cap.	When you are treating a fistula as we have said in the divisions of diseases and do not perform your cure, then know that you should cauterize it according to this manner: order the patient to rest his head in your lap, and have someone else hold his head steady with their hands so that his head is neither moved nor shaken.
E aprop pausa coto enfus en album de huou o en mucellage de ptilli sobre le huel de lu.	Then place a piece of cotton wool soaked in honey or in the mucilage of psyllium over the patient's eye.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	And heat the cautery, of which this is the form:
le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.	which should be hollow, thus in the shape of a cane or of an owl' s feather, from one end of which the cautery is made.
E si voys, sia penetrant entro a la autra extremitat.	And if you wish, it may be solid all the way through to the other end.
E si vols sia sort ayssi cum tenta.	And if you want it to be hollow inside, then make it thus with an opening.
Mays empero aquel que es concau es milhor a la tieua obra.	However, what is hollow is better for your work.
E aprop prem la fistula si es uberta, e tra de lu sania et exsicca aquela.	And press the fistula if it is open, and draw out from it pus and fluid to dry up that place.
E si no es uberta, lahoras obre aquela e extratz la poyredura de lu.	And if it is not open, then open it and extract the matter from it.
E aprop pausa sobre lu le cauteri le qual sia be ignit, e te am aquel la tieua ma un petit deves le cauteri del huel a la partida del nas, per so que no erre la tua ma o le malaute sia enquietat, e lahoras pausa le cauteri en le grays del huel e corrompas aquel.	And then place the cautery which should be well ignited, and hold your hand close to the cautery near the nose, so that your hand does not shake or the patient be disturbed, and then apply the cautery to the margin of the eye and corrupt it there.
E donc si al comensament del tieu cauteri perve entro al os, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera le cauteri una veguada o dos, si mestiers era; e layssa aquel ayssi per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre aquel coto am boder e enviro lu am enguent exsiccatiu entro que sia sanat.	And so if at the beginning of your cautery it penetrates into the bone, that is good; and if not, then repeat the cautery once or twice if necessary, and leave it thus for three days, and then place over that place cotton wool and wrap it up with a bandage until it is healed.
Mays si eran passatz xi dias e no es sanat, lahoras pausa sobre lu medicina aguda corrosiva entro que l’os sia descubert e sia ras segon que conveneys en le sieu capitol.	But if eleven days have passed and it is not healed, then apply to it a sharp corrosive medicine until the bone is exposed and scrape it according to what is appropriate in that chapter.
E es autra manieyra de cauteri de fistula la qual alscus primiers diysero: enten al loc de la fistula e fen aquela e aprop pausa en aquela fissura camaen subtil del qual es la forma de lu: E fon en aquela la quantitat de i unc de plom fundut; e te la tua ma am camaem am bona retencio, e no sia maugut le malaute per so que le plom fundut no pervengua al huel de aquel; e cove que pausas sobre le huel del malaute coto enfus en album de huou o en aygua, quar plom adhureys le loc de la fistula e sana aquela per sanacio meravilhora.	And there is another manner of cautery for a fistula which some first mentioned: enter the fistula and open it up, and then place in that fissure fine lead subtilely formed thus: melt the lead and pour it into the eye; hold your hand steady with good retention so that the patient is not disturbed by the molten lead entering the eye, and see to it that you apply over the eye cotton wool soaked in honey or water, for the lead adheres to the place of the fistula and heals it by a marvelously wonderful cure.
E si la fistula es sanada am aquo que havem dit del cauteri e de la curacio, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari aministrar trauc del nas e reduzir la fistula al cors del nas segon que vindra en son loc propri.	And if the fistula is healed with what we have said about the cautery and the cure, that is good; and if not, then it is necessary to administer a cut to the nose and reduce the fistula into the cavity of the nose according to its proper location.
Capitol .xviii.	Chapter .xviii.
De cauterizacio de la fendedura des potz.	Of cauterization for a split nostril.
Motas veguadas accideysso fissuras en las labias, e majorment en las labias dels enfantz.	Many times cracks occur in the lips, and more often in children.
Donc cum tu curas aquelas fissuras am aquo que nos havem dit en las divisios e no aprofieyta la tua cura, lahoras igneys le cauteri petit cutellar segon aquesta forma que s’ensiec:	Therefore when you cure those cracks with what we have said in the divisions and your cure is not effective, then heat the cautery like a small knife thus:
E sia la conquavitat de lu segon la subtilitat de cotella.	And its hollow should be according to the thinness of the blade.
Aprop pausa aquel init cuytadament en aquelas fissuras entro que·l cauteri pervengua al preon de las fissuras.	Then place that edge carefully into those cracks until the cautery penetrates the edges of the crack.
E aprop cura aquel am cerotz entro que sia sanat.	And then cure it with wax until it is healed.
Capitol .xix.	Chapter .xix.
De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.	Of cauterization for a fistula in the mouth.
Quan en la razit de uvula o en le paladar o en las razitz de las dentz endeve apostema e aprop fa brac, e aprop es rompuda, e aprop es antiquada, e corr brac e es fayta fistula, e aprop tu curas aquela e no aprofieyta a curacio, lahoras cove que tu igniscas cauteri segon la quantitat que sia receubuda en la fistula, e aprop met aquel ignit en le trauc de la fistola, e te la tua ma entro que pervengua le ferr ignit al preon de lu, e al derier de lu fazen aysso una veguada o dos; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que nos havem dit de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	When in the root of the uvula or in the palate or in the roots of the teeth there is a boil and it has burst, and it is aged, and suppurates and there is a fistula, and you cure it and your cure is not effective, then know that you should ignite the cautery according to the amount received in the fistula, and then place the iron hot into the opening of the fistula, and hold your hand so that the hot iron penetrates the root of it; do this once or twice, and cure it with what we have said about the cure until it is healed.
E donc si la sania es abscindita e es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari de descubrir le loc e hostar le os corrumput segon que vindra en son capitol.	And so if the pus is discharged and it is healed, that is good; and if not, then it is necessary to expose the location and scrape away the corrupted bone according to what comes in that chapter.
Capitol .xx.	Chapter .xx.
De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.	Of cauterization of teeth and of softening of gums.
Quan las angivas son mollificadas per humiditat e las dentz son maugudas, e curas aquelas am medicinas e no confereys, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra aprop aysso, enayssi que tu pauses la quanula sobre la dent e entromet en aquela le cauteri ignit festinantment, e te la tieua ma un petit entro que·l malaute cente la calor del foc a la razit de la dent esser pervenguda.	When the gums are softened by moisture and the teeth are shaken, and you cure them with medicines and your cure is not effective, then order the patient to rest his head in your lap, and heat the cautery, of which the form will come immediately below, so that you place the cotton wool over the tooth and push into it the hot cautery quickly, and hold your hand close so that the patient feels the heat of the fire at the root of the tooth from which it came.
E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.	And then raise your hand, and repeat the cautery several times according to what you wish.
E aprop le malaute huompla la sua boca de aygua de sal e tengua aquela per una hora, e pueys stupa aquela, quar la dent mauguda es fermada e la gengiva mollificada es strenguda e la humiditat corrompuda es exsiccada.	And then let the patient rinse his mouth with salt water and hold it for an hour, and then spit it out, because the shaken tooth is strengthened, and the softened gum is hardened, and the corrupted moisture is dried up.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter .xxi.
De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	Of cauterization for toothache.
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc.	When toothache is caused by coldness, or it is cold or red, or the cure with medicine is not effective, then the cautery is in two ways: with a cow' s lard, or with fire.
Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	The cautery with lard is that you take lard of cows and melt it in the hollow of iron, and then take cotton wool and wrap it around the end of the tooth, and then dip that in the hot lard and place it on the painful tooth until it is numbed.
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	And then repeat that several times until the power of the fire penetrates to the root of the tooth.
E si voys, submergeys lana o coto en le boder desus dit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolent, e pausa sobre aquel ferr ignit entro que·l ferr pervengua al preon de la conquavitat de la dent.	And if you wish, dip wool or cotton in the lard and place it on the painful tooth, and hold over that hot iron until the iron penetrates the cavity of the tooth.
Mays empero la cauterizacio am foc es que tu atendas a la quannula de eram o de ferr, e sia en le cor de lu alcuna grocesa e la acuitat del foc no pervengua a la boca del malaute.	However, the cautery with fire is that you take an iron or needle and heat it in the fire until it is red hot, and there is no thickness in it and the keenness of the fire does not penetrate the mouth of the patient.
E aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra, e pausa aquel sobre la dent e te la tua ma entro que·l cauteri sia enfregidat; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas quar la dolor sira remauguda o en aquel dia o en l’autre dia.	Then heat the cautery thus, and place it on the tooth and hold your hand so that the cautery is numbing; do this several times because the pain will be reduced or in that day or the next day.
E cove que per empressio de aquel cauteri que·l malaute umpla la sieua boca de bon boder e tengua aquel per una hora e aprop scupa le; e aquesta es la forma del cauteri.	And know that by pressure of that cautery that the patient fills his mouth with good breath and holds it for an hour, and then spits it out; this is the manner of the cautery.
E cauteriza am qual que tu voys extremittat segon que a tu es possible.	And cauterize it as much as you can.
E aquesta es la forma de la cannula:	And this is the shape of the tube:
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter .XXII.
De cauterizacio de extrophulos.	Of cauterization of hernia.
Quan extrophulos so de flecma e de humors fregas e no so hobedientz a digistio per medicinas e tu voys la digistio de aquelas leugerament, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri conquau la forma del qual es aquesta seguen, havent dos extremitatz hubertas per que yesca le fum deves le cauteri per l’autra extremitat, e pausa aquel ignit sobre aquel apostema una veguada, e autre si indigeyses de aquel, entro que pervengua al preon del apostema.	When hernias are from phlegm and cold humors, and are not cured by digestion with medicines, and you see that those are lightly digested, then you should burn the cautery as much as possible, having two ends so that the smoke of the cautery rises through one end into the hernia, and the other if it is needed for that, while you wait until the hernia comes to the surface.
E si l’apostema es pauca, lahoras pausa le cauteri segon la quantitat del apostema, e aprop leyssa le per tres jorns e pausa sobre lu coto enfus en boder entro que sia remaugut aquo que·l foc ha comburit.	And if the hernia is small, then apply the cautery according to the amount of the hernia, and let it sit for three days, and place a bandage soaked in hot water over it while it is still warm from the fire.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent e tentas e draps entro que sia sanat.	And then cure that with ointment, poultices and linen until it is healed.
E la forma de la cannula o deu cauteri a tal es comveyter.	And the shape of the tube or cautery must be as follows:
Capitol .xxiii.	Chapter .XXIII.
De cauterizacio de rauquiera de votz e de constriccio de ale.	Of cauterization of sore throat and of contraction of the larynx.
Quan las humiditatz veno sobre le quanal del pulmo, e majorment quan aquo es am fregiditat de compleccio, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia evacuat al comensament am medicinas laxativas, e aprop cauteriza aquel deves la razit del golayro en le loc depremegut.
