Mays si aquo endeve ad alcu e no sia le metge present ni medicina, lahoras obre am pausament del dit indic sobre le orrifici de aquela vena ayssi cum havem dit, e entenda a la gran costreccio de lu entro que le sanc sia ostat de la sobirana partida de la plagua, e sobre la arceria le dit no sia remaugut; e de sobre la arceria sia aspergit am aygua frega de mot gran fregiditat entro que·l sanc sia congilat e engrossat; e mays cossire en que ha de cauteri o de medicina necessitat.	But if that happens to anyone and the physician is not present or medicine, then open with your index finger over the orifice of that vein as I have said, and understand at great constriction on him until the blood is stopped from the supreme part of the artery; and on the artery let your finger not be bitten; and from over the artery let it be sprinkled with water rubbed by much rubbing so that the blood becomes congealed and engrossed; and cease doing that only when he needs cautery or medicine.
Comensa la segonda partida.	Begin the second part.
De incisio e perforacio e ventozas e de fleubotomia e de plaguas e de lor semblants.	Of incision and piercing and opening and of phlebotomy and of sores and their likes.
Aquestas son paraulas de Albucazis.	These are the words of Albucasis.
Ja havem dit en le primier capitol tota malautia en la qual cauteri am foc es convenient e am medicina comburent, e las occasios e las causas de lu, e les instrumentz en aquels necessaris am las formas dels cauteris; e he ordenatz les capitols de la subiranetat del cap entro als pes.	We have already said in the first chapter of all diseases in which cautery with fire is convenient and medicine burning, and their occasions and causes, and the instruments in which they are necessary, and we have ordered the chapters from the superficiality of the head to the feet.
E yeu procesire en aquest capitol per aquela meteysa guisa, per que sia alliujat lo querent aquo, lahoras sobre aquo que aura demandat.	And I will proceed in this chapter by that medical way so that it is alleviated for the patient, then on him who has demanded it.
E denant que yeu comense aquo, cove, fils, que aprenguatz que en aquest capitol es per terror aquo que es en le capitol primier de cauterizacio.	And before I begin that, let us understand that in this chapter is for terror that which is in the first chapter of cautery.
E per aquo que cove que sia en lu gran cautela, quar en la operacio la qual es en aquest capitol motas veguadas catz evacuacio la qual es am sanc am le qual esta la vida deves la aspersio de la vena o incisio sobre l’apostema o apercio de exsitura o puracio de la plagua o extraccio de sageta o incizio de peyra e a lor semblantz.	And for that which is in him great caution, for in the operation which is in this chapter many times there is evacuation which is by blood from which life is removed, or by sprinkling of the vein or incision on an abscess or opening of an ulcer or piercing of stone or like things.
E de totz aquels so acompanhatz temor e tremor e en le mas de lor catz la mort.	And all those are accompanied by fear and trembling, and in their legs death comes.
E yeu amonesti vos que sobre vos no caia aquo en le qual es esitacio, quar alcunas veguadas cazo deves vos manieyras de homes am manieyras motas de malautias.	And I admonish you that it does not fall on you in which there is excrementation, for some times by habits of men many diseases happen.
E de lor es alcu que s’irays am la sua malautia e es leugiera deves lu la mort, e aysso per la vehemensia de aquo que troba de sa malautia, e per longuesa de la malautia de lu, e am la malautia es paor la qual significa mort.	And from them there are who go away by their disease and death comes to him, and so by the vehemence of that which finds him of his disease, and by length of his disease, and by disease it is fear which means death.
E de aquels es le qual dona a tu son aver e ditta, tu esperant am aquel sanetat, e la sieua malautia es perniciosa.	And from them is he who gives to you his word and promise, you waiting for that health, and his disease is harmful.
E donc no cove que tu consentas en aquel que ve a vos del qual es aquesta manieyra; e la vostra cautela sia major que covesitat e la vostra rapacitat; e no presumatz alcuna causa sobre aquo sino aprop sciencia certa la qual virifica aquo deves vos, e al qual perve successio lausabla.	And therefore do not consent to him who comes to you in this manner; and your caution be greater than confidence and your rashness; and assume no cause on that unless certain science verifies it for you, and to which follows laudable success.
E usatz en la curacio de totz vostres malautes de pronosticacio e indicacio de lu al qual es salut convertida, quar en aquel es a vos ajutori sobre adquisicio de fama e de memoria, de lausor e de gloria.	And use in the cure of all your diseases of prediction and indication of him to whom is converted health, for in him is your help in acquisition of fame and memory, of praise and glory.
O, filhs, Dieus en vos spire le sieu entendement e no oste a vos direccio e proteccio, quar aquo es en la sua ma.	Oh children, may God guide your understanding and not hide from you direction and protection, for that is in his hand.
E yeu e ordenat aquest capitol distingent per capitols segon que precedit en le capitol de cauteris, de la cura del cap entro als pes, per que sia a vos alleujat aquo que demandatz de aquo e del qual havetz necessitat.	And you have ordered this chapter distinguishing by chapters according to that which preceded in the chapter of cauteries, of the cure of the head into the feet, so that it may be to you lightened what you demanded of that and of which you have necessity.
Capitol primier.	Chapter first:
De la curacio de aygua la qual es contenguda en le cap dels enfantz.	Of the cure of water which is contained in the head of infants.
Sapias que aquesta malautia motas veguadas endeve als enfantz deves le enfantament e quan la noyrissa estrenh le cap del enfant ses livitat.	Know that this sickness many times is due to the nursing and when the nurse squeezes the infant's head it becomes relieved.
E alcunas veguadas endeve per causa amaguada la qual no es saubuda.	And sometimes because of a hidden cause which isn't cleansed.
Mays yeu no vi aquesta malautia sino en les enfantz; e a totz aquels les quals yeu vi se coytec la mort, e per ayssi es a mi vist layssada obra en aquels.	But I have not seen this sickness except in infants; and to all those whom I saw it befell death, and for this reason is to me left working on them.
E yeu e vist que un enfant le cap del qual era d’aygua omplit, e·l cap de lu era totjorn ayssi magnificat entro que ceser no podia sobre si meteys per la grandesa del sieu cap, e mays que la humiditat fe aucmentada entro que foc mort.	And I have seen an infant whose head which was filled with water, and his head always swollen as much that he could not move himself because of the great size of his head, and more than the moisture increased as much that deadly fire.
E aquesta humiditat o es agreguada entre la codena e l’os, o es agreguada dejos le os sobre le ciphac.	And this humidity either is aggregated between the skin and bone, or is aggregated below the bone over the brain.
Quar la operacio en aquel si la humiditat es entre la codena e l’os e le apostema es pauc, lahoras cove que tu fendas en le mieg loc del cap am una fissura en la latitut, e sia la longitut de la fissura cays dos notz entro que corra la humiditat, e aquesta es la forma del spatum:	Because the operation on him if the humidity is between the skin and bone and the pustule is small, then you must make an incision in the middle of the head with a fissure in its breadth, and let the length of the fissure be about two inches so that the humidity may flow, and this is the form of the spatula:
E donc si la humiditat es mays augmentada e l’apostema es major, lahoras son aqui dos fissuras segon aquesta manieyra:	And therefore if the humidity is more increased and the pustule is larger, then there are two fissures according to this manner:
E si la humiditat es dejos le os, senhal de lu es que tu vezes la comissuras del cap ubertas de tota partida e l’aygua es spremuda quan tu compremes aquela am la tieua ma a las partidas dedintz e no es aquo a tu amaguat.	And if the humidity is below the bone, sign of it is that you see the comissures of the head opened and the water is squeezed when you compress it with your hand to those openings, and it isn't hidden from you.
Cove que tu fendas en le mieg loc del cap am tres fissuras segon aquesta manieyra:	So that you make in the middle of the head with three fissures according to this manner:
e aprop la inscizio extratz ne tota la humiditat; e aprop strenh las fissuras am draps e plumassols; e aprop enbroca aquo de sobre am vi e oli entro al quint dia, e aprop deslia le liament e cura la plagua am tentas e enguentz, e strenh le cap am equalitat; e mange le malaute am vianda secca de pauca humiditat entro que·l membre sia confortat e sanat.	and then extract all the humidity from it; and then close the fissures with bandages and plasters; and then anoint over it with wine and oil on the fifth day, and then loosen the ligature and cure the wound with tentwires and ointments, and bind up the head with equability; and feed the patient with dry food of little humidity until the member is comforted and healed.
E es autra manieyra de incisio, que consideras hon apar la magnitut del apostema e la colleccio de l’aygua, quar alcunas veguadas es mays en le occipicii, o en la partida denant, o en la destra, o en la sinistra; e donc aten am la incizio on appar le apostema e la replecio de l’aygua, e fen aquo segon que a tu es miels possible.	And is another manner of incision which consider the appearance of the size of the pustule and the collection of water, for sometimes it is more in the occipital, or in the front part, or in the right, or in the left; and therefore attend to the incision where the pustule appears and the gathering of water, and do this according to what is best possible for you.
Et observa que no inscindas la arteria e endevengua flueys de sanc e mora le malaute per aquel flux de sanc am evacuacio de humiditat.	And observe that you not cut the artery and it would bring forth blood streams and kill the patient through that blood flow with evacuation of humidity.
Capitol .ii.	Chapter ii.
De inscisio de las arterias las quals so aprop las aurelhas, apeladas hilasseysse.	Of incision of the arteries which are near the ears, called hilasseysse.
Capitol segon.	Chapter second.
Quan endeveno ad alcu catars o raumas als huelhs o al pietz, e es antiquat aquo, e no confereys en aquo la curacio de las medicinas, lahoras la deriera curacio en aquest es incizio de aquelas dos arterias.	When due to some catarrh or phlegm to the ears or feet, and it is old, and does not confer in that the cure of the medicines, then the last cure for this is incision of those two arteries.
E donc cove quan tu vols inscidir aquelas que le malaute raza lo sieu cap, e aprop fregua le loc am drap aspre per so que aparan las arcerias, e aprop sia strengut le col del malaute am alcu drap; e aprop considera on polsa la vena; e les locs de quascuna sobre les locs les quals so aprop las aurelhas depremutz, e tant se occultan sino en alcus homes.	And therefore when you want to cut those which the patient's head passes through it, and then rub the place with rough cloth so that the arteries appear, and then bind up the neck of the patient with some cloth; and then consider where pulses the vein, and the places of each upon the places which are near the ears depressed, and as much are hidden except in some men.
E aprop senha sobre la arceria am tenta, e aprop inscideys quascuna am le spatum de quascuna partida agut am inscizio pervenient entro al os, e sia aquo per la latitut del cap.	And then mark upon the artery with a tentwire, and then cut each with the spatula of each part cut through to the bone, and let it be for the breadth of the head.
E si vols, entromet le spatum dejos la arteria e trenqua aquala a las inciden a las partidas desus.	And if you want, insert the spatula below the artery and pierce that to the parts beneath them.
E sia la longitut de la inscizio cays dos ditz ajustatz, quar quan alcuna vena es inscizida le sanc es eyssit am egressio pulsatil, le qual saut deforo per saut frequent.	And let the length of the incision be about two inches and a half, for when some vein is cut the blood flows out with pulsating emission, which leaps forth by frequent leaps.
Mays si la arceria no apareys al cintiment, lahoras cove que tu mesures de la aurelha la quantitat del spazi de tres ditz, e aprop senha am tenta, e fen entro al os.	But if the artery does not appear to the feel, then let you measure from the ear the quantity of the space of three inches and a half, and then mark with tentwire, and do this through to the bone.
E aquo que cove getar del sanc es quantitat de vi unc., e fort leu ne geta de lu mays o mens, e tot aquo es segon la quantitat la qual appareys de la vertut del malaute e de la replecio de la arceria de lu.	And that which should come out of blood is quantity of wine ounce., and strongly it comes out from him more or less, and all this is according to the quantity which appears of the strength of the patient and of the gathering of the artery from him.
E aprop considera la plagua, e donc si reman sobre le os alcuna causa del ciphac, lahoras inscindys aquo per so que no endevengua apostema caut.	And then consider the wound, and therefore if remains on the bone some cause of the brain, then cut it so that it does not bring forth pustule cautery.
E aprop strenh la plagua am plumassols e am liamentz de drap de li, e aprop cura aquela am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And then bind up the wound with plasters and with ligatures of cloth, and then cure it with ointments until it is healed.
Capitol .iii.	Chapter iii.
De extraccio de las arcerias las quals so en las templas.	Of extraction of the arteries which are in the temples.
Quan ad alcu accideys emigranea antiqua o catertz agutz, per humiditatz agrimonials e per qualiditat en les lacertz des templas, o sodo antiqua vehement e semblantz ad aquels, e es medicat am las manieyras de curacio de medicina e aquo no comfereys, lahoras nos hem sproatz en aquestas malautias extraccio de las arcerias en les templas, o cauterizacio de aquelas ayssi cum havem mostrat.	When due to some happens emigration ancient or catarrh gotten because of humidities phlegmy and for quality in the lacerts from the temples, or gout ancient violent and similar to those, and is medicated with the manners of cure of medicine and that does not confer, then we have shown in these sicknesses extraction of the arteries in the temples, or cautery of them as we thus show.
E la manieyra de la operacio e extracio de aquelas es que·l malaute raza les pels les quals son en les templas; e entenda a la arceria apparent en le templar quar ela es a tu mostrada per le sieu pols, e·s occultada sino en paucs homes per vehemencia de freg.	And the manner of the operation and extraction of them is that the patient passes through the temples; and understand to the artery apparent in the temple because it is shown to you by its pulse, and is hidden except in few men by violence of rubbing.
E si a tu es occultada, lahoras le col del malaute sia strengut am alcun drap; e aprop fregua le loc am un drap aspre o evapora le loc am aygua cauda entro que aparesca a tu la arceria manifestament.	And if it is hidden to you, then the neck of the patient be bound up with some cloth, and then rub the place with rough cloth or evaporate the place with hot water until you appear to you the artery evidently.
E lahoras tu pren le spatum del qual aquesta es la forma:	And then you take the spatula of which this is the form:
E aprop tu scorja la codena am aquel am facilitat entro que pervenguas a la arceria; e aprop geta en lu onti e extratz aquela a las partidas sobiranas entro que extraguas aquela de la codena e descobras aquela de las tunicas las quals so dejos aquela, de tota partida.	And then you scorch the skin with it with facility until you come to the artery; and then you go on it gently and extract it from the parts uppermost as you have extracted it from the skin and discovered those of the tunics which are below that, all over the part.
Mays si la arteria es subtil, lahoras envolveys aquela am la extremitat del oncii, e aprop inscindeys de aquela una partida segon la quantitat per la qual sian alonguadas las extremitatz de lu e sian contraytas, e no endevindra flux de sanc, quar si no so inscididas no pujara le sanc de tot.	But if the artery is slender, then wrap that with the extremity of the needle, and then cut from it one part according to the quantity for which are drawn out the extremities of him and are contracted, and no blood will flow, for if not are cut they would not drive away the blood at all.
E aprop evacua del sanc de vi unc. entro a tres.	And then evacuate the blood with wine ounce. in three.
E si la arceria es gran, lahoras cove que tu lies aquela en dos locs am fiel dopble fort de ceda o am cordas a lonc, e no coyte a lu putrefaccio denant la consolidacio de la plagua e endevengua flux de sanc.	And if the artery is great, then let you ligature that in two places with strong thread of linen or with cords long, and do not cut him putrefaction before the solidification of the wound and bring forth flow of blood.
E aprop incideys la superfluitat la qual es entre dos liamentz; e fay aquo en aquela hora o aprop autra ora.	And then cut the superfluity which is between two ligatures, and do this in that hour or another hour.
E si vols, cauteriza aquela am cauteri entro al os am cauteri cutellar entro que sian incididas las extramitatz de lu, e stara en loc de aquela meteyssa obra.	And if you want, cautery it with cautery within the bone with cautery knife so that they are cut through to the extremities of him, and be in place of that wound done.
E es milhor obra sino que·l malaute aia febre o es de escalfada compleccio; quar cauteri es de aquelas causas que ajudan a las humiditatz finidoras, e donc es milhor en juvament.	And is better work unless the patient has fever or is of heated complexional for cautery is of those causes which aid to the phlegmy humours, and therefore is better in youth.
E cove aprop la extraccio de las arcerias que huomplas le loc de coto antic, e sian pausatz sobre lu polvils decentement fayt, e aprop sia curat am medicinas seccas fazen naysser la carn e am calguas entro que sia sanat.	And here is the first sentence of your text to translate: "E cove aprop la extraccio de las arcerias que huomplas le loc de coto antic, e sian pausatz sobre lu polvils decentement fayt, e apropri sia curat am medicinas seccas fazen naysser la carn e am calguas entro que sia sanat."
E si mentre obres autra veguada endeventa flux de sanc de la arceria, lahora tu te coyta a restrenger aquel sanc, o am cauteri, o que omplas le loc de coto, e strenh la tua ma entro que sia restreyt le sanc.	And if while you are working you see bleeding from the artery, then you should try to restrict that bleeding, either with a cautery, or by plugging the wound and tightening your hand around it until the bleeding stops.
E si deguna causa de aquelas no es a tu present, lahoras pausa le tieu dit sobre le loc entro que·l sanc sia congilat, e enbroca le loc am aygua de vehement fregiditat entro que la acuitat repausa, e sia strengut segon que cove.	And if you don't have any of those available to you, then place your finger on the site of the bleeding and hold it there until the blood congeals. Then use a piece of cold water to stop the pain and tighten the wound up tightly with a bandage.
E aquo que es pus leugier en extraccio de arceria es que tu cauterizes la vena am aquest cauteri haventz dos cotels, pus que tu has senhat les dos locs am tenta, e depausa quascus, mot ignitz, entro que pervenguan al os e inscindan la vena en dos locs, per so que sia elonguat aquo que es entre las extremitatz de lu, quar no son consolidadas de tot am aquest cauteri.	And when you are removing an artery it is best to cauterize the vein with this two-pointed cautery; after you have probed both ends and found that they are not connected, light them both until they are red hot so that as they cool down they will shrink around their edges and close off the part in between.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri:	This is how the cautery should be made:
E sia la acuitat dels dos cotels esemps.	And it should have two equal points.
Mays empero si so mendres acuitat que dos cotels es milhor, quar si so agudas cum dos cotels propera a quascuna freg, e no enscideysso la carn am velocitat.	However if it is sharper than two points, that is better, because when you press the two points into something they will close off the flesh more quickly.
Donc cum en aquels es alcuna grossitut, es tenguda la calor del foc en aquels e la carn es abscindida leugierament.	So if there is any thickness in them, it is necessary for the fire to spread into those parts and cut off the flesh more quickly.
E aquesta obra es milhor en tota obra e pus leugiera.	And this action is better in all actions and the most gentle.
E sia le spazi le qual es entre dos cotels la quantitat de la grossesa del dit.	And it should be the distance between the two points, equal to the thickness of your finger.
Capitol quart.	Chapter four:
De la cura de cors de lagremas agudas e aciduas dels huels.	Of the treatment for acute and acidic wounds in the bowels.
Quan so lagremas aciduas, e es le cors de aquelas venas las quals so sobre le test del cap deforo, e no comfereys en aquo alcuna causa de la curacio de medicina, e vezes la cara del malaute ja enrogesir e sent en le sieu front deambulacio ayssi cum si era deambulacio de formiguas, e·ls huels de aquel so extenuatz, humitz enayssi que ja les pels de lor son conodutz, e las parpelas so scalfadas per la acuitat de las lacrimas, les antics agro mesties en la curacio de aquelas de aquesta operacio, e nompnero aquela curacio am spassa.	When they are acute and acidic wounds, and it is the cause of those veins which appear on the forehead of the head, and there is no use in applying any medical treatment to them, and you see the patient's face turning red and feeling as if it was crawling with ants, and his eyelids become swollen, and his eyes damaged by the intensity of the tears, then the old treatment for these is to apply a poultice.
E es que tu comandas al malaute rayre les pels les quals son en le sieu front, e aprop inscideys en le front tres fissuras engualment distans segon la longitut del front.	And you should command the patient to shave his head, and then cut three gashes in his forehead evenly spaced according to the length of his forehead.
E si’ la longitut de la fissura cays dos ditz: la una fissura sia engualment distant a la longitut del nas en le mieg loc del front, e la segonda segon la longitut un petit del movement dels lacertz les quals so en le lacrimal, e la tersa del autre part.	And if the length of one finger is two fingers: the first cut should be evenly spaced according to the length of the nose in the middle of the forehead, and the second according to the length of a small movement of the tear ducts, and the third from the other side.
E guarda te de la incizio de las arcerias las quals so en dos latz, e elongua la tua ma de la continuacio de amdos las mandibulas.	And be careful to avoid cutting into any arteries that are on either side, and stretch your hand out along the continuation of both jaws.
E si’ l’espazi de quascuna inscizio la quantitat de tres ditz ajustatz.	And if the space between each cut is three fingers length apart.
E si’ a tu una pessa d’espongua apparelhada o draps seccatz motz am les quals exsiccas le sanc.	And if you have a sponge or dry rags that you can use to soak up the blood.
E aprop entremet le spatum de dos agudas extremitatz, del qual aquesta es la forma de la inscisio de lu:	Then insert the sponge between the two acute ends like so, and this is how you should make the cut:
que es de la partida des templas entro a la segonda inscizio.	from the temple towards the second cut.
Exxcorja am aquel tota la codena la qual es entre dos incizios am le ciphac le qual es sobre le os, e aprop fay aquo de la inscizio migera entro a la segonda inscisio.	Scrape away the flesh between the two cuts with a chisel, and then push down on the cut from the middle towards the second cut.
E aprop stratz ne aquest spatum e entromet en la primieyra inscizio autra vetz un autre instrument le qual es apelat cutellar, agut de una part e del autre no agut.	Then press it down and insert another tool called a scalpel, sharp on one side and blunt on the other, into the first cut again.
E pausa le latz de aquel agut deves la carn annexa deves la codena, e le latz de lu leon dintz le os, e empelley aquel entro que pervengua a la fissura migera, e abscindeys am aquel totz les vaysels que descendo del cap als huels.	And hold the sharp side against the flesh attached to the bone, and the blunt side against the bone, and push it down so that it reaches the middle cut, and sever with it all the vessels that descend from the head to the bowels.
Mays que sia continuada la inscizio ad aquo appar de la codena, e aprop fay aquo en la fissura migana entro al autra fissura.	But make sure the cut is continued past the bone, and then do the same in the middle cut towards the other cut.
E pus que corr del sanc quantitat engual, exprem les locs de las pessas del sanc congilat.	And when the blood has stopped flowing as much, press out the places where the blood is congealed.
E aprop pausa en quascuna fissura calgua de coto vielh, e pausa sobre aquels polvils enbegutz en vi e oli e vi agre, e vegas que no endevengua apostema caut.	Then insert some old bone into each cut, and put on a poultice made of ground up eggs in wine and oil, so that it does not develop an abscess.
E en le tertz dia deslia le liament e aministra gran enfusio de aygua cauda o tebeza, e aprop cura aquo am enguent bazilicon am oli rozat e autres entro que las plaguas sian sanadas.	On the third day loosen the bandages and give a strong poultice of water or tea, and then treat it with basil oil and other remedies so that the wounds heal.
Capitol .v.	Chapter Five:
De la cura de lagramas per catartz e als huels descendentz de las partidas dedintz del cap.	Of the treatment for wounds with a cautery and to the bowels that descend from the sides of the head.
Quan ad alcu veno catartz agutz e continuantz, e vezes les huels del malaute extenuatz petitz, e ja le reguardament de lor es debelitat, e las palpebras ulceradas e de lor cazo les pels, e en le preon del cap es dolor aguda ledent e extrenutacio consequent, lahoras sapias per aquestz accidentz que las materias e catartz no veno sino de motas venas de las partidas dedintz procedent.	When the cauteries are applied and continue, you see the patient's eyelids become swollen, and their eyes weak and painful, and an intense throbbing pain in the head, then understand from these signs that the matter and cauteries are coming from some small veins that descend from the sides of the head.
E la milhor curacio en aquels es aquesta: que comandes al malaute que raza lo sieu front, e aprop inscideys en aquel una fissura al mieg loc del front, un petit per la latitut (e comensa am la fissura del templar senestre entro al dextre templar; e sia inscisio entro al os; e eslongua la tua ma dels lacertz del templas lesquals son maugutz deves la mastigacio), entro que sia le os descubert.	And the best treatment for these is to command the patient to have his forehead shaved, and then cut a single gash in the middle of his forehead, starting from the left temple and ending at the right temple, so that it reaches the bone, and stretch your hand out along the tear ducts which are swollen because of the chewing.
Exsicca tot le sanc am espongua o am drap secc e aprop repleys entre las doas labias de la fissura am coto vielh o am draps de li.	Soak up all the blood with a sponge or dry rags, and then pack the wound between the two lips of the cut with old bone or lint.
E aprop estrenh desus am polvils enbegutz en vi e oli per so que no endevengua apostema caut.	Then press it down with a poultice made of ground up eggs in wine and oil, so that it does not develop an abscess.
E quan deslias aquo e veses que l’apostema ja es diminuit, lahoras cove que fregua le os entro que comensa en lu nayser carn, e aprop cura aquel am regiment exsiccatiu le qual fassa neysser la carn, ayssi cum si tu prenes de farina de froment dos partidas e de colofania quatre partidas e mescla o, e de lor sia fayt emplastre e sia aministrat en aquestas plaguas a de la carn nativitat.	And when you have removed that and see that the abscess has diminished, then scrape away the bone so that it starts to produce new flesh, and then treat it with an astringent remedy which causes the flesh to shrink, as if you were taking flour from wheat and gum arabic, mixing them together in equal parts, and applying this poultice on the wounds of new flesh.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter Six:
De la cura de aquo que catz en las aurelhas.	Of the treatment for what is cauterized in the ears.
Tota causa que catz en las aurelhas es una de quatre specias, quar o es peyra mineral o causa semblant a peyra, ayssi cum ferr e veyre, o es de planta ayssi cum ceze o fava, o es causa fluxtibla ayssi cum aygua e vi agre e a lor semblantz, o alcuna bestia.	All cauteries to the ears are one of four types; some are made of stone, like iron or vitriol, others from plants like celery or peas, and some are caused by something combustible, like water and wine, and they resemble each other.
E donc quan peyra catz en l’aurelha o autra causa semblant de aquelas causas que no ajustan ne creysso en l’aurelha, e pausa la aurelha al solelh, e si vezes la peyra, lahoras distilla en aquela alcuna causa de oli violat o sizami, e aprop aministra la extraccio de lu, e fay le stornudar am condizi, e oppila las nars deve le aveniment de stornutacio.	And so when a stone cautery is applied to the ear or some other cause that does not form in the ear, and you see the cautery, then hold the ear to the sun, and if it seems hot, then distill something into it made of oil of violets or myrrh, and then apply the extract on it, and make the patient sneeze a few times.
E aprop pausa en le circuit de la aurelha alscunas pessas de drap o lana, e dextendas la aurelha a las partidas desus, quar motas veguadas es foro-getada am aquestas causas.	Then put on the edge of the ear some lint or wool, and stretch out the ear to either side, because many times it is torn by these causes.
E si no n’es getada, lahoras aministra extraccio de lu am le instrument apelat gesti epicicarios subtil del qual aquesta es la forma:	And if it has not been torn, then apply an extract to the cautery with a tool called a very fine curved needle; this is how it should be made:
E si es foro-getada am gesti, bo es; e sino, lahoras aministra la extraccio de lu am onci subtil de pauca duplicacio.	And if it has been torn with a needle, then it is; and if not, then apply the extract to it with a very fine hooked needle.
E donc si no es foro-getada per aquo, lahoras fay una canula de aram e entromet la extremitat de la canula en le trauc de la aurelha e claus a l’enviro de la canula am cera e am oli mollificada per so que no sia ubert sino la canula.	And if it has not been torn by that, then make a tube of wire and insert the end of the tube into the hole of the ear, and close up the opening of the tube with wax and warm oil so that there is no discharge except through the tube.
E aprop extratz am le tieu vent am fort atraccio, quar tropas veguadas cum aquo que havem recontat.	And then pull out your breath with strong suction as you have seen with us.
Mays si no es foro-getada en aquesta manieyra, lahoras pren de halka alumbat o de vecz aparelhat am le qual son preses les ausels una patita quantitat, e pausa aquel en la extremitat de ray, e aprop envolopa sobre aquel coto decentment pausat.	But if it is not removed in this manner, then take a little bit of lit charcoal or a burning brand and place it at the end of the bone and then wrap a bandage decently over that spot.
E aprop entromet aquel en le trauc de la aurelha am facilitat, e aprop excicca la aurelha de la humiditat.	Then insert it into the hole in the ear with ease, and dry the ear of its moisture.
E donc si no es foro-getada am totas las causas las quals havem recontadas, lahoras tu coyta a talhar aquela denant que endevengua apostema caut o espasme.	And if it is not removed with all the causes that we have recounted, then you must cut it before it becomes an abscess or ulcer.
E la manieyra de talhar aquela es que tu al comensament sancnes le malaute de la vena sephasica e extratz del sanc segon la mannieyra de la vertut de lu, e aprop fay aquel cezer entre las tuas mas e converteys l’aurelha a las partidas desus, e fen am petita fissura en la razit de la aurelha deves lo greys de lu en le loc be premegut de lu.	And the way to cut it is that you first numb the patient's ear with wine and then draw out the blood according to his condition, and then fold the ear between your fingers and turn it upwards, and make a small hole at the root of the ear above its gray part in the spot that has been well pinched.
E sia la fissura de figura lunar entro que pervengua a la peyra, e, la peyra atrobada, osta aquela si podes am instrumentz apropriatz; e aprop cos la fissura en aquela hora am velocitat, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And the hole should be moon-shaped so that it reaches the stone; and when you have found the stone, remove it if you can with appropriate instruments; and then close the hole quickly, and heal it until it is well.
E si la causa cazent en la aurelha es un dels gras que creysso e so inflatz, lahoras aministra la curacio e la extraccio de lu; mays si no obezeys a tu ad eyssiment, lahoras tu pren spatum teune subtil segon aquesta forma:	And if the cause of the ear is one of the fats that have grown and become inflamed, then administer treatment and remove it; but if it does not obey your treatment, then take a thin spatulum according to this shape:
e aministra am aquel la abscizio de aquel gra lo qual es cazut en l’aurelha.	and use it to perform the incision of that fat which has grown in the ear.
E no fassas aquo quan cogitas que aquel ja es humectat per la vapor del aurelha, e pausa aquel en motas pessas, e prop extratz ne aquelas am les oncis o am gesti subtil, o ab inscizio ayssi co dit havem, quar es alleujada la extraccio de lu.	And do not do this when you think that it is already moistened by the vapor of the ear, and place it in a little bit, and then pull it out with pincers or with a thin instrument, or with an incision as we have said, for it is easier to remove it.
Mays en l’aygua la qual es intrada en l’aurelha cove que·l malaute use de sternutacio am condizi al comensament, e omple la sieua aurelha am alcu coto vielh, e jagua sobre aquela aurelha en la qual es l’aygua, e si per aquo es foro-getada, bo es; e sino, lahoras pren tropas peyras teunas e leons segon la longitut del dit, e calfa aquelas en le foc un pauc, e le pacient entrometa una de aquelas en le trauc de la sua aurelha e saute sobre la un pe sieu de aquela partida e percussia am una autra peyra sobre la peyra la qual es dintz la aurelha.	But in the water that has entered the ear if the patient uses a sneeze at the beginning, and fills his ear with an old cloth, and then spits over the ear where the water is, and if it is removed by this, it is good; but if not, then take some thin stones according to the length of your finger, heat them in the fire for a little, and let the patient insert one of these into the hole of his ear and suck with another stone over the stone that is inside the ear.
Donc no cesse aquo am peyra entro que tota l’aygua sia foro-getada.	So do not stop this until all the water is removed.
E ja l’aygua sira foro-getada enayssi que tu prenguas de papier o de gonc .i., e met la una extremetat de lu en l’aurelha e estendas l’autre extremitat am foc entro que sia comburit le may de lu.	And when the water is completely gone, take some paper or a piece of cloth, and insert one end of it into the ear and extend the other end with fire until its middle is burned.
E prop met i autre gonc e fay aquo tantas veguadas entro que tota l’aygua sia foro-getada, e stratz aquel am canula ayssi co desus es dit de la peyra extrasadora.	Then insert another piece of cloth and do this as many times as necessary until all the water is removed; and then use the straw as we have said with the stone extractor.
Mays en la extraccio de bestia intrant en aquela aurelha, si es a petit cos, ayssi piussa e a lu semblant, cura aquel ayssi cum havem dit en la divisio; mays si es de gran cos la qual causa apar al sen del vezement, lahoras aministra la extraccio de lu am gesti e oncis, e la causa de lu es pus leugiera de totas las autras causas que cazo en l’aurelha.	But in the extraction of a bee that has entered the ear, if it is small like a fly and similar to it, treat it as we have said in the division; but if it is a large thing whose cause appears in the membrane of the ear, then administer its removal with instruments and pincers, and the cause of it is usually pus from all the other causes that affect the ear.
Mays en la extraccio de verm engendrat en la aurelha, quan tu curas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e en le tractat de distillacios e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu reguardes la aurelha al solelh.	But in the extraction of a worm that has grown in the ear, when you treat it as we have said in the division and in the treatment of distillation, and your treatment does not succeed, then see that you examine the ear in the sunlight.
E donc si apar aqui alcuna causa dels verms, lahoras extratz aquel am gesti o am onci subtils, mays si no apar deguna causa, lahoras pren una canula dejos streyta e desus ampla de la qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And so if you see there any cause of the worms, then pull it out with instruments or with fine pincers; but if you see no cause, then take a straw which is narrow below and broad above, and whose shape is as follows:
E entromet la extremitat subtil en la aurelha segon la quantitat la qual suffertar puesca le malaute; e aprop sucgeys am aquela per succio fort, e fay aquo motas veguadas, entro que totz les verms sian foro-gitatz.	And insert the narrow end into the ear according to the amount that the patient can endure; and then suck it out with a strong suction, and do this many times until all the worms are removed.
Mays si no obezeysso a tu al ayssiment, lahoras tu opila e claus en le circuit de la canula am cera ayssi cum havem dit; lahoras aministre distillacios las quals han ja esproadas les antics en la curacio dels verms, e atrobaras aquo en le tractat de distillacios.	But if it does not obey your treatment, then stop up the hole around the straw with wax as we have said; then administer distillation as the ancients have practiced in the treatment of worms, and you will find this in the treatment of distillation.
E sia la tua efusio am la qual efundas les olis medicinas en la aurelha am aquest strument del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And your effusion with which you pour the medicinal oils into the ear is done with this instrument of which the shape is as follows:
E fay aquela de argent o de eram, dejos streyt, en le qual sia un petit trauc, e am pla desus.	And make it of silver or brass, narrow below and broad above, with a small hole in it, and flat on top.
E donc sia cum empellent a que es en la conquavitat de la canula de continent aqui on sira necessari.	And so be careful that it is in the cavity of the straw, where it will be necessary.
E si vols, pren le ray e envolveys en la extremitat de lu decentment coto, e aprop gieta oli en la concavitat del auziment, o suc de alcuna herba, o aquo que vols de aquestas medicinas en la canula — e aquela es en la aurelha —, e aprop entromet le ray am coto desus e exprem am la tua ma aquel am compressio temprada de lu entro que l’oli sia expellit en la concavitat del auziment e le malaute senta le oli dedintz.	And if you wish, take the rod and wrap it decently at its end, and then pour oil into the cavity of the straw or suck in some herb, or whatever medicine from these into the straw — and that is in the ear —, and then insert the rod with a grip above and squeeze it with your hand until the oil is expelled into the cavity of the straw and the patient feels the oil within him.
E aquo que sia enfundut en la aurelha sia ja scalfat am foc un petit.	And what has been poured into the ear has already been warmed by fire a little.
E guarda te que la causa la qual distillaras en l’aurelha no sia trop frega, quar las medicinas de aurelha no suffertan aquo.	And be careful that the cause which you distill in the ear is not too hot, for ear medicines do not endure that.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter 7.
De curacio de opilacio de aurelhas.	Of the treatment of pain in the ears.
Alcunas veguadas alcus enfantz yeysso dels ventres de lors mayres no-perforatz, e aquo ja accideys en alcus homes, opilacio en le meat de la aurelha per plagua o per carn nada en aquela; e aquesta opilacio alcunas veguadas es fayta en le preon del trau de la aurelha la qual no consiec le vezement, e alcunas veguadas es en las partidas defora.	Many times some children suck from their mothers' bellies and do not pierce them, and this happens in some men as well, with pain in the middle of the ear due to cold or due to a wound in that part; and this pain is sometimes caused by an obstacle in the hole of the ear, and sometimes it is in the outer parts.
E aquela que accideys en le preon de lu, la qual no comprehen le vezement, es en las majors disposicios de dificil sanacio.	And that which happens in the middle, which does not affect the membrane, is in the more difficult dispositions to heal.
E en aquela en qual consegueys le vezement, cove que tu pauses la aurelha del malaute al solelh e reguarda en aquela.	And when you have achieved the membrane, see that you hold the ear towards the sun and examine it.
E donc si vezes oppulacio apparent, obre aquela am espatum subtil del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And so if you see obvious swelling, open it with a thin spatula of which this is the shape:
Si’ la extremitat de lu en la qual sia petita la latitut, del qual la una partida sia aguda e l’autra no; e le spatum sia de dos latz leon per so que no fassa lizio al aurelha.	If its end is narrow where the width is small, and one side is pointed and the other is not; and the spatula should be of two edges so that it does not injure the ear.
E donc si la opilacio es per carn nascuda en la aurelha o en le meat de lu, lahoras te aquela am oncis subtils e incidiys aquela vehement facilitat entro que sia ostada tota la carn.	And if the pain is due to a wound born in the ear or in its middle, then open it with fine pincers and cut it fiercely until it is entirely exposed.
E si opilacio es en le preon de la aurelha, lahoras pren ray subtil leon e escalfa aquel am foc un pauc, e aprop met aquel en le meat de l’aurelha.	And if the pain is in the hole of the ear, then take a thin rod and heat it in the fire for a little, and then insert it into the middle of the ear.
E donc si as scentit oppulacio am aquo que le malaute atroba am facilitat, per gravetat de ausir, esforsa la oppressio de lu am facilitat; e guarda te que no plagues les nervis del aurelha.	And so if you have felt swelling with ease due to an obstruction, release the pressure of it with ease; and be careful not to injure the nerves of the ear.
E aprop pausa en l’aurelha drap de li segon la quantitat del ample del trauc lo qual tu as envolvutz en l’enguent egipciac; e fay aquo per alcus jorns entro que sias segur de la consolidacio de la plagua; o que prenguas qualgua e enfon aquela en ayguaros e pulveriza sobre lu segi trissat e usa de lu; e si vezes la aurelha ja esser apostemada, lahoras cove que tu estraguas la qualgua e permutes aquela am autra qualgua la qual tu envoloparas en cerot que sia fayt am oli rozat, entro que sia le apostema caut cedat; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then place over the ear a bandage according to the amount of the width of the wound which you have wrapped around it; and do this for several days until you are certain of the healing of the wound; or take some cotton wool and soak it in vinegar and powder it with ground pepper and use it; and if you see that the ear is already swollen, then remove the cotton wool and replace it with another one which you have soaked in rose oil, until the ulcerated part has healed; and then treat it until it is well.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc, lahoras submergeys esponga o drap en aygua frega e pausa sobre la aurelha, e usa del autra curacio la qual restrengeys le flux del sanc, la qual es dita en le tractat de distillacio.	If there is bleeding, then soak a sponge or cloth in water and place it on the wound, and use the other treatment which restricts the flow of blood, which is described in the treatise on distillation.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter VIII.
De cura de athezil le qual endeveno a las palpebras.	On the treatment of Athaizeel, which extends to the eyelids.
Athezil les quals endeveno a las paupebras dels huels alcuna veguada so humitz, alscunas veguadas son secs.	Athaizeel, which affects the eyelids of some people with moisture, and others with dryness.
Donc cove que tu tenguas aquels am tenhalhas o am onci, e inscindas aquels am espatum de las suas razitz, e aprop pausa sobre les locs segi trissat.	Therefore, if you have them, take the am tenhalhas or am onci, and cut off their branches from the roots, and place it over the affected areas after crushing it.
Mays si dolor am flux de sanc veno, lahoras tu cauteriza aquels am cauteri lanticular subtil.	But if there is pain with bleeding, then you should cauterize it with a very thin anticular cautery.
E la milhor cauterizacio es aprop las inscizios e tropas veguadas retornam quan reman alcuna causa de sas razitz; e quan so cauterizadas am foc, aquelas razitz son comburidas e no retornan.	And the best cauterization is to cut and pull them out from their roots, and when they are cauterized with fire, those roots are burned and do not return.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter IX.
Cura de grandeyssa que veno a las palpebras dels huels.	On the treatment of grandeyssa that affects the eyelids of men.
Motas veguadas endeve en las palpebras dels huels alcuna causa la qual es asemblada a grandissa en sa fortalicia e duricia, e per so grandissia es apelada.	In many cases it occurs in the eyelids of men for some reason which is similar to grandissia in its strength and hardness, and because of this it is called grandeyssa.
E es agreguacio de humiditat grossa en la palpebra dejos e desus.	And it is an accumulation of thick humidity under and above the eyelid.
Donc la opperacio en lor es que consideras lahoras si la grandissia es procedent en lu en aquo que apar de la palpebra e es mauguda a tota partida; e la causa de lu es leugiera.	Therefore, the treatment for them is that one should consider whether the grandissia is proceeding from something appearing on the eyelid and spread all over it; and the cause of this is leukemia.
Donc fen sobre aquela am fissura per la latitut, e aprop escorga aquela de tota partida am facilitat entro que evasesca, e aprop suspen aquela am onci e abscindeys aquela.	Therefore, cut a slit in it according to its width, and then dig out all of it with ease so that it comes out, and then suspend it with am onci and cut it off.
Mays si a tu no es apparelhada la incizio de lu si no pus que penetras la palpebra am inscizio pauc a pauc, lahoras aquo no notz en deguna causa.	But if the beginning of it is not apparent to you, but only pus that penetrates the eyelid a little at a time, then pay attention to this for any cause.
E si la figura es gran, lahoras tu l’ajusta am sutura; e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And if the wound is large, then you should sew it up; and treat it until it is healed.
E si es pauca, a tu no sobrevindra mal per aquela quar l’anguent de lu restaura aquela e encarna.	And if it is small, you will not suffer from it because the eye restores it and the flesh grows back.
E si la grandissia es declinant a las partidas dedintz de la palpebra deves la superficia dedintz, lahoras evesa la palpebra e suspen la grandissia am onci, otra que tu indigescas de incizio, e prem aquela de tota part, e si la palpebra per inscizio es alonguada, aquo no notz en deguna causa.	And if the grandissia is declining towards the inner parts of the eyelid, then cut off the surface within it, and then suspend the grandissia with am onci, another that you should dig out from its roots, and press it from all sides, and if the eyelid is cut open because of this, then it does not matter.
E aprop la incizio, lava le huel am aygua salada; e cura le loc am aquo que encarna entro que sia sanat.	And after the incision, wash the eye with salted water; and treat the wound so that it heals.
Capitol .x.	Chapter X.
De la cura axcirnah en la palpebra desus del huel.	On the treatment of axcirnah above the eyelid.
Axcirnath es grays le qual es engendrat en las tunicas de la palpebra desus, e majorment endeve als enfantz, agrava les huels de aquels et accideyso a lor catartz le mayti; e no podon reguardar la claror del solelh per aquo quar lagremas se coytan ad aquels.	Axcirnah is a disease which affects the membranes of the upper eyelid, and mostly affects children, harming those whose eyes it occurs in, causing them to close their eyes because of it.
E per so tu vezes aquels jaser sobre les lors caras tot temps, e sobre les lors caras dormen; e so a las palpebras de lor dejos les sobrecils humidas, las quals ja ha cuberta imflacio, e iminencia de accernac apparent es en l’uelh; e que quant tu premes le loc am les tieus ditz, tu centes accernac entro aquels.	And because of this, you will see them all the time on their faces, and they sleep with their eyes closed; and the eyelids below are wet, covered in inflammation, and an apparent protuberance is visible on their eyes; and when you press it with your fingers, you feel it inside.
E alcuna manieyra de opperacio es en aquel que le malaute pausa le sieu cap en le tieu se, e aprop pausa drap de li e de lu fay calgua, e fay de lu cercle segon la quantitat la qual contena arthernach de tota partida, e aprop pausa aquel sobre aquela e prem am les tieus ditz de tota per que sia agreguat arcernac en le mieg del cercle, e aprop fen en le mieg de aquela humiditat am spatum inscident am fissura per la latitut, e la fissura no sia major que la fissura que es fayta en flaubotomia.	And one way of treating it is for the patient to place his head in your lap, and then place a cloth on him and make him take a cold bath, and make a circle according to the amount which contains arthernach all around, and then place it over the affected area and press it with your fingers from all sides so that it becomes attached; and then cut out the middle of that humidity with a pointed instrument making an incision according to its width, and the incision should not be larger than the one made in flaubotomia.
Mays en le preon cove que tu fendas la codena tota entro que pervenguas ad arcernach, quar en las mays desposicios proceseys arcernach per fissura segon la forma de grayseza blanca.	But in the case where you split the cord all the way so that it reaches the arcernach, for in most cases the arcernach comes about through an incision according to the shape of white grayness.
Donc extratz aquela am draps los quals tu as envolopatz entre les tieus ditz a las partidas deforo e revolv entre la ma dextra e sinistre entro que sia dispargut.	Therefore, extract it with cloths which you have wrapped between your fingers on the outside and twisted between the right and left hand so that it is dispersed.
E guarda te que no ajustes en la fissura per so que am le spatum no pervenguas al huel e ladescas aquel.	And be careful not to push into the incision with the instrument so that you do not reach the eye and loosen it.
Mays si no apar a tu arternach en le comensament de la fissura, mays que tu ajustes en la fissura un petit am fecilitat entro que procesisca arternach; e aprop extratz aquela ayssi quo havem dit; e aprop submargeys draps de li en aygua e vi agre e pausa les sobre le loc e estrenh aquels am polvils.	But if you do not see arternach at the beginning of the incision, but you push into the incision with ease so that it occurs; and then extract it as we have said before; and then soak the cloths in water and wine and place them over the affected area and press them hard.
E so alcus que trissan sal e pausan aquel en la conquavitat de la fissura per so que aquo que es remas de aquela humiditat.	And so that it is crushed with salt and placed over the cavity of the incision so that what remains of that humidity is removed.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then treat it until it is healed.
Mays si accideys en le loc apostema caut, lahoras cura aquel am emplastres cedatils entro que sia sanat.	But if an abscess occurs on the wound, then treat it with mild poultices until it is healed.
Capitol .xi.	Chapter XI.
De manieyras de tactimi del huel.	On ways of testing the eye.
Quan en las palpebras dels huels so natz pels ajustatz dejos les pels naturals e so antiquatz, lahoras aquels noso al huel e fan endevenir manieras de malautias ayssi cum lacrimas assiduas e mollificacio de palpebras e tela entro que aquo sia causa de destruccio del huel que s’apela tactinir del huel, e cura se en quatre manieyras: o per cauteri am foc; o am medicina acuta segon que denant es dit en le capitol de cauteri; o es fayt atactini per inscizio e sutura; o per cannas segon que yeu diyre.	When the eyelids of men are touched by being pressed down beneath their natural margin and worn out, then these affect the eye and cause ways of destruction of the eye which is called tactinir of the eye, and it is treated in four ways: either by cautery with fire; or by an acute medicine according to what is said before in the chapter on cautery; or tactinir is caused by incision and suturing; or through cannas as the eye doctor says.
E donc cove que tu pauses le cap del malaute en le tieu se; aprop converteys la palpebra del uelh am la tua ma sinistra, e si es convertida, bo es; e sino, entromet agulha en aquela en la qual sia fiel de la partida pus dejos de la palpebra, e fay penetrar la agulha am fiel desus, e aquo sia — prop del marge de la palpebra en le qual naysso les pels — prop dels pels, e tira le fiel a las partidas desus am la palpebra, e converteys aquela am le ray.	And so that you place the patient's head in your lap; and then turn the eyelid of the eye to the left with your left hand, and if it is turned, it is good; but if not, insert a needle into the part where pus is below the eyelid, and let the needle pierce above it, and what is - near the margin of the eyelid in which the hairs are - near the hairs, and pull the fiel towards the upper parts of the eyelid, and turn that to the eye doctor.
E aprop fen en la partida dedintz de la palpebra dejos les pels ajustatz am spatum inscidentz del lacrimal major entro al lacrimal mendre; e aprop extratz le fiel e pausa dejos la palpebra polvilhs petitz de coto o de drap, e aprop senha sobre la palpebra am tenta, e sia ayssi cum figura de fuelha de mirt.	And then cut into the inner part of the eyelid below the hairs with a pointed instrument inserted through the tear gland into the smaller tear gland; and then extract the fiel and place small pieces of cotton or cloth under the eyelid, and then bandage it over the eyelid with a tent, and it should be as if there is a leaf of mirt.
Mays empero cove que sia la figura segon la quantitat de helevacio de la palpebra, quar aquo ja es diversificat en les homes, quar de aquels es le quals indigeys que sia inscidit de la palpebra gran quantitat segon la quantitat per la qual la palpebra es mollificada.	But however, it should be according to the amount of elevation of the eyelid, for that is different in men, for from those there occurs an incision of the eyelid a great quantity according to the amount by which the eyelid is softened.
E aprop fen am le spatum sobre las doas linhas las quals has senhadas, e comensa del lacrimal major entro al lacrimal menor.	And then cut with the instrument over the two lines which you have drawn, and begin from the tear gland into the smaller tear gland.

Capitol .xix.	Chapter 19.
De reduccio de arizati al nas.	Of the reduction of hernia in the nose.
Quan tu curas arisati am cauteri o am medicina aguda comburent segon que es precedida la narracio de lu e no es sanat, lahoras no es engen en lu sino que fendas sobre le apostema deves la maturitat de lu, e que extraguas tota la humiditat la qual es en lu e·l poyre entro que sia descubert le os.	When you cure hernia with cautery or sharp medicine according to how it is preceded in the narrative and it is not healed, then do not leave anything in him but split over the hernia after removing its maturity, and draw out all the moisture which is in him and the pus until the bone is exposed.
E donc cum es descubert le os e vezes en lu corrupcio o negror, lahoras tu ratz lu am un sturment del qual aquesta es la forma:	And therefore when the bone is exposed and you see in it corruption or blackness, then you shall scrape it with an instrument of which this is the form:
E es nompnat de aspre cap, e sia feyt de fer indi, e sia le cap redon ayssi cum asir le qual sia fayt punctat per punctacio de lima o aliskalfati per punctacio subtil (ayssi cum es en la forma seguent). Therefore if the place is consolidated and there is good flesh grown in it and the body has withdrawn from the sania and healed after 40 days, and it is not renewed and there is no hernia and no accident happens to it, then you know that it is healed.

Sia la extramitat de lu ferr triangulada, e·l fust de lu sia prim extenuat entro a la extremitat ayssi cum vezes assi.	Let its outer edge be triangular, and its shank be pressed inward toward the outer edge thus.

And then place that on the bone, and let it be near the tear duct; and lengthen your hand a little from the wound, and then turn your hand with the forceps so that it penetrates all the bone, and he feels the patient through pressure as he tries to stop the wind coming out through him.
Donc lahoras restaura le loc am medicinas stipticas exsiccantz ayssi cum t’e eyssenhat.	Therefore then restore the place with astringent and drying medicines thus as it is described.

Therefore when the flesh and the place are hardened, then the matter which poured out to the sides of the foramen returns into the nose; therefore it is pus that lies heavier on the patient.
Capitol .xx.	Chapter 20.
De reduccio de la eminencia del huel.	Of the reduction of the eminence of a wound.
Quan le huel emineys am la sua totalitat e no accideys en le vezement nocument ni diminuacio, lahoras cove que laxas le malaute, e aprop que·l segues, e aprop que pausas ventozas en le cervitz ses scarificacio e succa per bona succaccio; e aprop pausa sobre le huel liniment le qual sia fayt de acatra e aloe e enses e sarcocolla, e aprop strenh le emplaustre sobre le huel am motz polvils.	When the wound protrudes in its entirety and no harm or diminution happens in the bleeding, then you should lax the patient, and then you should hold him by the neck and suck out with good suction; and then place ventouse on the neck with scarification and sucking with strong suction; and then place liniment which is made of copper scale and aloe and myrrh, and then tighten the dressing over the wound with fine powders.
E la manieyra dels polvils es que prenguas draps de li leons motz, e quascun drap sia duplicat en quatre plecs; e fay de aquels motz.	And the manner of the powders is that you take rags of linen clothes, and each cloth be folded in four folds; and make those into powder.
E aprop pausa aquels la un sobre le autre segon la quantitat de la qual ha le huel necessitat.	And then place those one over the other according to the quantity of which the wound has need.
E aprop strenh sobre aquels am drap dur am fort strictura; e itera las ventosas am succio ses scarificacio; e aprop osta las ventosas e leyssa le huel streyt le dia e la nueyt.	And then tighten over that with a hard cloth with strong compression; and repeat the ventouses with suction without scarification; and then stop the ventouses and let the wound rest day and night.
Mays si entretant le liguament es mollificat, lahoras cove que sia mot streyt.	But if in between the ligament is softened, then you should be made to be tight.
E aprop osta le liament aprop le dia e la nueyt ayssi cum havem dit.	And then stop the ligament then day and night as we have said.
E si vezes le huel ja esser redusit, bo es, e sino, lahoras itera le emplastre am les polvils e la strictura e las ventosas entro que sia sanat.	And if you see the wound already reduced, well and good, and if not, then repeat the dressing with the powders and the compression and the ventouses until it is healed.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter 21.
De la inscizio de la eminencia de la tunica uvea.	Of the incision of the eminence of the tunica uvorea.
Quan endeve disrupcio en la tunica uvea, e aprop es eminent e procezeys fora las palpebras ayssi cum un gra de rasim, e es orrazada la forma de home per aquo, e vols aquo inscidir, lahoras la operacio en lu es ayssi cum havem recomtat, que tu entrometas la agula en la razitz de la uvea de la partida dejos en la partida desus, e aprop met la agula autra en la qual sia fil doble de la part del lacrimal, e fay aquela penetrar e leyssa la primieyra agula segon la sua disposicio; e aprop inscideys le loc del fiel doble e leva am aquel la partida de la uvea en le circuit de la agula, e strenh aquela mot. E aprop extratz la agula e pausa sobre le huel lana infusa en album de huou e leyssa entro que cayha le fil am la uva.	And then pull out the needle and place over the wound wool infused in white vinegar and let it rest until the thread falls down with the uvrea.

Capitol .xxii.	Chapter 22.
De curacio de alconati.	Of the cure of a hernia.
Aquesta malautia que es apelada alconati no es sino sania la qual es ajustada en le huel semblant a aygua dessendent e no es aquela.	This illness which is called alconati is not anything but a wound which is situated in the wound like water descending and is not that.
Mays la manieyra del obrar en ela es que fasses le malaute sezer sobre la sela aparelada e dreyta, e aprop pren le cap sieu en las tuas mas de doas partz e mau aquel entro que veias la sania pervenir a las partidas dejos, e aprop sia siccada e no descenda, e sia ostat le lum, e·l malaute veia las causas ayssi cum vezia.	But the manner of working on it is that you make the patient lean forward over the hard bench and straight, and then take his head in your hands from two parts and hold him thus so that you see the wound coming to the upper parts, and then let it be dried and not descend, and let there be light, and the patient sees the causes thus as he looks.
E si no descendra en jos, sapias que es aygua.	And if it does not go down below, know that it is water.
Mays si no es preparat le descendement a la sania am aquo que havem dit, lahoras fay le malaute sezer entre las tuas mas e aprop pren spatum subtil e fen am aquel sobre le pannicol cernent un petit deves la continuacio de la conjunctiva am la tunica cornea en la corona (entro al loc vuet), entro que sia fora-getada la sania. Capitol .xxii.	Chapter .XXII.
De la curacio de la aygua descendent del huel.	Of the cure of water descending from the hole.
Ja havem dit las specias de la aygua en la divisio e qual conveneys a perforar am sermo declarant, lahoras aquel segon la sanetat.	We have already said the species of water in the division and which it is convenient to pierce with language declaring according to health.
Lahoras cove que tu fassas sezer le malaute entre las tuas mas sobre un cayrat e lia le sieu huel sa, lu mot stringent.	Then you should make the patient sit between their own hands on a chair and open their hole wide, then tie it shut tightly.
E aprop pausa prop de la palpebra del sieu huel la tua ma senestra, si le huel en le qual es l’aygua es le huel senestra; o am la tua ma dreyta, si le huel es le dextre. And then when it is dried and doesn' t descend, then you pull alum out with ease, and rotate your hand little by little around it, and then dissolve in the water a little of clear salt of gemma, and with that wash the eye inside; and then stop the eye outside with cotton or a stop made of lamb's wool infused in rose water and albumen of egg white.
Mays nos e aquels que so de nostre temps pause sobre aquel comi trissat am album de huou.	But us, who are from our time, put it on that combed with albumen of egg white.

E aprop entromet almagda segon que havem dit.	And then put alum in as we have said.
E deves le compliment de la tua obra, sia preparat al malaute dormitori descentment fayt en le qual dorma sobre le sieu dos en mayson tenebrosa, e sia prohibit de totz movementz .	And after you have completed your work, the patient should be prepared for a sleeping descent, in which he sleeps on his back in a dark room, and all movements are prohibited.
E pausa en la natura de lu aquo per que sia linida la sua natura, e no maugua le sieu cap a la partida dreyta ni senestra de tot.	And place in nature for him so that his nature is made smooth, and don't turn his head to the right or left at all.

Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras cove que deslias le huel denant le vii dia, e rectifica aquel am aquo que ceda apostema.	But if pus occurs in the eye, then open the eye on the seventh day and correct it with water that reduces the pus.

Capitol .xxiv.	Chapter .XXIV.
De la curacio de carn nada en le nas.	Of the cure of swollen nose.
Quan en le nas so nascudas carns diversas ajustadas de las quals es alcuna causa la qual es assemblada a scorpio de motz pes, o a polip peys; e aquesta malautia es apelada polipus quar es a semblansa de aquel peys representat. And after that is done, let him breathe in so that it goes into the channels of the nose, and he breathes out over his throat, for troops look like this action do children in schools, and is a distant cause to that which wants to be done.
E aprop pausa las dos extramitatz del fiel, una extremitat que iesca sobre le nas et l’autra que romangua en le nas, e aprop aministra serratura de carn am les nuzes que so en le fiel, e fay aquo entro que sapias que las carn ja so am les nuzes del fiel. E aprop extratz le fiel, e pausa en le nas aprop la abstraccio del sanc una calgua , e fay aquo per tres dias o mays entro que l’enguent corrodo tot aquo que es romas de las carns.	Then extract the gallbladder and in the nose apply an abstraction of blood with a cautery, and do this for three days or more until the cautery has corroded all that is rotten in the flesh.
E aprop en la fi de la causa, pausa en le nas una canula de plom per alscus jorns entro que sia sanat.	And at the end of the cause, insert a lead cane into the nose for several days until it is healed.
Mays si endigeys de curacio que exsique, usa de aquela.	But if you have a more effective cure, use that instead.
E aquesta es la forma del instrument a capipurge fazedor am le qual son distillatz olis e medicinas en le nars:	And this is the form of the instrument for an emetic that draws oils and medicines into the nose:
E fay aquo de argent o de eram, la qual sia semblant a una petita lampesa uberta, ayssi cum petita conqua, e le meat semblantment.	And do this with silver or brass, which should be similar to a small lamp, also with a small cavity and the spout similarly.
E si vols, fay una canula clausa ayssi cum cana, e la cancula del estrument a capipurge fazedor e sia plana, descuberta; a la qual sia manubre en lo derier de lu, am le qual tenguas aquela quan escaufas en lu oli o aquo que tu vols dels sucs e de las causas suctiblas.	And if you want, make a closed tube like a cane, and the spout of the emetic instrument should be flat and uncovered; it should have a handle at its rear end, with which you can draw oils or waters that you want from suckable fluids and causes.
E aquestz capipurgi es precios: recipe de enforbi de castor, de balayra blanc, de giengiebre, e piletre de safra, de pebre lonc, de escafragia, de epetum de spic ana unc. vi cumfizeys am suc de bleda e de caul, e sian faytas pillulas, e sia destemprada una pillula am aygua tebeza, e sia gitat en las nars del malaute jasent envers.	And these emetics are precious: take from beaver testicles, white balsam, ginger, long pepper, scammony, asafetida, spikenard in powder a drachm each. Take them with juice of dandelions and cabbage, and let the pills be made, and one pill be tempered with aqua tegeminosa, and let it be dropped into the nose of the patient lying on his back.
Capitol .xxv.	Chapter 25.
De theyls natz en las extramitatz del nas.	Of wounds in the ends of the nose.
Motas veguadas es nat theyl en las extramitatz del nas, e es magnificat e omentat en alscus dias entro en que mot es leg le reguardament de lu.	Many times a wound occurs in the ends of the nose, and it increases and swells for several days until something is put on it to heal it.
E per aquo cove que tu inscidas aquel en le comensament de la apparissio de lu, e erediques tot aquel.	And by that time you should have applied the beginning of its appearance, and you should have removed all of that.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc o cauteri o medicina comburent la qual estia en loc de lu.	Then apply over the site a cautery or burning medicine which is in the location of the wound.
Mays si es tardada la sua inscizio entro que sia magnificat, lahoras considera si es lapificat, dur, de fusca color e de pauc sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel am ferr quar es apostema crancos; quar motas veguadas ad aquel que inscideys aquesta apostema endeve per lu granda malicia sobre aquel le qual aquel havia.	But if its beginning is delayed until it has become magnified, then consider whether it is suppurating, hard, of dusky color and of little feeling, then do not touch that with iron, for this suppuration often brings great harm to the person upon whom you are doing it.
E si le apostema es de leon tocament e no es de fosca color, e vezes que inscizio es possibla en tot aquel, lahoras evacua le malaute e inscideys aquel senes temor, e cura le loc am aquo que exsique e costrenh entro que sia sanat.	And if the suppuration is of a painful nature and not of dusky color, and its beginning is possible in everything, then evacuate the patient and do it without fear, and treat the site with something that dries and constricts until it is healed.
Capitol .xxvi.	Chapter 26.
De sutura del nas e de las labias e de la aurelha quan la continuitat es dissolvuda per plagua o per semblantz.	Of the sewing of the nose and of the lips and of the ear when the continuity is dissolved by pus or by similar things.
Sapias que quan accideys solucio de continuitat en una de aquestas cartillages, pauc confereys en aquela operacio sino en alcus homes.	Know that when a solution of continuity occurs in one of these cartilages, few confer about this operation except in some men.
Donc cove, quan endeve ad alcu alcuna causa de aquelas, que consideres si es plagua fresca am le sieu sanc, e lahoras tu ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	Therefore, when for some cause of those you consider that it is fresh pus with its blood, then join the two lips of the pus with a suture, and then cure that until it is healed.
E si las labias de solucio de continuitat so ja separadas, e quascuna es fayta sana, lahoras cove que tu excorjes quascuna partida de la sua codena apparent entro que n’iesca sanc.	And if the lips of the solution of continuity are already separated and each one is made healthy, then cut each party of the visible tendon within which the blood flows.
E aprop ajusta las doas labias am sutura e strenh aquelas, e sobre aquelas pulveriza sanc de drago e enses trissat, e pausa sobre la polvera una pessa de emplaustra diafinicon, o de alcu autre dels emplastres consolidatius, e leyssa aquel liat per dos jorns o per tres, e aprop deslia aquel e permuta aquel emplaustre e leyssa aquel entro que·ls fiels per si sian abscinditz, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Then join the two lips with a suture and strengthen those, and over them pulverize dragon's blood and pounded vinegar, and place over the powder a pad of diaphoretic plaster, or one of the other plasters of consolida tion, and let that lie for two or three days, and then remove that plaster and change that plaster, and let it lie until the wounds by themselves are healed.
Mays la manieyra de la sutura es que tu agregues la solucio de continuitat o am agulhas ayssi cum havem recomtat en la sutura del ventre, o agregua la solucio de continuitat am fiel ayssi cum a tu e fayt saber.	But the manner of the suture is that you add the solution of continuity or with needles as we have mentioned in the suture of the belly, or add the solution of continuity with gallbladder as we have made known to you.
Capitol .xxvii.	Chapter 27.
De extraccio de aquela causas que veno en las doas labias en las partidas dedintz.	Of the extraction of those causes that come in the two lips in the divided parts within.
Motas veguadas endeve a motz homes en las partidas dedintz de las suas labias alcus apostemas durs semblantz a gras de errs, e alscunas de lors son mendres e alcunas son majors.	Many times in many men in the divided parts of their lips there are some suppurations hard and resembling grass, and some of them are minor and some are major.
Donc cove que tu convertas las labias e fendas quascuna de aquelas duricias de tota part, e aprop la abscizio umpliscas le loc de sagi trissat entro que·l sanc sia restrengut, e aprop sia lavat am vi agre e sia curat le loc am aquo que es stipticitat, entro que sia sanat.	Therefore you should convert the lips and cut each one of those hardnesses throughout its whole part, and then fill up the incision with powdered sage within so that the blood is constricted, and then wash it with vinegar and cure the site with something that is astringent until it is healed.
Capitol .xxviii.	Chapter 28.
De inscizio de la carn ajustada en las gengivas.	Of incision of the flesh joined in the gums.
Granre de veguadas nays sobre la gengiva carn ajustada la qual les antics apelero albulus, adonc cove que tu suspendas aquela am onci o que tenguas aquela am las forfecs e inscidas aquela deves la sua razit, e leyssas la sania correr o le sanc.	Many times there is upon the gum joined flesh which the ancients called albus, therefore you should suspend that with an ointment or have that with forceps and cut that after its root, and let the pus run or the blood.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc sagi trissat o autra polveras stipticas o excicativas.	Then apply over the site powdered sage or other styptic or astringent powders.
E si aquela carn retorna, lahoras inscideys aquela segundariament, e cauterisa aquela, quar aprop le cauteri no retornara.	And if that flesh returns, then cut it secondarily, and cauterize it, for by cauterizing it will not return.
Capitol .xxix.	Chapter 29.
De razo de dentz am ferr.	Of extraction of teeth with iron.
Quan en la superficia de las dentz de las partidas dedintz e de las de foro e entre las gingivas so ajustadas escorsas aspras, legas, e alcunas veguadas son de nigradas e son faytas citrinas o vertz entro que a la gingiva ve per aquo corrupcio e son faytas las dentz legas.	When upon the surface of the teeth in the divided parts within and between the gums are joined rough, sharp, and some times black escorsions and the teeth are made green or yellow, and within the gum is seen corruption and the teeth are made black.
E donc cove que tu fassas sezer le malaute entre las tuas mas e pausar le cap de lu en le tieu se, e ratz las dents en las quals apareysso aquelas escorsas e causas semblantz arena entro que de lor no romangua deguna causa, e aquo fay de la negror e de la citrinitat e de las autras entro que sian mondificadas.	Therefore you should make the patient open his mouth between his hands and push down his head toward his chest, and cut the teeth in which those escorsions appear and the causes seem like sand so that no cause remains within, and do this of the blackness and of the yellowing and of the others until they are cleansed.
Donc si es ostat aquo que es en aquelas del comensament de la razio, bo es; e sino, lahoras tu itera la razio sobre aquelas al autra dia e al segon e al tertz entro que vengua al derier stament en aquo que tu vols.	Therefore if that which is in the beginning of the root is rotten, well then; but if not, then you should repeat the incision over those another day and the second and the third until it comes to its final state in whatever you want.
E sapias que las dentz han necessitat de motz rezoris de diversas formas e de motas figuras segon que es preparat a la tua operacio.	And know that teeth have need of many different knives with diverse shapes and figures according to the preparation for your operation.
E per so quar le razori am le qual la dent es raza de la partida dedintz es autre del razori am le qual es ras entre las dentz segon autras formas, e aquestas formas de razoris sian deves tu preparadas las quals veyras tantost:	And therefore the knife with which the tooth is cut from the divided part within is another than the knife with which it is cut between the teeth according to other forms, and these forms of knives should be prepared by you as follows:
Capitol .xxx.	Chapter 30.
D’eradicacio de dentz.	Of uprooting teeth.
Cove que tu cures la dent de la sua dolor am tot engen e tardes en tota eradicacio de lu, quar no es denguna causa que suplisqua la veguada de lu quan es eradicada, quar es sustancia sublima entro que es excusacio en la eradicacio de lu.	Let the tooth be cured from its pain by all means and delayed in every uprooting of it, for there is no cause that supplants its existence when it has been uprooted, for it is a sublime substance within which is an excuse in its uprooting.
Mays cove quan le malaute es forsat aquela dent eradicar, que fermament deves tu sia certificat quala es la dent dolent, quar motas veguadas la dolor descep le malaute e cuga que sia en dent sana, e tu eradicas aquela e aprop la dolor no cessa entro que la dent malauta e dolent sia eradicada, quar nos ja havem vist aquo per operacio dels barbies.	But when the patient is forced to have that tooth uprooted, you should certifiably know which is the painful tooth, for many times the pain deceives the patient and seems to be in a healthy tooth and you uproot it and then the pain does not cease until the painful and sick tooth is uprooted, for we have seen this through operation of the barbits.
