Donc cum deves tu es sertificat qual es la dent dolent, e que o sabes be, lahoras cove que tu scarifiques en le circuit de la dent am spatum en le qual sia alcuna vertut, entro que sia dissolvut de la dent de la gingiva de tota partida, e aprop mau aquel am les tieus ditz, o am forfexs subtils al comensament petit a petit entro que aquela concucesquas.	Therefore when you are certified which is the painful tooth and know it well, then cut in the circuit of the tooth with a spatula in which there is some verticity, so that it is dissolved from the gum throughout its whole division, and then maul it with your fingers or with slender forceps little by little within until you have reached it.
E aprop alogua en lu fortz tenalhas grans per bona loquacio o estuptura fort, e pausa le cap del malaute entre les tieus denolhs que be le tengues que no·s maugua, e aprop tratz la dent segon rectitut en manieyra que no trenques aquela, ni al malaute major dolor no dones.	And then pull out the teeth with force using a strong plier or instrument, and place the patient's head between your thighs so that he does not bite you, and then treat the tooth according to its position so that you do not break it or cause the patient greater pain.
E donc si no es foro-getat, lahoras pren un de aquels instrumentz, e met aquel dejos lu de tota part am facilitat e esforsa la remocio de lu ayssi que es feyt al comensament.	And if it is not dislocated, then take one of those instruments and put it under the tooth from all sides with ease and force its removal so that it is done at the beginning.
Mays si la dent es trauquada o corrosa, lahoras cove que tu comples de drap aquel trauc e estrenguas aquel am la extremitat de ray subtil per so que no sia trinquada en la hora de la tua constriccio sobre aquela am tenalas.	But if the tooth is broken or worn down, then you must cover that break with a piece of cloth and grip it tightly at its base with tweezers so that it does not break when you are tightening it with pliers.
E cove que tu obres exquesitament am scarificacio en le circuit de tota part de la gingiva e guarda mot la tua fortaleza que no trenques aquela e romangua partida de lu, e retorne sobre le malaute per la malicia que sia majo que la primieyra dolor de lu.	And you must open it carefully with an incision all around the gum and be very careful not to break it or tear it apart, and return to the patient so that he suffers less pain than before.
E guarda te que no fassas aquo que fan alscus ignorantz barbiers en lor fistinacio e audacia sobre la eradicacio de lor, ses que no aministran aquo que nos havem recomtat; quar motas veguadas fan venir sobre les homes malautias grans las quals son pus dificils que sian trinquadas, e las razitz de lor remaugudas totas, o alcunas de aquelas, o que extrayguas aquela am alcus osses de la mandigula ayssi cum motas veguadas havem testificat.	And be sure not to do what some ignorant barber-surgeons do in their foolhardiness and audacity during tooth extractions; for they do not administer what we have recommended, and many times they bring on great diseases in men which are more difficult to cure than before, and the roots of their teeth remain whole or partly intact, or they extract them with some bones of the jaw as we have often witnessed.
E aprop la eradicacio de lu sia lavada la boca am vi caut o vi agre am sal.	And then after the extraction let the mouth be washed with warm wine or vinegar and salt.
E si endeve fluxs de sanc per aysso, ayssi cum motas veguadas endeve, lahoras trissa alcuna quantitat de zegi e aspergeys sobre la plagua, e si no confereys aquel zegi, cauteriza.	And if it bleeds profusely as it often does, then mix some powder of alum and sprinkle it on the wound; and if that alum does not stop the bleeding, cauterize it.
La forma de las forceps e tenalas subtils am las quals es mauguda la dent al comensament sia de longua extramitat, de breu manubre e gros, per so que no sian doblatz quan am aquels deves obrar.	The shape of the pliers and tweezers with which you pull out the tooth at first should have a long shank, a short handle, and be thick so that they do not bend when you use them to work.
E sian ayssi cum vezes de gros manubre entro que quan estrenhas am aquelas no sian dobladas, sian breus extramitatz.	And let their shanks be as short as possible so that when you grip with them they do not bend; let their shanks be short.
E sian faytas de ferr de India descentment faytas de dreytas extramitatz, e en las extramitatz de aquelas sian dentz de las quals las unas intron en las autras e estrenhan per constriccio descent fort, e alscunas veguadas las extramitatz de aquelas sian la forma del bec d’un auzel le qual ha nom ciconia, so es guanta, e son de fort constriccio.	And let them be made of Indian iron with straight shanks and let the shanks have teeth that mesh together and grip tightly; some of their shanks are shaped like a stork's beak, which is hooked, and they grip very tightly.
Capitol .xxxi.	Chapter 31.
De erradicacio de dentz e d‘estraccio dels osses de las mandibulas trincadas.	On the extraction of teeth and the breaking of the jaw bones.
Quan deves la eradicacio de dent le qual es trinquat roman alcuna causa, lahoras cove que tu pauses sobre le loc coto am boder per un jorn o per dos entro que·l loc sia mollificat; e aprop entromet algesti o tenalhas las extramitatz de las quals so asembladas al bec de un auzel apelat ciconia o guanta, la forma de las forceps:	When you must extract a tooth that is broken, then you should put on the site a poultice for one or two days until the site is softened; and then insert a forceps or pliers whose ends are shaped like a stork's beak or hooked, the shape of the pliers:
Las extramitatz de lor sian faytas dedintz ayssi cum lima o alfagi.	Their ends should be serrated like a file or chisel.
E si no obediys a tu a eyssiment am aquestas forceps o tenalas, lahoras cove que tu caves sobre la razit e descrobas tota la carn e entrometas le instrument le qual ha nom atali, so es palanca petita del qual la forma es aquesta:	And if you do not obey my instructions with these forceps or pliers, then you should cut into the gum and expose all the flesh, and insert the instrument called an awl, which is a small lever whose shape is like this:
E sia de breu extremitat grossa un petit, e no sia enbegut per so que no sia trinquat.	And let it be short with a thick shank, and not bent so that it does not break.
Donc si per aquo la razit es foro-getada, bo es; e sino, ajuda te am aquestz autres instrument dels quals aquestas son las formas: la forma del primier instrument es de triangulada extramitat en la qual sia alcuna grossesa:	Then if by doing this the root is exposed, well and good; but if not, help yourself with these other instruments of which these are the shapes: the shape of the first instrument is triangular at its shank end in which there should be some thickness:
La forma del segon instrument es que sia de triangulada e de pus subtil extremitat.	The shape of the second instrument is that it should have a triangular and more slender end.
E ja so ajudatz am aquest instrument havent dos ramps del qual aquesta es la forma aprop la seguent:	And now help yourself with this instrument which has two ramps whose shape is as follows:
e am autres instrumentz les quals precidero en rasura de dentz; quar juvament es fayt am aquest instrument le qual es asemblat a onci gran, e aquesta es la forma:	and with other instruments which are used in tooth extractions; for the aid is made with this instrument which is shaped like a large needle, and this is its shape:
de la triangulada extremitat torta o curta, la qual sia alcuna grossesa, e no sia enbegut per so que no sia trinquat.	The triangular end should be curved or cut short and have some thickness; let it not be bent so that it does not break.
E otra sapias que·ls instrumentz de las dentz motz so e semblantment les autres instruments.	And another variation on the instruments for teeth is to make them similarly to the others.
Mays le artifexs savi e subtil en l’art, atroba per si mateys segon aquo que a lu significa la operacio e las malautias diversas; quar son de las malautias a las quals les antics no diysero ni pausero propri instrument, per las formas de diversas specias.	But the clever and skilled practitioner in this art finds for himself methods according to what his experience and diverse illnesses teach him; for there are illnesses to which the ancients did not attribute or assign proper instruments because of their various shapes.
Mays si es trinquat l’os de la mandibula o dels autres osses de la boca, o si poyreys, lahoras sia pes curat sobre aquel en son loc am aquo que es a lu convenient dels instrumentz e de las forceps las quals havem dit en la extraccio de las razitz de las dentz, e ajuda te am gesti del qual aquesta es la forma:	But if the jaw bone or any other bone is broken, or if there is pus, then let it be treated at that site with what is appropriate from the instruments and pliers we have mentioned in the extraction of tooth roots; and help yourself with an instrument whose shape is like this:
E sia en lu alcuna grosseza petit a petit, e sia instringida o tenguda am la boca per que no evasesca o fuga entro que l’os de tot sia foro-getat; e aprop restaura le loc am medicinas convenientz ad aquo.	And let there be some thickness added to it little by little, and let it be bound or held in place by the mouth so that it does not slip or leak until the bone is healed; and then dress the wound with appropriate remedies for that.
Mays si en l’os es petita poyredura, lahoras ratz aquel de aquela poyredura e de la sua negror, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	But if there is a small ulcer in the bone, then scrape away that ulcer and its blackness, and treat it until it is healed.
Capitol .xxxii.	Chapter 32.
De la cura de las dentz eminentz sobre las autras.	On the treatment of prominent teeth above the others.
Quan las dentz so eminentz no segon lor cors natural per aquelas la forma es laga, e majorment quan endeve a las femnas, e majorment a las piuselas venerablas; donc cove que tu consideras: si dent es nada aprop autra dent, e no es possibla sarradura ni linament de lu, lahoras radica aquela; mays que no sia annexa am autra dent, lahoras tu inscideys aquela am aquest instrument del qual aquesta es la forma; e es semblant a morr de porc, e sia feyt de ferr de India de extramitat mot aguda.	When teeth are prominent not according to their natural form because of their shape, and especially when this occurs in women, and especially in old women, then consider: if the tooth is attached to another tooth, and there is no space or room for it, then pull it out; but if it is not attached to another tooth, then you cut it down with that instrument whose shape is like this; and it is similar to a pig's tusk, and it should be made of Indian iron with a very sharp end.
E sia la tua inscizio am la qual inscideyses aquela en trops dias per la duricia de la dent, e que no sia comauguda autra de las dentz.	And make your incision in it which you will use to cut into it in several places because of the hardness of the tooth, and that it does not affect any other teeth.
E si es dent eminent expausat a limadura, lahoras lima aquel am lima de ferr de India del qual aquesta es la forma:	And if the prominent tooth is expanded with file, then file it with an Indian iron file whose shape is like this:
E sia tot de ferr de India e·l margua eysament; e sia de motz menutz puntz ayssi cum lima am la qual son faytas agulhas, am la qual la dent sia limada pauc a pauc en motz dias am fecilitat, per so que no sia autra dent comauguda e caga.	And let it be all of Indian iron and very sharp; and let it have many small points like a file with which the tooth is filed little by little in several places with ease, so that no other tooth is affected and it does not break.
E aprop lineys aquela en la fi, e ratz aquela am alscus razoris.	And then line that up in its width, and cut that away with some razors.
E si es dent del qual una partida es trinquada e lideys la lengua, lahoras cove que tu limescas aquel entro que l’aspretat de aquela fraccio sia ostada e engualhada, e sia aplenada per so que la lengua no ledesca ni la paraula no corrumpa.	And if that tooth whose part is broken and touches the tongue, then let you file it down until the sharp edge of that fracture is filed down and smoothed, and let it be flattened so that the tongue is not cut or speech impaired.
Capitol .xxxiii.	Chapter 33.
De restauracio de dentz maugudas am fiel de aur o de argent.	On the restoration of broken teeth with gold or silver wire.
Quan accideys a las dentz devant concussio e remossio per percussio o per cazament, e le malaute no pot strenher sobre aquo que manga, e tu has curat aquel am medicinas stipticas, e no ha valgut la tua curacio, lahoras per so que no cagan es engen en aquelas que sian strengudas am fiel de aur e no de argent, quar argent se fa vert e aprop se poyreys aprop alscus dias, mays aur nul temps no es mudat.	When the teeth have received a concussion and removal due to impact or biting, and the patient cannot chew on it, and you have treated that with astringent remedies, and your treatment has not worked, then so that they do not become loose as they are bound with gold wire and not with silver wire, for silver becomes blackened but gold does not; and let them be bound, and after several days, but gold will not darken.
E sia le fiel en tal subtilitat e grocesa segon la quantitat que puesca entrar entre las dentz; e la forma de la reccio es que prenguas le fiel e pren lo doble de lu entre doas dentz sanas, e aprop que cresques am doas tortuositatz del fiel entre doas maugudas, o si’ una o motas, entro que pervengua la tela a la dent sana del autra partida.	And let the wire be of such thickness and coarseness according to the amount that can fit between the teeth; and the shape of the twist is that you take the wire and wind it twice around two healthy teeth, and then let it grow with two twists of the wire between two broken teeth, or if one or more, in such a way that the thread comes to the healthy tooth from the other broken tooth.
E aprop itera le teyssiment entro a la partida de la qual comenciest, e strenh la tua ma am facilitat e savieza entro que no sia mauguda.	And then repeat the massage in the area where you started, strengthening your hand with skill and wisdom so that there is no discomfort.
E sia la tua striccio am la qual strenhas le fiel deves las razitz de las dentz que no evasesca.	And tighten the string with which you draw the teeth roots so that it does not leak.
E aprop inscindeys las extramitatz del fiel superfluens am las forceps o tosoyras, e agregua aquelas en quascun loc am gesti, e converteys aquelas e las occulta entre la dent sana e la dent mauguda, per so que no fassa lesio a la lengua.	Then cut the ends of the superfluous thread with forceps or tweezers, and place them in each spot with gestures, and turn them and hide them between the healthy tooth and the damaged tooth so that it does not cause harm to the tongue.
E aprop leyssa aquela ayssi streyta cum roman.	Then let that remain tight like a Roman bow.
Mays si es desliada o rumpuda, strenh aquela o aquelas am autra fiel en tal manieyra en tot son temps.	But if it is loose or torn, strengthen it or them with another thread in the same way at all times.
E aquesta es la forma de las dentz e la figura de la rectacio de doas dentz sanas e de doas maugudas, ayssi cum vezes aquestas liadas:	And this is the form of the teeth and the figure of the direction of two healthy teeth and two damaged ones, thus with their threads tied:
E quan se fa que retorno una dent o doas aprop le cazement de quascuna en lors locs, e sian recrescutz ayssi cum havem recomtat, e que remauguan.	And when one or two teeth are pushed back into their sockets and have grown back as we have described, and they hurt again:
E no fa aquo sino bo artifexs e savi.	And it does not happen unless by a skilled and wise artist.
E alcunas veguadas es aptat alcuna causa dels osses de vaca, e es fayt de lor ayssi cum forma de dent, e es pausada en loc en le qual defayl la dent, e es strengit ayssi cum havem dit, e reman e serveys am aquel per lonc temps.	And sometimes it is necessary to use a bone from a cow, and it is shaped like a tooth, and placed in the place where the tooth is lacking, and strengthened as we have said, and it remains and serves for a long time.
Capitol .xxxiv.	Chapter .xxxiv.
De inscizio del liament le qual ve en la lengua e prohibeys loquela.	Of the beginning of the swelling that comes in the tongue, and prohibits speech.
Aquest liguament le qual ve dejos la lengua alcunas veguadas o es natural am le qual hom nays, o accidental e accideys per plagua la qual ja es consolidada.	This ligament which comes below the tongue sometimes happens naturally or accidentally as a result of a plague which is already consolidated.
E la operacio en lu es que huobres la boca del malaute, le sieu cap existent en le tieu se; e eleva la sieua lengua, e aprop inscideys aquel liament nervos segon la latitut entro que sia solvuda la lengua de la sua recencio.	And the operation in it is that you open the mouth of the patient, his head being in your lap; and raise his tongue, and then cut that nervous ligament according to the width by which the tongue is released from its bondage.
Mays si en aquela es alcuna duricia o denodacio, e aquo es stat per consolidacio de plagua, lahoras tu gieta unci e scindeys aquel per la latitut entro que aias inscindit le liament e sia dissolvuda la nodacio.	But if there is any hardness or knotting in it, and it has become so because of the consolidation of plague, then you apply an unguent and cut it where you cut the ligament and the knot is dissolved.
E guarda te que no sia fayta fissura en le preon de la carn e que scindas aqui arceria e vengua flux de sanc.	And beware that there be no fissure in the membrane of the flesh, and that you cut through here with an incision and blood flows out.
E aprop sia lavat le vestigi de la inscisio am ayguaros o am vi agre o am aygua frega; e aprop pausa dejos la lengua licini; so es meca la qual tengua le malaute dejos la lengua en quascuna nuoyt per so que no sia consolidat autra veguada.	Then wash the trace of the incision with wine vinegar or with pure wine, or with water mixed with vinegar; and then place a cotton swab under the tongue, or a bandage which the patient keeps under his tongue every night so that nothing else is consolidated there.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc, pausa sobre le loc vetriol trissat; mays si le sanc ventz, lahoras cauteriza le loc am cauteri lantiginos le qual conveneys ad aquo.	But if blood flows out, place a mixture of vitriol over the spot; but if pus flows out, then cauterize the spot with a red-hot cautery which is appropriate for that.
E aprop aquel cura am las autras causas entro que sia sanat.	And then let it be cured by the other causes until it is healed.
Capitol .xxxv.	Chapter .xxxv.
De extraccio de ranula dejos la lengua.	Of the extraction of a ranula under the tongue.
Alcunas veguadas accideys dejos la lengua apostema asemblant a nomla petita prohibent la lengua de la sua operacio natural; e fort leu es magnificada entro que huempla la boca.	Sometimes it happens under the tongue an abscess resembling a small lump, which prohibits the tongue from performing its natural functions, and when it is enlarged it fills the mouth.
E la operacio en lu es que huebras la boca del malaute sesent devant le solel e considera le apostema.	And the operation in this case is that you open the mouth of the patient facing the sun and examine the abscess.
E si tu le vezes de fusca color o de negra, dur, al qual le malaute no atroba sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel quar es cranc.	And if you see it dark or black in color, hard to which the patient does not respond with feeling, then do not touch that because it is rotten.
E si es declinat a blancor, en le qual es humiditat, lahoras tu met le onci en lu, e inscideys aquel am spatum subtil, e inscindeys le de tota partida; e si sanc te ventz en la hora de la tua operacio, lahoras tu pausa desus zegi trissat, so es vetriol, entro que sia restreyt le sanc.	And if it is inclined towards whiteness, and there is moisture in which there is humidity, then you put an unguent on it, and cut it with a sharp blade, and cut it throughout its entire length; and if blood flows out during your operation, then you place over it a mixture of vitriol so that the blood is restrained.
E aprop retorna a la obra tua entro que lo haias trayt am compliment de lu, entro que sia lavat am vi agre e sal; e cura aquel am l’autra curacio ad aquo entro que sia sanat.	Then return to your work until you have finished it, after which wash it with wine vinegar and salt, and let it be cured by the other cure for that until it is healed.
Capitol .xxxvi.	Chapter .xxxvi.
De extraccio de apostema de doas aurelhas e de aquel que es nada en le golayro e de las autras apostemas.	Of the extraction of an abscess from two ears and of that which is found in the gullet, and of the other abscesses.
Quan endeveno en le golayro godat, so son glandulas las quals son asembladas algodat, las quals accideysso deforas e son nompnadas doas aurelhas, las quals quan tu las curas am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no es sanat, lahoras tu considera si le apostema es dur, de fusca color, de pauc sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel am ferr.	When you find in the gullet a swelling which is like glands which are similar to cotton, and they are discharged from the outside and are called two ears, and when you cure them with what we have said in the division and it is not healed, then consider if the abscess is hard, of dark color, of little feeling, then do not touch that with iron.
E si es de roga color e la razic es grossa, lahoras no toques aquela am ferr per le flux del sanc; abantz layssa aquel entro sia madurat, e lahoras o tu trauqueras aquel, o sira romput per si.	And if it is of a red color and the root is thick, then do not touch that with iron for the flow of blood; before you remove it let that mature, and then either you will draw out that or it will burst by itself.
E si es de blanqua color, radon, e la razit de lu es subtil, lahoras aquel es que cove esser inscidit.	And if it is of a white color, soft, and the root of it is fine, then that is what should be cut.
E la operacio en lu es que consideras, denant la tua operacio, si ja ha repausat le apostema de lu caut am repaus complit o si es deminuit am alcuna deminucio; e lahoras fay sezer le malaute denant le soleyl, e·l cap de lu sia en le tieu se, e huebre la boca de lu, e le servidor prenent entre las suas mas prema la lengua de lu dejos am instrument mot noble del qual aquesta es la forma:	And the operation in this case is that you consider before your operation whether the abscess has rested after being cauterized completely or if it has diminished by any lessening; and then cause the patient to sit facing the sun, and his head be in your lap, and open his mouth, and the assistant holding with his hand press down the tongue of the patient from above with a noble instrument, of which this is the form:
E sia fayt de argent o de aram, e sia subtil cum cotel.	And let it be made of silver or of copper, and let it be fine like a needle.
Donc cum tu premes am aquel la lengua e es mostrat a tu la apostema, e catz sobre aquel le tieu vezement, lahoras pren onci e fica aquel en l’amenla, e tira aquel a las partidas defora tant quant podes.	Then when you press down with that the tongue and it is shown to you the abscess, and put over that your iron weight, then take unguent and smear that on the root of it, and draw out that to the outer parts as much as you can.
Otra aquo que tiras alcuna causa de las tunicas, e aprop incideys aquela am instrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	Another thing which you draw some cause from the membranes, and then cut that with an instrument of which this is the form:
e es asemblat a forceps, empero las extramitatz de lu son corvadas, ayssi que l’orrifici de quascuna de aquelas es en le endreyt del autra, mot agudas, le qual sia de ferr indi enbegut.	It is like forceps except the ends of it are curved so that the orifice of each of them is in the direction of the other, being sharp, let that be made of iron hardened in vinegar.
Mays si aquest instrument no es a tu present, lahoras inscideys aquel am spatum del qual aquesta es la forma de lu: E sia agut de la una part, no agut del autra part.	But if that instrument is not at hand, then cut that with a blade of which this is the form: And let it be sharp on one side, blunt on the other side.
E pus que has inscidit una mella, inscideys l’autra segon aquesta meteyssa manieyra de inscizio, e aprop la inscizio le malaute guarguarise de aygua frega	And after you have cut one wound, cut the other according to this way of cutting, and then wash the wound of the patient with water mixed with vinegar.
Mays si endeve flux de sanc, guarguarise aygua de decoccio de scorsa de milgrana o de fuelha de mirtra e semblantz ad aquel de las causas stiptiquas entro que·l flux del sanc sia restreyt, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	But if blood flows out, then wash it with water of a decoction of bark of a pomegranate or of bayberry leaves and like that of the causes of stipting within so that the flow of blood is restrained, and then let it be cured by that until it is healed.
E alcunas veguadas naysso en le guolayro autras apostemas otra aquelas doas aurelhas, e inscideys aquelas segon que yeu e dit en la inscizio de doas mellas engualment.	And sometimes it happens in the gullet other abscesses, and those two ears as well; and cut those according to what we have said in the cutting of two wounds equally.
E yeu ja fu medicat una femna de apostema le qual era nat en le golayro de lu, le qual apostema tendia a color fusca, de pauc sentiment, le qual ja havia claus le golayro de lu, e la femna respirava am meat streyt, e ja havia prohibit a lu comestio e beure de aygua, e ja era pervenguda a la mort si mays agues stat per un dia o per dos.	And there was a woman who had an abscess which was found in the gullet of her, that abscess tended towards a dark color, with little feeling, and it had closed the gullet of her, and the woman breathed with difficulty, and already prohibited from eating and drinking water, and she was already nearing death if she did not last for one day or two.
E l’apostema ja tant havia pugat que havia mezes dos ramps entro que eyssiro per dos traucs.	And the abscess had swollen so that it had formed two bumps within which poured out through two holes.
Donc yeu me cuytegui fisturalment e fiquegui en un de lor onci, e tiregui aquel, e atirada es de lu gran porcio, e aprop yeu incidigui aquela de on comprendegui del autre trau, e aprop yeu obrigui la boca de lu, e compremegui la sua lengua, e aprop yeu fiquegui le onci en aquela apostema.	Then she cut it with a sharp blade and inserted one of the tips into that abscess, and drew out that, and tied up is from her mouth a great portion, and then she cut the other wound as we have said before, and then she closed his mouth, and pressed down his tongue, and then she smeared the unguent on that abscess.
E aprop yeu abscizi gran partida de lu, e no corria de lu sino un pauc de sanc.	And then she cut a great portion from it, and there flowed out from it only a little blood.
Donc absolut es le guolayro de aquela femna, e comensec tantost beure aygua, e aprop presec vianda, donc yeu no cessegui inscidir de aquela apostema motas vetz per lonc temps, e succesia apostema en loc de aquel, le qual inscizia entro que es prolonguat aquel.	Then the bleeding of that woman stopped, and she immediately began to drink water and eat food; therefore I did not cease cutting out that boil several times over a long time, and then the boil appeared in another place where it was cut out, as it was growing.
Donc yeu engen agui e cauterizegui le guolayro de lu, donc astec de addicio; e aprop yeu perambulegui e no saubi que fec Dieus de aquela aprop mi.	Then I bandaged and cauterized his boil, therefore on the next day; and then I walked around and did not know what God had done to him.
Capitol .xxxvii.	Chapter 37.
De inscizio de huvela quan es apostemada.	On cutting out a boil when it is suppurating.
Quan catarr deysen a la huvula, e es apostemada e es longa, lahoras ela es nompnada perpendicular; e si es en la partida dejos grossa e redonda, e lahoras ela es apelada buba.	When pus comes out of the boil and it is suppurating and long, then it is called a furuncle; and if it is at the top thick and round, then it is called a bubo.
Mays quan es curada am aquo que havem dit en la divisio, e no comfereys la tua curacio, e eyssament ja vezes que apostema caut ja es ostat de lu e es subtil, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquela que es agreguadas redonda; e si es ad aquela longitut, e es sanguina, de fusca color o de negre, e no es a lu centiment, lahoras cove que tu temtes la inscizio de lu, quar en aquela es temor sobre le malaute.	But if it is healed with the water that we have mentioned in the previous chapter and does not respond to your treatment, and you see that suppuration continues, then be careful about cutting it, for there is danger to the patient when suppuration continues.
E quan tu vezes aquela segon la manieyra que yeu he dita de la sua blancor e longuesa, que tu fassas sezer le malaute e premas la lengua de lu am instrument del qual procesic la sua forma e aprop fica le onci en la nuva, e tira aquela en jos e inscideys aquela am un de dos instrumentz les quals e ditz en la inscizio de dos mellas.	And when you see it according to what I have said about its whiteness and length, then make the patient fast and press his tongue with an instrument of which process has been mentioned in the incision of two teeth, and stick it into the gum and cut that with one of the two instruments of which are spoken in the incision of two teeth.
E cove que no inscidas aquela sino aquo que es ajustat sobre le terme natural ses addicio, quar si tu inscides de lu mays, lediyras le sieu parlar.	And you must not cut it unless it is above its natural limit; for if you cut more, you will hurt his jaw.
E aprop la inscizio, usa de aquo le qual havem recomtat en la inscizio de dos mellas, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And after the incision, use what we have recommended in the incision of two teeth, and heal it until it is cured.
Mays si era le malaute espaventat per la inscizio de lu, cove que use de engen en la cauterizacio de lu ses temor, e la manieyra del cauteri en lu no es sino am aygua aguda, e es que tu pauses le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop prem la lengua de lu am le instrument le qual havem dit, e aprop pren de l’aygua la qual havem dita en le capitol de cauterizacio, e comfeys am aquela caus viva, e pausa aquela no spessa ni subtil, e de aquela omple la concavitat de l’estrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	But if the patient is afraid of having his jaw cut, then use the cauterization without fear, and the manner of the cauterization in it is only with acute water; and you must place the head of the patient in your lap, and press his tongue with the instrument we have mentioned, and take the water we have spoken of in the chapter on cauterization, and do this with a live coal, and pour that not thick nor subtle into the cavity of the instrument of which this is the form:
Sia la extramitat de lu conquavitat en la qual sia pausada la medicina ayssi cum la conquavitat de culher de ray, e pausa le strument am la medicina sobre la vula, e·l malaute jagua sobre le sieu latz per so que corro saliva o musellage de la boca de aquel per la intrinscequa medicina, per so que no deyssenda de aquela deguna causa sobre le golayro de lu e que ledesca aquel.	Let the end of it be hollow like a spoon, in which the medicine is put as in a spoon; and place the instrument with the medicine on the boil, and let the patient lean over on his side so that saliva or mucous from the mouth does not fall back into the wound.
E aprop te la tua ma am la medicina, e exprem aquela sobre la uvula per l’espazi de miega hora entro que vegas aquela esser denegrada e sedada per la mordicacio de la medicina.	And with your hand hold the medicine and press it onto the uvula through the space of about a half-hour until you see it blackened and subdued by the biting of the medicine.
E si vols, prengues coto e envolopes aquel sobre la extremitat del ray, e submergeys le coto en la medicina, e entrometas le ray am le coto en una canula de sobre entro que·l coto adheresca en aquela canula, e fay aquo tantas vetz entro que consiegues aquo que vols de la cauterizacio de la uva, e aprop leyssa aquela quar ela se seccara e cayra aprop tres dias o quatre.	And if you want, take a piece of cloth and wrap it around the end of the jaw, and submerge the cloth in the medicine, and insert the jaw with the cloth into a tube as far as the jaw adheres to that tube, and do this several times until you achieve what you want from the cauterization of the uvula; then let it be for three or four days.
E si indigeysses que iteras la medicina, itera aquela, e aprop la cauterizacio abstergeys en le circuit de la uva am coto enbegut en boder, e mondifica am aquel aquo que es en le circuit de lu de la medicina, e sia lavat am aygua frega, e sia curat deforo am embrocacio, e dedintz am guarguarismes entro que sia sanat.	And if you find that the medicine needs to be repeated, then repeat it; and after the cauterization, cleanse around the uvula with a cloth dipped in water, and cleanse what is inside the mouth of the medicine, and let it be washed with soapwater, and let it be healed outside with ointment, and inside with gargles until it is cured.
E aquesta especia de curacio es pus salva que inscizio e pus long de temor.	And this kind of cure is more safe than incision, and less painful from fear.
Alcunas veguadas es curada la uvuola am aquo que es pus subtil que cauteri e inscizio, quar es curat am subfumigacio en aquesta manieyra: recipe calament, ysop, origua, ruda, scicados arabic, camamilla, broyda e semblant ad aquels de las erbas, e ajusta totas aquelas causas, o alcunas de lor, en una ola, e sian submergidas am vi agre, e bulhan; e la ola sia be lutada am lut decentment, e sia en le mieg loc de la ola un trauc, sobre le qual sia pausat un instrument conquau de aram segon aquesta manieyra; sia fayt de argent o de aram.	Sometimes the uvula is healed in a way that is more subtle than cauterization and incision: take gallnuts, hyssop, oregano, ruda, scilla, arabic alkanet, camomile, bromine and other herbs like them, and mix all those ingredients, or some of them, into a cake; and let the cake be cooked in a decent pot, and let there be a hole in the middle of the cake, on which is placed an instrument made of silver or iron.
E sia entromesa la extremitat en la boca del malaute entro que la vapor poge a la uvula sobre la quanula, entro que la uvula sia mot ofuscada.	And let the end be inserted into the mouth of the patient so that the steam reaches the uvula over the glottis, until the uvula becomes very foggy.
E aprop itera sobre aquela motas veguadas entro qu’es secca, e guarda te que no fassas aquesta curacio al comesament de l’aveniment de apostemas, quar trop ajustaria en le apostema, e no cove que tu fassas aquo, sino deves la declaracio de apostema de lu caut.	And after that repeat on it several times until it is dried up; and beware of doing this cure during the day when there is a suppuration of boils, for then it would be too much on the boil; so you must not do this.
Mays si no es a tu present aquest instrument, lahoras pren una cana e compon en la extramitat de lu un clos de huou, per so que la boca del malaute sia comborida, quar le closc del huou prohibeys la vapor comburir la boca.	But if you do not have this instrument, then take a reed and tie on the end of it a cloth of hemp, so that the mouth of the patient is burned, for the cloth of hemp prohibits the steam from burning the mouth.
E aquesta curacio es bona am salut.	And this cure is good for health.
Capitol .xxxviii.	Chapter 38.
De extraccio d’espinas e de aquo que adhereys en le golayro e de las autras causas.	On the extraction of thorns and of what adheres in the throat and from other causes.
Motas veguadas adhereys en le guolayro o spina de peys o alcuna autra causa.	Sometimes there is adhesion in the throat, or thorn of a stone or some other cause.
Adonc cove que tu extraguas aquo que de aquels es apparent, sobre le qual catz la vista, pus que tu premes la lengua am instrument denant solelh, per so que a tu sia declarat aquo que es en la guola.	Then you must extract what is evident from those, on which the eye falls, when you press the tongue with an instrument in front of the sun, so that it is revealed to you what is in the throat.
E aquo que no apar e es a tu occultat en le guolayro, cove que tu fassas vomir le malaute denant que la vianda sia degerida en l’estomac, quar fort leu la causa annexsa le golayro sira foro-getada per vomit; o que deglusia le malaute una pessa de nap o de razit de laytuga o un boci de pa sec; o prengua una pessa de sponga marina sequa leon, e lia aquela fortment am fiel, e aprop le malaute transglussia aquela, quar cum perve al loc en le qual so spinas e es extrahuda, lahoras so foro-getatz.	And what is not apparent and hidden in the throat, then you must make the patient vomit before the food is digested in the stomach, for it is certain that the cause of the throat is brought up by vomiting; or that the patient licks a piece of soapwort or a leaf of lettuce, or a piece of dry bread; or that he takes a piece of dried sea sponge and chews it hard with his teeth, and then makes him vomit so that what is in the throat is extracted.
E mays pren una anguila e be am fiel liada, e sia dedintz mesa e soptament sia extrayta; o pren un porr e soptament le metas e soptament l’en tratz.	And if he takes a piece of eel and chews it, and then vomits it out, or takes an onion and chews it and vomits it out, then it is extracted.
Mays si no so foro-getatz am aquelas causas las quals havem ditas, lahoras husa de un instrument de plom segon aquesta forma:	But if it is not extracted with the causes we have mentioned, then use an instrument made of lead in this form:
E sia pus gros que ray un petit, e en la extramitat de lu sia conquavitat la qual tu entrometas en la sua guola am facilitat.	Let it be thicker than a little finger, and let the end of it be hollow which you insert into his throat with ease.
E el aga le sieu cap elevat en sus, e guarda te que·l tocament del sieu os de la gola, per so que endevengua a lu cos e am aquela que enpellesca le os o la spina, o que aquel le metge am la sua ma.	And let him raise his head up, and beware of the touching of his bones in the throat, so that it does not push it into his throat, or that he touch with his hand.
Mays empero que·l malaute aquel entrometa es miels, per la sua sciencia del loc de la causa annexa e enpellisca en jos, e tira la sua ma am le instrument en sus, tot aquo segon la quantitat la qual es a lu preparada entro que sia foro-getada.	But let him insert that end gently into his throat with his knowledge of the location of the cause and push it inwards, and pull out his hand with the instrument upwards, as far as it is prepared to be extracted.
Capitol .xxxix.	Chapter 39.
De extraccio de sancguisugua annexsa al golayro.	On the extraction of blood-spitting annexed to the throat.
Quan es medicada sanguisugua am aquo que havem dit en la divisio de la curacio am medicinas e no comfereys, considera lahoras en le guolayro del malaute al solelh, pus que tu aias compremuda la lengua de lu am instrument le qual a tu havem recomtat.	When blood-spitting is cured with what we have mentioned in the division of the cure with medicines and does not respond, then consider after that in the throat of the patient towards the sun, for you will see that his tongue is swollen with the instrument which I have recommended.
Donc si tu vezes la sancguisugua, extratz aquela am onci petit o am gesti subtils decentment.	Then if you see the blood-spitting, extract it with a small needle or with decently subtle instruments.
E si no es a tu possible estrayre am aquel, lahoras pren una canula concava e entromet aquela en lo guolayro del malaute, e aprop pausa en la concavitat de la canula un ferr ignit, e fay aquo tantas vetz (entro que la sancguisugua sia morta e se osta del guolayro) e abstengua se le malaute tot lo jorn de aygua.	And if you are not able to extract it with that, then take a hollow tube and insert it into the throat of the patient, and after that place in the cavity of the tube an iron needle which has been heated, and do this several times (until the blood-spitting is stopped and comes out of the throat) and let the patient abstain from water for all the day.
E aprop prengua una veyria plena de aygua frega, e obra la boca de lu en aquela, e lava la boca am aquela; e no trasglucia de aquela alcuna causa e maugua l’aygua una hora aprop autra am la sua ma, quar la sancguisugua tantost cum sent l’aygua catz.	And then take a washcloth soaked in warm water, open their mouth with it, and wash their mouth with it; and do not give them anything to drink for one hour or so with your hand, for the blood will flow immediately when they feel the water.
Mays si no es foro-getada am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras subfumigua le malaute am cimetz o am assafetida per le instrument le qual havem recomtat en la sufumiguacio de uvula.	But if it is not cured with what we have recommended, then smoke the patient with camphor or assafetida using the instrument which we have recommended for smoking the uvula.
Fay aquo, so en quar cayra.	Do this, depending on how far gone they are.
E es un’autra manieyra de operacio en sufumiguacio de aquela, es que tu prenguas una ola en la qual sian carbos ignitz e la ola sia cuberta am una cobertora en le mieg de la qual sia un trauc, e sia compausat en aquel trauc la extremitat del instrument; e aprop dega desus la subfumigacio; e pause le malaute la sua boca en la extremitat de la canula, e claugua la sua boca per que la subfumiguacio no sia foro-getada entro que sapias que la subfumigacio es pervenguda a la sancguisugua, quar la sancguisugua tantost cayra.	And there is another way of operating on this: that you take a vessel in which are burning coals and the vessel be covered with a covering in the middle of which there is a hole; and the end of the instrument be placed in that hole; and then let the smoking take place; and let the patient place their mouth at the end of the tube, and close their mouth so that the smoking is not wasted until you know that the smoking has reached the blood, for then the blood will flow immediately.
E si no catz, lahoras tu itera la subfumiguacio motas vetz, e abstengua le malaute de beure, e mange causas saladas e alhs, e no begua aygua, e ayssi necessari es que am aquest regiment sia fora-getada.	And if it does not work, then repeat the smoking several times, and keep the patient from drinking, and let him eat salty foods and lard, and do not give them water, and thus it is necessary that this regimen be followed.
E aquesta es la forma del instrument am le qual es trayta sancguisugua del guolayro quan es vista; e es semblant a forceps ayssi cum vezes, sino quar es en lu alcuna curvitat:	And this is the form of the instrument with which blood is drawn from the gullet when it is seen; and it is like tweezers, except that there is some curvature in it.
le qual sia mesa al guolayro, e la extremitat de lu es semblant a bec de ciconia, que es guanta, en la qual es aspretat de lima, per so quar, quan comprem alcuna causa, aquela no leyssa.	And it is placed at the gullet, and its end is similar to a stork's beak, which is gloved, in which there is tightened with a thread, so that when we press any spot, it does not leak.
Capitol .xl.	Chapter 40.
En le qual es la suma del sermo en apercio de apostemas e en seccio de lor.	In which is the sum of the discussion on ulcers and their treatment.
Les apostemas so motas specias, de motas manieyras, segon que ve rememoracio de lor, de quascuna en aquest libre.	Ulcers are of many kinds, according to what is remembered of them in this book.
E so diversas en perforacio e seccio de lor per doas manieyras, de las quals la una es per la specia de apostemas en si meteys; e per aquo que comprem de las humiditatz.	And they are diverse in their penetration and section by two methods: one is by the kind of ulcer within themselves; and the other is according to what we know of their moisture.
E la segonda manieyra es prop les locs en les quals accideys del cos, quar le apostema accident en le cap es autra de la apostema accident en le cul; e le apostema en le loc carnos accident es autra del apostema accident en junctura; e a quascun de lor es son juguament per operacio.	And the second method is according to the locations in the body where they occur, for the ulcer that occurs on the head is different from the one that occurs on the tail; and the ulcer on the fleshy location is different from the one that occurs at a joint; and each of them has its own treatment by operation.
E mays de apostemas so alcunas las quals cove que no sian perforadas sino aprop maturacio de la sania en aquels o compliment de lor.	And there are some ulcers which do not penetrate but rather mature the pus within them, or else they are fulfilled in themselves.
So autras apostemas les quals cove que sian traucatz quan son cruzes, e no son maturatz segon lor compliment, ayssi cum apostemas que son propdas a las juncturas, quar apostema quan ve prop junctura, lo esser de lu es prolonguat entro que·s poyreys aquo que es en le circuit de lu, e fort leu son corromputz les liamentz o les nervis de aquela junctura, per que es fayta causa de contraccio de aquel membre; o es apostema prop de membre principal, e si tu tardas la perforacio de lu entro sia madurat nosira al membre principal; o es prop le cul, donc perfora aque no-madurat; e no cove que·l perforas cru, de no-complida degestio, sino aquel que es prop del cul, per so que no poyresca le preon de lu e sia elonguat a las partidas dedintz del cul, e sia fayta fistula, o que sia fayt en le terme de lu que no sia sanat.	And there are other ulcers which are not cut open unless their pus matures within them and they are fulfilled: these are the ulcers near the joints; for when an ulcer comes near a joint, its nature is prolonged through that which it affects of its parts, and corrupts the tendons or nerves of that joint, so that it causes contraction in that member, or else it affects the main member, and if you delay piercing it, it matures in the main member; or it is near the tail, therefore do not pierce it unless it is matured, lest it corrupt the parts within the tail, or unless it is made in the end of it so that it does not corrupt the parts within the tail and is prolonged to the parts within the tail, and a fistula be formed, or that it be made in its term so that it may not be healed.
Mays cove que tu sapias la hora de la perforacio de la apostema, e aysso es quan es maturat.	But know the time of piercing the ulcer, and then it is when it has matured.
E sapias que es madurat quan es la cedacio de la dolor e la cessacio de la febre, e aprop la diminucio de la rogor e de la pulsacio, e la acuitat del cap del apostema, e les autres senhals.	And know that it has matured when there is a decrease in pain and fever, and also the lessening of heat and pulse, and the sharpening of the tip of the ulcer, and the other signs.
E quar cove que sapias la perforacio cazer en le loc pus dejos del apostema e de pus venient de curacio de la eminencia.	And know that piercing occurs at the bottom of the pus-filled location of the ulcer and from the pus coming out of the eminence of its cure.
E perforacio tostemps sia per le lonc de la carn o del cors, si las apostemas son en las partidas de las mas o dels pes, e en loc dels lacertz, de las cordas dels nervis, de las arcerias; e, al derier, en totz locs enguals en les quals no es reflecio; quar en aquels que so reflectitz, usa de perforacio segon aquel membre.	And piercing should always be according to the length of the flesh or body, if the ulcers are on the ends of the hands or feet, and in the places of the tendons, of the strings of the nerves, of the bowstrings; and finally, in all similar locations in which there is no reflection: for in those where there is a reflection, use piercing according to that member.
Mays quan le apostema es en loc carnos, lahoras miels es que leysses la perforacio de lu entro que sia confermada la digestio de lu segon compliment, ayssi quo havem dit; quar si tu perforas aquel denant aquo, es prolonguat le cors del poyre de lu e de mota sordicia, e fort leu las labias de lu so enduradas e la profunditat de lu.	But when the ulcer is in a fleshy location, it is better to delay piercing it until its digestion is confirmed according to its fulfillment, as we have said; for if you pierce it before that, the body of the pus within it will be prolonged and there will be much corruption, and often its lips are hardened and its depth increased.
Mays alcus apostemas so perforatz segon la latitut de la carn o del cos deves la necessitat, o segon aquo del qual lo membre indigeys.	But some ulcers are pierced according to the breadth of the flesh or body, or according to which member is in need.
E cove que administres petita perforacio , e·n les apostemas grans gran perforacio e ampla o motas seccios segon la diversitat de la grandesa dels apostemas.	And you should administer small piercing in small ulcers, and in large ulcers great piercing and wide or many piercings according to the difference in the size of the ulcers.
E autras so dels apostemas en les quals cove que la codena sia conquavada e sia encidida, quan es fayta ayssi quo pan e fayta es en terme que ja stigua, ayssi cum aquel que accideys en trops de dubelec e de bubos.	And there are those in which the vein is hollowed out and has been cut, when it is done so that bread is made, and it is made in a term so that it may not be healed, just as that which occurs in pustules and blisters.
E de aquels so que so insciditz am seccio havent tres angles; e de aquels es en le qual es inscidit ayssi cum figura de fuelha de mirtra, ayssi cum las apostemas dels angonars.	And there are those in which it is cut with three angles; and there is that in which it is cut like the leaf of the myrrh tree, just as in the ulcers of the armpits.
E de lor so en les quals es administrada seccio redonda e seccio lunar, e semblantz ad aquels.	And there are those in which round section and moon-like section are administered to them, and they are similar to each other.
Mays aquel al qual no es cap ayssi cum son apostemas leons superficials, cove que tu perforas aquel am perforacio superficial, o plana tant solament.	But that one to which there is no head as in superficial ulcers, you should pierce it with superficial piercing or flat piercing only.
E cove quant le apostema es gros e ya ha colligit mota sania, que perfores aquel e no te coytes que extraguas tot le poyre en aquela hora; habantz extratz de aquel una partida, e aprop opila le apostema entro al autre dia, e aprop extratz una partida major, e aprop fa aquo motas veguadas segon graduacio entro que sia foro-getat.	And when the ulcer is large and has collected much pus, pierce it and do not be afraid to draw out all the pus in that hour; take some from it at one time, and then close up the ulcer for another day, and then take more at a greater time, and do this repeatedly until it is healed.
E majorment si·l malaute es de freol vertut, o femna prens, o enfant petit, o viel en decrepitut, quar l’esperit animal motas vetz es resolvut am la egressio de la sania, e fort leu mor le malaute, e tu operte les.	And especially if the patient is of a cold nature, or a woman in labor, or a small child, or an old person in decline, for the animal spirit is often resolved by the discharge of pus, and often the patient dies, and you should operate on them.
Don guarda aquest capitol am gran cautela, e aprop la tua perforacio en la qual perforas aquestz apostemas, cove que abstergescas las plagues e consideras donc si la plagua del apostema es pauca, o es una seccio plana, lahoras tu aministra las qualguas de li o de coto antic; e si le apostema es gran, e las fissuras de la perforacio son motas, lahoras cove que tu pauses meca en quascun trauc entro que pervenguan ensemps.	Keep this chapter with great caution, and then with your piercing by which you pierce these ulcers, wash the sloughs and consider therefore whether the slough of the ulcer is small or it is a flat section, then administer the oils of lard or of rose; and if the ulcer is large and its fissures are many, then pause the nail in each crack so that they may be filled.
E si en le apostema es abscindit una partida de la codena o has concavada aquela en le circuit, lahoras cove que tu la complescas de coto viel o de fil fayt de drap de li, ayssi cum quan has traytz pans o razizos, ses humiditat; e strenh aquel entro al tertz dia; e aprop proceseys aquel e cura le am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And if in the ulcer a part of the vein is cut or it is hollowed out within its circuit, then you should complete it with lard fat or cloth made from linen, just as when you have drawn out pus or roots, without moisture; and strengthen that within the third day; and then process it and heal it with what you will, according to its signs.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc en la hora de la operacio tua, lahoras tu aministra aygua frega e vi agre en les quals mules un drap de li, e pausa aquel sobre le loc del fluxs del sanc motas veguadas.	But if there is blood flow in the hour of your operation, then administer warm water and wine mixed with a cloth made from linen, and place that on the location of the blood flow many times.
Mays si persevera le fluxs del sanc, lahoras cove que tu aministres regiment e curacio e polveras las quals he recomtadas en motz locs de aquest nostre libre e de divisio.	But if the blood flow persists, then you should administer regimen and cure, and apply powders which I have recommended in many places of this our book and in division.
Mays si es en temps de hivern, e·l loc de la apostema es loc de motz nervis, lahoras cove que tu enfundas pulvils en vi e oli caut, e pauses aquels sobre les locs.	But if it is in the winter time, and the location of the ulcer is the location of many nerves, then you should pour powders into wine and oil and place those on the locations.
E si es en estiu, e les locs son carnoses, lahoras cove que tu pauses pulvils enbeguts am aygua e oli o am vi e oli, e tot aquo sia freg entro que sia le ters dia, ayssi cum havem dit, e lahoras cove que tu deslies le apostema e abstergescas aquel e aministres en la curacio de lu aquo que a lu conveneys entro que sia sanat.	And if it is summer, and the areas are fleshy, then you should apply powdered herbs mixed with water and oil or wine and oil, and let this mixture rest on the affected area for three days as we have said, and then you should open the blister and clean it and apply what is suitable for its healing.
E aysso es aquo que es necessari de la cognicio de la curacio de apostemas universalment, mays segon la via de distinccio ja he dit de tot apostema en qual manieyra es via de la cura de lu per capitols singularment.	And this is what is necessary to know about the treatment of blisters in general, but according to the method of distinction, I have already said about each type of blister and how to treat them specifically.
Capitol .xli.	Chapter 41.
De seccio de apostemas les quals veno en la codena del cap.	Of the incision of blisters which come on the nape of the neck.
En la codena del cap petitz apostemas, e so de specias de nodes les quals conteno tunicas que so a lor factz ; e las specias de lor so motas.	On the nape of the neck, there are small blisters, and they are made up of layers of membranes which are formed; and the layers are very thin.
E de lor son pingas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditat semblant a lima.	And from them are bumps, and from those come blisters containing humidity similar to lime.
E de aquelas so las quals conteno humiditat semblant a pols, et asemblantz a lor; e de aquelas so que son lapideas, durs.	And from them are those that contain humidity resembling powder, and resembling them; and from those are the ones that are stony, hard.
E en la seccio de totz, e en la extraccio de aquels no es temor, cum deves la exteccio de aquels no fa contrariat arceria.	And in the incision of all of them, and in the extraction of these there is no fear, as the extraction of these does not cause a pulse.
E la operacio en seccio de aquels es que tu esproes aquels am instrument la forma del qual ve aprop aysso, le qual es apelat entromes, entro que sapias que contengua.	And the operation in the incision of these is that you should press them with an instrument, the form of which is shown below, while knowing what they contain.
Quar si aquo que conte es humiditat, lahoras scindeys aquel am seccio segon la longitut per seccio superficial segon aquesta forma:	For if what it contains is humidity, then you should split it with an incision according to its length and a superficial cut according to this form:
E comensa en la seccio de la linha de .B. entro a la linha de .G. Donc cum la humiditat es evacuada, lahoras tu excoria aquela pel que conte aquela humiditat, e no leysses de aquela alcuna causa de tot, quar tropas veguadas retorna, si roman de aquela alcuna causa.	And you should start the incision along the line from B to G. Then, when the humidity is discharged, you should scrape away the membrane that contains the humidity, and do not leave any cause of it behind, as returning troops will come back if anything is left behind.
E aprop submergeys coto en enguent egipciach, si es present, e sino, en aygua e sal; e umpleys am aquel la plagua e layssa aquel entro ad autra dia, quar am aquo corrodeys tot so que es romas de aquela pellicula.	Then you should immerse the wound in Egyptian ointment if available, and if not, in water and salt; and fill it with that, and leave it for another day, as it will eat away at everything that is left of that membrane.
E aprop itera sobre aquel coto am enguent egipciach segondament e tersament si indigeyses de lu, entro que·t comfides que no y haia romas alcuna causa de aquela pellicula; lahoras cura la plagua am enguent entro que sia sanada.	Then you should apply Egyptian ointment to the wound again and again if it needs it, until you are sure that there is no cause for the membrane left; then heal the wound with ointment until it is healed.
E si apostema conte nodi gras, lahoras tu inscideys aquel segon aquesta forma:	And if the blister contains a fatty nodule, then you should incise it according to this form:
am seccio havent forma de crotz, e geta oncis entre doas labias de la seccio e scorsa aquel de tota partida, e esforsa la tua vertut en extraccio de la tunica la qual conte aquel.	by making an incision in the shape of a cross, and cut between the two lips of the incision and pierce it all the way through, and exert your strength in pulling out the membrane that contains it.
Mays si a tu arceria fa contrarieta, lahoras fay aquo que yeu t’e recontat primieyrament.	But if your pulse feels disturbed, then do what I told you at first.
E semblantment fay en le apostema lapificat de seccio e de curacio segon que a tu havem dit; e seccio sobre apostema lapificat es pus leugiera, quar es de pauc sanc e de pauca humiditat.	And similarly, do the same with the stony blister in terms of incision and treatment as we have said; and an incision on a stony blister is lighter, as it contains less blood and humidity.
E alcunas vetz so alcus de aquestz apostemas les quals so en le cap en alcus homes am los quals de tot no es humiditat; la qual causa es quar yeu inscindigui sobre un apostema en le cap de una femna vielha e atrobegui le apostema ayssi cum peyra sorda, aspra, blanqua, la qual no podia esser trinquada, e si a alcu fos am aquela percussit, plaguera aquel.	And sometimes some of these blisters occur on the nape of the neck in some people, and they do not contain humidity; the cause is that one struck an old woman on the nape of her neck and found the blister there hard, rough, white, and unable to be pierced, and if someone struck it, it bled.
Mays en les autres apostemas accidentz en le cap otra aquest no es aquest capitol, ayssi cum les apostemas que veno als caps dels enfantz e deves las razitz de las aurelhas, mays la seccio de aquestz totz sia seccio superficial.	But in other types of blisters on the nape of the neck, this is not the case as in the blisters that occur on children's heads due to the roots of the ears, but the incision of all of them should be a superficial cut.
E pausa la perforacio de aquels de la partida pus bassa de lor per so que sia alleujat le cos de la sania a las partidas pus bassas.	And make the incision of those from the lowest part of them so that the body is separated from the lowest parts.
E aprop cura aquelas am aquo que conveneys ad aquel de curacio.	Then heal those with what is suitable for their healing.
Capitol .xlii.	Chapter 42.
De seccio de scrophulas las quals accideyso en le col.	Of the incision of scrofula which occurs on the neck.
Motas veguadas endeveno aquestas apostemas en le colh e en las aysselhas e en les angonars; e alcunas veguadas accideyso en las autras partidas del cos.	These blisters often occur on the neck, armpits, and angles of the joints; and sometimes they occur in other parts of the body.
E so aquelas que accideysso en le colh, e so motas que so engendradas entre lor, e tota scrofula de aquelas es dintz la sua tunica propria, e ayssi cum en les nodis e apostema del cap, ayssi cum havem recomtat.	And those that occur on the neck are often generated among them, and all scrofula of these is within its own membrane, and similarly with nodes and blisters on the head as we have described.
E las specias de aquestas scrophulas son motas, quar de aquelas so alcunas lapideas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditatz, e de aquelas so malignas las quals no obeseysso a curacio.	And the nature of these scrofula is variable, as some are stony, and some contain humidity, and some are malignant and do not respond to treatment.
Donc en aquela la qual tu vezes de bona disposicio en le Tocament, de la qual la color de aquo que es manifest es propda a la color de la codena, e es mauguda a tota partida, e no es annexsa am le nervi del colh, ni am las venas, ni am la arceria, e no es preonda, cove que tu inscidiscas aquela am siccio superficial de la partida desus a la partida dejos del cos de la linha de .G. entro la linha de .B., e scorja aquela de tota partida, e exten dos labias de la codena am onci, o am motz oncis si has necessitat de aquels, ayssi cum havem dit en las apostemas del cap, e extratz aquela petit a petit.	Therefore, if you see good disposition in the touch, and the color of what is manifest is close to the color of the neck, and is spread out to all parts, and is not attached to the nerves of the neck, or the veins, or the pulse, and is not deep, then you should incise it with a superficial cut from above to below from the line from G to B, and pierce it completely, and cut off all its lips as we have said in blisters on the head, and extract it little by little.
E es mays cautela que no sia inscidida la vena o nervi.	And be more careful so that no vein or nerve is incised.
E sia le spatum no mot agut, que no ajuste a tu la tua ma am inscizio, o que enquiete le malaute, e que inscidas aquo que no es necessari inscidir; quar si inscideysses vena o arceria e prohibeys tu de la tua operacio, lahoras pausa en la plagua vetriol trissat o autras polveras las quals ostan fluxs de sanc, e estrenh la plagua, e layssa aquel entro que·s repausa la acuitat de la apostema e sia mollificada la plagua e comense esser poyrida.	And be careful not to cut with the scalpel so that it does not touch your hand with the incision, or the patient, and do not incise what is not necessary to be incised; for if you incise a vein or pulse and prohibited from your operation, then apply powdered vitriol or other powders which stop blood flow, and tighten the wound, and leave it until the sharpness of the blister is relieved and the wound becomes soft and starts to discharge.
Quan le sanc es abscindit.	When the blood has been stopped.
Donc retorna a la tua operacio entro que l’aias complida.	Then return to your operation until you have finished.
E aprop inquireys am le tieu dit indic si es romas alcuna causa de las autras petitas scrophulas, donc inscideys aquelas e munda aquelas.	And then inquire with your finger if there is any cause for the other small scrofula, so incise them and clean them.
E si es en la razit de la scrophula gran vena, cove lahoras que no inscidas aquela scrophula de la sua razitz.	And if it is in the root of the large scrofula vein, then you should not incise that scrofula from its roots.
Abantz cove que lies aquela am fiel doblat fort e que leysses aquela entro que caia per si ses nocument.	First, fold a piece of cloth tightly and place it over the blister so that you see it falling down by itself without causing harm.
E aprop omple la plagua de coto vielh le qual tu has ja submirgit en enguent egipciac, e aprop cura aquel.	Then fill the wound with old oil which you have already soaked in Egyptian ointment, and then heal it.
E si inscides aquela scrophula tota, lahoras cove que tu ajustes las doas labias de la plagua e cuzas2 tantost pus que no y ha romasa deguna superfluitat.	And if you have incised that scrofula completely, then you should tie the two lips of the wound and cut off as much pus as possible so that no surplus remains.
Mays si tu vezes que haia romasa superfluitat per la grandeza de la scrofula, cove que tu entendas a inscidir la razit de aquela, e astrayra aquela e aministra sutura e aquo que es dit.	But if you see that surplus has remained due to the size of the scrofula, then understand that you must incise its root, and pierce it and administer cauterization and what is said.
E aquela de las scrophulas que conteno humiditatz, perfora aquela am perforacio superficial aqui la on appar a tu le loc de maturacio de lu, e pausa perforacio de aquo que siec le pus bas del cos, ayssi cum havem dit.	And those of the scrofula that contain humidity, pierce it with a superficial incision where you see the location of its maturation, and stop the piercing from what is the lowest part of the body as we have said.
E aprop aministra perforacio, calguas am enguent e semblantz ad aquels, per so que corroda aquo que es romas de la corropcio.	Then administer cauterization, oil, and similarly to those, so that it eats away what is left of the cautery.
E aprop quan tu vezes la plagua ja esser mundada, lahoras tu cura aquela am enguent de carn generatiu entro que sia sanada.	And then when you see the wound already cleaned, then heal it with generative ointment so that it is healed.
Capitol .xliii.	Chapter 43.
De seccio del pilhot del apostema accident dintz le guolayro.	Of the incision of the pimple of the blister which occurs within the neck.
Diyssero les antics aquesta seccio en le epilhot, e no vist alcu hom en nostra terra que aquela aia fayta.	They have tried this incision on the pimple, and we have not seen anyone in our land who it did.
E aquesta es la inscriptura del sermo de aquels.	And this is the inscription of its name.
Mays en les homes haventz esquinencia, cove que sia esquivada la extraccio del epilhot, cum per aquo no sia fayt juvament per so quar totas las venas e las majors del malaute so aqui.	But in men who have a fever, then the extraction of the pimple should be avoided, as long as all the veins and the major nerves of the neck are not cut off.
Mays en aquels que han apostemas cautz en la boca o guolayro o dos aurelhas, quan la malautia no es en la cana, cove husar de la seccio de epilhot a fugir la perdicio la qual es fayta per perfocacio.	But in those who have sores in the mouth or throat or two ears, when the disease is not in the brain, one must use the section of epilhot to avoid the loss that is made by piercing.
Donc cove quan volem aquo, que inscidam le epilhot dejos tres cercles dels cercles del epilhot, o quatre am petita seccio per la latitut en aquel que es entre dos cercles per quantitat, que la seccio sia en ciphac, no en la cartillage, e aquest loc es convenent a seccio, quar es privat de carn e les vayselhs de sanc de lu son luhen.	Therefore, when we want to do this, we must cut the epiglottis below the three circles of the epiglottis, or four with a small section according to the width in that which is between two circles in terms of quantity; the section should be in the soft tissue, not in the cartilage, and this place is suitable for sectioning, because it is deprived of flesh and its blood vessels are light.
E si le metge es pauruc, cove lahoras que extenda la codena del golayro am onci, e aprop fenda la codena entro que pervengua a la canal, mays evite les vaysels de sanc si vetz de aquelas alcuna causa.	And if the doctor is fearful, one must sometimes extend the string of the larynx with an instrument, and then split the string so that it reaches the larynx, but avoid the blood vessels if for any reason you see them.
E aprop inscida li ciplach segon que havem recomtat; e es significat sobre la seccio de la canal per le flacma le qual es de aquela eyssit am aquo que es de lu disromput e per la abscizio de la votz.	And then cut the palate according to what we have recounted; and it is significant about the section of the larynx by the flame which is from that exit, having been split apart and through the absence of the voice.
E layssa la plagua uberta per alcun temps.	And let the wound remain open for some time.
Donc cum la hora es remauguda en la qual perforacio es temuda, agregua doas labias de la codena de la plagua, e cus aquela sola ses la cartillage.	Therefore, when the time is past in which piercing is feared, sew together the two lips of the wound of the palate, and sew only to the cartilage.
E aprop administra medicinas que fan naysser la carn entro que sia sanat.	And then administer medicines that cause flesh to grow within so that it may be healed.
E diyssec Albucasis que la summa del sermo le qual havem recomtat, exposicio no es sino que veias que alcus de aquetz apostemas ja han opilat lo guolayro del malaute, e le malaute es vengut entro a mort, e le ale de lu es entresecat, e alcus van a inscidir le epiglos per so que respire le malaute sobre le loc de la plagua per alcuna respiracio, e sia salvat de mort.	And Albucasis says that the sum of our speech, which we have recounted, is an explanation; that some of these sores have oppressed the larynx of the patient, and the patient has come inside to death, and his throat is choked, and someone goes to cut the epiglottis so that the patient may breathe through the wound's location by any respiration, and be saved from death.
E per aquo comandero layssar la plagua uberta entro que sia consumida la malicia de la malautia; e es la malicia de lu per tres dias; e donc lahoras comandero cosi la plagua, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And for this, I command that the wound remain open until the malice of the disease is consumed; and its malice lasts for three days; and therefore, then I command to sew up the wound, and cure that within which it may be healed.
E aquo que yeu he vist per mi meteys, es que una sirventa pres un cotel e mesec le en le sieu golayro e inscidic am aquel una partida de la cana del pulmo, e yeu fu apelat a la curacio de lu, e atrobegui la mugen ayssi cum es mugit del moridos, e descubrigui la plagua e atrobegui le sanc le qual era yssit de la plagua petit.	And what I have seen by my servants is that a servant pressed a hot iron to his throat and cut into it a part of the stalk of the lung, and I was called to his cure, and found the mucous membrane as if it were that of a corpse, and discovered the wound and found the blood which had been oozing from the wound.
Donc yeu fo confessat que aquela no havia inscidit vena ni guidegi, e le vent yssia de la plagua, e curegui aquela entro que foc sanada.	Therefore, I was confessed that she had not cut a vein nor an artery, and the wind came out of the wound, and I cured that within which the fire healed.
E no accidic a la sirventa si no rauquiera en la votz, e aprop alcus dias retornec ad miloracio de las suas dispozicios.	And I did not accuse the servant unless he had spoken with his voice, and then after some days he returned to the improvement of his dispositions.
E ara dic yeu que en la seccio del epilhot no ha temor.	And now I say that in the sectioning of the epiglottis there is no fear.
Capitol .xliv.	Chapter 44.
De seccio sobre apostema le qual accideys en le golayro defora, e es apelat hernia del golayro.	Of sectioning upon a sore which occurs in the exterior throat, and is called a hernia of the throat.
Aquest apostema nompnat hernia del golayro es apostema gran segon la color del cors, e es mot en las femnas.	This apostema named hernia of the throat is a great sore according to the color of the body, and occurs in women.
E es segon dos manieyras, quar o es natural o accidental.	And it occurs in two ways; for it is either natural or accidental.
E en le natural no es engen de curar.	And the natural one has no means of being cured.
E l’accidental es segon dos manieyras del qual la un es semblant a nodes grasses, e l’autra manieyra es semblant apostema le qual es fayt per nodacio de arteria, e en aquel es temor.	And the accidental one is according to two ways; of which the first is similar to fatty nodes, and the other way is similar to a sore which is made by knotting of an artery, and in that there is fear.
E no cove que·s fassa presumpcio a lu cum ferr sino en aquel que es petit.	And let him not make presumption upon it with iron unless it is small.
E tu proha aquel e investigua aquel am le dit, e si atrobas lu semblant a nodi gras, e no es suspendut am alcuna de las venas, lahoras tu inscideys aquel ayssi cum les nodes, e extratz aquel am aquo que conte lu de la pel e bursiclam; e sino, lahoras es perscrutat tot le sieu esser, e aprop cura le loc am aquo que cove de curacio entro que sia sanat.	And you probe it and investigate it with the finger, and if you find it to be similar to a fatty node, and not suspended by any of the veins, then you cut it as well as the nodes, and extract that with what contains it of the membrane and bursa; and if not, then it is probed throughout its being, and the place is cured with what means of cure within so that it may be healed.
Capitol .xlv.	Chapter 45.
De seccio de las specias de nodes.	Of sectioning of the species of nodes.
Dels nodes so motas specias e yeu ja he dit totas las specias de lor en la divisio.	The nodes occur with many species, and I have already spoken of all their species in the division.
E cove que yeu recomte assi la diferencia entre node e exitura cum fassa dubitacio.	And let him who doubts the difference between a node and an exit wound.
Donc yeu dic que am exitura es caliditat e febre e dolors vehementz entro que es sedada la ebullicio de la superfluitat; e es complida putrefaccio que lahora cessa la febre, la dolor e la calor.	Therefore I say that with an exit wound there is heat and fever and violent pains within so that the ebullition of superfluity is allayed; and it is fulfilled putrefaction when the fever, pain and heat cease.
Mays am node no es caliditat ni febre ni dolor, e conte aquel ciphac leon le qual es al u sac propri.	But with a node there is no heat or fever or pain, and it contains that leon which is in the proper sac.
E es segon la color del cors, e le comensament de lu es cum un ceze e es fayt ayssi cum vace, sia major o minor, e son segon dos specias, quar o so grassas e conteno humiditat, e las colors de la humiditat son motas, segon que yeu diyssi en la divisio.	And it is according to the color of the body, and its commencement is with a cough and it occurs thus with phlegm, whether major or minor, and they are according to two species; for some are fatty and contain humidity, and the colors of humidity are many, according to what I have spoken in the division.
Donc cove, quan pervenas a la curacio de node, que exprohes aquel e inquiras aquel al comensament am sturment le qual es apelat intromes, segon que vindra la sua forma en le capitol le qual es aprop aquest.	Therefore, when you come to the cure of a node, let him probe it and investigate it as to its commencement with an instrument which is called an intromis, according to what its form will come in the chapter which is next.
E es manieyra de inquisicio de apostemas e de totz nodes, e es que tu prenguas aquest sturment e entromet aquel en le loc pus humit le qual atrobas en le apostema, e tu revolveras les tieus ditz am aquel petit a petit entro que sapias que·l sturment ja ha penetrat la codena.	And it is the manner of investigation of sores and of all nodes; and it is that you take this instrument and insert it in the most humid place which you find in the sore, and you rotate your fingers with it little by little within so that you know that the instrument has penetrated the membrane.
E aprop ultima la tua ma segon la mesura de la grandeza del apostema, e aprop extratz le entromes e considera aquo que es yssit en le vestigi de lu.	And then close your hand according to the measure of the size of the sore, and extract the intromis and consider what has been oozed in its trail.
E si es fora-getada la humiditat corrent, de qualque color sia, lahoras tu le inscideys am seccio superficial segon que he dit en les autres apostemas.	And if the oozing humidity has ceased, whatever its color is, then you cut it with superficial section according to what I have said in the other sores.
E si del vestigi de l’intromes no hieys humiditat, lahoras sapias que es gras.	And if from the trail of the intromis there is no oozing humidity, then know that it is fatty.
E secca sobre lu am seccio havent forma de crotz segon aquesta forma:	And dry over it with section having the form of crosses according to this form:
ayssi cum t’e ensenhat, e suspen aquel am oncis, e excorja la codena de tota part am facilitat, e guarda la pel o sac, si podes, sobre aquel e extraguas aquela sania am le node.	in this way as you have taught him, and suspend that with hooks, and cut the membrane of all parts with facility, and guard the membrane or sac, if you can, over it, and extract that pus with the node.
Mays si es romput en la operacio, no es possible extrayre aquela sana, e motas veguadas endeve aquo, e lahoras tu la extratz a pessas entro que de lu no romangua denguna causa.	But if it is broken in the operation, it is not possible to extract that pus, and many times it will happen thus, and then you extract it at intervals within so that from it no rupture any cause.
Quar si de lu roman denguna causa, pauc o trop, le node retorne segon le mays.	For if from it any cause does not cease completely, a little or much, the node returns according to the most.
