E si tu vezes que de lu roman alcuna part petita, lahoras comple la plagua de alcunas polveras corrosivas agudas e strenh la plagua, e pausa sobre aquela que sede apostema caut, e cura aquel del autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	And if you see that from it any part has ceased a little, then complete the wound of some corrosive powders and strengthen the wound, and pause over that which seat the sore cauterize, and cure that by another cure within so that it may be healed.
E si es node gran, lahoras tu cus las doas labias de lu e cura aquel am aquo que encarna.	And if it is a great node, then you cut the two lips of it and cure that with what encases.
Mays si vena pulsatil es a lu contraria, o no-pulsatil, lahoras tu coyta e huemple le loc de zegi trissat que es vetriol e leyssa aquel streyt per dos dias o per tres entro que·s poyresca la plagua e que repause la ebullicio del sanc; e aprop retorna a inscindir aquo que es romas del node.	But if the vein is pulsating contrary to it, or not pulsating, then you cut and plug the site of the wound which is vetriol and let it be for two or three days within so that the swelling of the wound ceases and the ebullient of the blood; and then return to sectioning where it is broken from the node.

Capitol .xlvii.	Chapter XLVII.
De la cura de las mamillas dels homes las quals so asembladas de femnas.	Of the cure of women's breasts, which are like those of females.
Alcunas veguadas so infladas las mamillas de alcus homes deves le compliment del dormir cum comensan esser pellutz, e aprop so infladas las mamillas, e so asembladas las mamillas de las femnas, e romano apostemosas, lejas.	Some men's breasts are swollen due to the complement of sleep when they begin to be hairy; and then their breasts are swollen, and their breasts are like those of women, and are Roman-like, lean.
E ad aquel que avoreys aquo, cove que inscidisca aquelas am seccio lunar segon aquesta forma, de la linha de .B. entro a la linha de .G., e aprop excorja la groceza tota, e aprop uempla la plagua de medicament encarnatiu, e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am cosidura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And when you pierce those according to this, from the line of B. to the line of G., and then cut out the whole pouch, and fill the wound with medicine, and then close the two lips of the wound with a stitch, and heal it.
Mays si la mamilla declina a las partidas dejos e es mollificada per la sua magnitut ayssi cum endeve a las femnas, lahoras sia fendut en dos latz sieus pus sobiras, am dos seccios semblantz a figura lunar, de las quals quascuna sia contenguda en l’autra deves la fi de quascuna, entro que sia que la linha major contengua la menor segon aquesta forma de la linha de .B. e la linha de .G. E aprop excorja la codena la qual es entre dos labias de la plagua, e osta la pingueza, e aministra aquo que havem dit de la sutura e de las polveras aquo que es necessari en la curacio entro que sia sanat.	But if the breast sags to the sides and is softened by its weight like that of women, then it is split into two sides, with two cuts resembling a lunar figure, of which each contains the other according to the shape from line B. to line G. And then cut out the pouch, and close up the two lips of the wound with a stitch, and heal it.
E si tu non conpleysses la inscizio de aquo que cove inscidir per la inquietut del malaute, e per flux de sanc, lahoras cove que huemplas la plagua de coto submergit en enguent corrosiu e layssa aquel entro que aquo corroda que es romas de la grayssa, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if you do not complete the incision of that which you intend to pierce due to the restlessness of the patient, and due to the flow of blood, then fill the wound with a cut submerged in corrosive ointment and let it rot away, and heal that which corroded is like that of the ulcer.
Capitol .xlviii.	Chapter XLVIII.
De perforacio de apostemas que veno dejos le titillic.	Of piercing abscesses that come from below the tip of the needle.
Aquetz apostemas que veno dejos le titillic so de las specias de scrophulas, durs, las quals conte una pel que es sac.	Abscesses that come from below the tip of the needle are of the species of scrofula, hard, which contain a membrane that is thin.
E de aquelas so alcunas que conteno humiditatz; e aquelas que conteno humiditatz cove que sian inscididas am seccio lunar segon aquesta figura: de la linha de .G. a la linha de .B. E cum es tot evacuat aquo que es en le apostema de la sania, lahoras tu le comple de coto viel e leysa le entro al autra dia.	And some contain moisture; and some that are punctured according to this lunar section: from line G. to line B. And when the pus is completely evacuated from the abscess of the gland, then you fill it with a cut short and let it rot away into the other day.
E aprop le coto sia ostat e sia curat am enguent convenient ad aquo, entro que sia sanat.	And then the cut is closed and healed with convenient ointment into that, when it is healed.
E si le apostema de las specias dels nodes es, e de las scrophulas, lahoras tu scindeys sobre aquel ayssi cum havem dit en la seccio sobre las scrophulas engualment.	And if the abscess of the species of the joints is, and of scrofula, then you split it on that like that we have said in the section above scrofula with a split.
May si la plagua es extenduda en aysso que yesca poyredura, lahoras administra en lu cauteri segon que en aquo havem denant dit.	And if the plague has spread so that it causes necrosis, then administer cauterization to him as we have already said before.
Capitol .xlix.	Chapter 49.
De seccio de apostemas que accideysso per arceria o per vena.	Of incisions on ulcers that occur through an artery or a vein.
Quan arceria es rompuda, e la codena es consolidada la qual es sobre aquela, lahoras motas veguadas accideys apostema E les senhals per les quals es conoguda que imflamacio e apostema sian per la arteria o per vena: quar quan apostema es per arceria es lonc agreguat en le preon del cors; e que quan inpelleysses le apostema am les tieus ditz, sentes en lu quays sia stridor.	And if an artery is broken and the vein above it is hardened, then pustules occur; and by these signs you know that inflammation and pustule are caused by an artery or a vein: for when the pustule is caused by an artery, it is found in the lower part of the body; and when you press the pustule with your fingers, you feel that there is a pulsing in it.
E aquel que es per vena es redon al manifest del cors.	And that which is caused by a vein is roundish and raised on the surface of the body.
E seccio sobre aquest apostema es error, e majorment en aquel que es dejos las aysselhas, e en les angonars, e en le col, e en motz locs del cors; e es mot gran, donc cove que la sua curacio am ferr sia esquivada, e aquel que es en las extramitatz, o al cap, cove que sia evitat.	And an incision on this pustule is harmful, and especially in that which is below the elbow, and in the armpits, and in the neck, and in many places of the body; and it is very large, so one should avoid its cure by cautery, and that which is in the extremities, or the head, should be avoided.
Mays sobre aquel que es de lor per imflacio de l’orrifici de la arceria, scindeys en la codena seccio en le lonc; e aprop huebre la seccio am uncis e aprop la arceria, e deliura de las tunicas entro que sia descuberta.	But in that which is above caused by inflammation of the orifice of the artery, make an incision in the vein in the long direction; and then open the incision with nails, and discover the artery and the veins underneath it.
E aprop met sobre aquel agulha e fay aquela penetrar entro al autre latz, e estrenh la arceria am fiel doble en dos locs, — la qual causa yeu a tu eyssenhegui en extraccio de doas arcerias les quals so en les templars.	And then put an awl over it and make it penetrate to the other side, and ligature the artery with a double thread in two places — which causes that you are in great pain in the extraction of two arteries which are in the temples.
E aprop punh le loc le qual es entre dos liamentz am spatum entro que yesca le sanc tot que es en lu, e sia dissolvut le apostema.	And then stab the place between the two bones with a spatular instrument until the blood flows out of it, and dissolve the pustule.
E aprop administra curacio en la qual es engendrat poyre entro que caian les liamentz; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz convenientz ad aquo entro que sia sanat.	And then administer a cure in which pus is engendered, until the bones fall away from each other; and then cure that with an appropriate ointment until it is healed.
E si es apostema per seccio de vena, lahoras cove que tu tenguas am la tua ma aquo que es a tu possible del apostema am la codena, e aprop intromet la agulha dejos le loc le qual tu has tengut dejos la tua ma, e fay aquela penetrar; e sia en aquela fil doble entro que tu extraguas aquel del autre latz, e aprop ligua le apostema am bo liament segon que yeu he dit a tu en le liament de uva4 de doas partz am doas extremitatz del fil.	And if it is a pustule caused by an incision of a vein, then you must hold with your hand what you can of the pustule over the vein, and then thrust in the awl below the place which you have held with your hand, and make it penetrate; and let there be a thread doubled in two places so that you extract that from the other side, and then ligature the pustule with a good ligament according to what I have said to you about the ligament of the grape in two parts with two extremities.
Mays si temes que extraguam le fil, lahoras entromet le fiel am aquela agula dejos tot le apostema deves la inscizio de la agulha primieyra, e strenh les tieus fiels en quatre locs.	But if you fear that the thread will be extracted, then thrust in the needle below all the pustule after the incision of the first needle, and ligature your threads in four places.
Aprop secca le apostema en le mieg loc de lu entro que quan es yssit aquo que es en lu, lahoras tu inscideys la superfluitat de la codena, e layssa aquo que de lu es liat.	Then dry up the pustule in its middle place so that when it is dried up what is in it will come out; and then you cut off the superfluity of the vein, and leave what is attached to it.
E aprop pausa sobre lu pulvil le qual has submergit en vi e oli, e aprop administra la curacio la qual es fayta am calguas e enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And then put dust over it which you have dipped in wine and oil, and then administer the cure which is made with hot water and ointment until it is healed.
Capitol l del apostema le qual accideys per torcio de nervis.	Chapter 50 of the pustule which occurs by twisting of nerves.
Ayssi cum accideys apostema en arceria e en vena, e semblantment accideys apostema en les nervis quan accideys en lor percussio o accideys per trebal superfluable, e per semblantz.	Just as pustules occur in arteries and veins, so pustules similarly occur in nerves when they occur from a blow or occur from excess work, and likewise.
E es fayt le mays de lu en les locs dels adjutoris o del talo, o en tot loc en le qual so maugudas las juncturas.	And it is done in the places of the assistants or of the foot, or in any place in which the joints are bruised.
E es apostema greu, e es asemblat a la color del autre cors, e es en las majors de lu disposicios ses de lor e quan es streyt am vehementia, sent en lu le malaute semblant stupor.	And it is a serious pustule, and it resembles the color of the rest of the body, and in its major parts it has no pulse, and when it is pressed with force, the patient feels a stupor.
E no es apostema agreguat en le preon del cors, e per so es dejos la codena, e el es maugut a tota partida e no va a las partidas denant ni detras.	And it is not a pustule aggregated in the lower part of the body, and because of that it is below the vein, and it is bruised all over, and it does not go to the parts in front or behind.
Donc aquo de aquels que es en las juncturas no cove que sia envasit am ferr, quar fort leu endevenguera contracio.	Therefore, that which is in the joints should not be cauterized with iron, for it would certainly produce contraction.
Mays aquel que es en le cap o en le front fen la codena am spatum.	But that which is on the head or forehead, open the vein with a spatular instrument.
Mays si es apostema pauc, lahoras te aquel am les forfecs e abscindeys aquel de razitz.	But if it is a small pustule, then grab it with forceps and cut it out by its roots.
E si es gran, lahoras tu le suspen am unci, e excorja aquel, e aprop osta aquel; e ajusta la plagua am sutura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if it is large, then suspend it with a hook and cut it out; and then stab that, and close up the wound with a suture, and cure it until it is healed.
Capitol .li.	Chapter 51.
De seccio de apostema le qual accideys de cheil que accideys al ventre.	Of incisions on pustules which occur on the jaw, and also occur in the belly.
Endeveno ad alcus homes motas veguadas en les ventres de aquels e en las autras partidas del cors de aquels theils les quals son apelatz funguals per similitut de aquels am funges, dels quals la razitz es subtil e·l cap de aquel es gros; e ja las labias de aquels so conversas, e es de aquels que es petit, e es de aquels que es mot magnificat.	It happens to some men that they have many pustules on their bellies and other parts of their bodies which are called ulcers because they resemble fungi; the roots of these are fine but the heads are large; and already their lips are wasted away, and they are found in small and also large people.
E yeu ja e vist un, e en le ventre de lu eran dos theils les quals eran mays a funges semblantz, e no era diferencia entre aquels blancs, de menuda razitz.	And I myself have seen one, and on his belly were two pustules which were like fungi, and there was no difference between them but that they were white and fine-rooted.
E ja las labias de aquels eran enversadas e se fendian, e humiditat corria de aquel tot temps.	And already the lips of these were turned inside out and were split, and moisture ran from them all the time.
Donc yeu inscidegui aquels e atrobegui en la un en pes quays xviii unc. e l’autre quays vi unc.	Therefore, I opened those and found in one 18 inches of pus. And the other six inches.
E la operacio en la inscizio de lor es que consideres lahoras si·l malaute es humit, e la color de atheil es blanca, humit, de subtil razitz; lahoras tu le inscideys am spatum lat, e sian en la presencia tua cauteris en le foc, quar motas veguadas deves la seccio de lu es expellit mot sanc; e si te ventz le sanc, cauteriza aquel.	And the operation at its incision is that you consider whether the patient is cold and his color white, cold, of fine roots; then you open it with a spatular instrument on the side, and let there be cauterization in the fire, for much blood is expelled through the incision; and if wind comes out of the wound, cauterize it.
E si vezes le malaute pauruc e temeros, guarda te de inscizio am ferr; mays lahoras pren fiel de plom recent fayt, e strenh am aquel atheil, la manieyra del qual es aquela que havem dita; e leyssa aquel per dos dias.	And if the patient is frightened and fearful, beware of cauterization with iron; but take a recently-made thread of lead, and ligature that pustule, the manner of which we have said before; and let it be for two days.
E aprop ajusta en la strictura del fil de plom; donc, no cesses strenher le plom granre devetz en theil, entro que sia abscindit e cayha per se ses trebalh.	And then tighten the lead thread; therefore, do not cease to tighten the large thread on the pustule until it is cut off and falls away because of its work.
Mays si theil es de grossa razitz, lahoras en la inscizio de lu es alcuna causa de temor e de paor, e majorment en aquel que es en le ventre.	But if the pustule is of coarse roots, then in its incision there is some cause for fear and horror, and especially in that which is in the belly.
Mays possibla es que tu inscindas la maytat de lu , e aprop cauteriza aquel per que no retorne.	But it is possible that you open the matrix of it, and then cauterize it so that it does not return.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanada la plagua.	And then cure it until the wound is healed.
E guarda te que tu no presumas inscidir theil le qual es de fusca color, de pauc sentiment, de leg reguardament, quar aquel es absi cancros.	And beware that you do not presume to open a pustule which is of dusky color, with little feeling, of light touch, for such a one is full of cancer.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio de cranc aprop aysso.	And you will know by memory of scrofula.
Capitol .lii.	Chapter 52.
De curacio de eminencia del umbilic.	Of cure of the eminence of the navel.
Eminencia del umbilic es fayta per motas causas; o per fissuras del ciphac le qual es sobre le ventre, e yeys de lu la tela o budel segon que endeve en las autras rupturas; o per sanc le qual flueys de vena o de arceria segon que es denant dit, o per ventositat coarctada en lu.	Eminence of the navel is caused by many causes: or by fissures of the hip which is on the belly, and its membrane or intestine according to that it goes into other ruptures; or from blood which flows out of a vein or artery as has been said before, or from constriction constricted in it.
Mays si es per fissura del ciphac e per yssiment de la tela, lahoras la color del apostema es semblant a la color del cors; e es leon ses dolor, e aprop appar de divers situament.	But if it is from fissure of the hip and constriction of the membrane, then the color of the pustule is like the color of the body; and there is little pain in it, and likewise appears in various situations.
E si es per egressio del budel, lahoras le situament de aquel am lu de aquo que havem recontat, de mays vehement diversitat, e cum tu premes aquel am les tieus ditz es occultat, e aprop retorna; e fort leu es am lu so, e es magnificat mot deves le introt de banh e vehement trebalh.	And if it is from egress of the intestine, then its situation according to that we have recounted, of more violent diversity, and when you press it with your fingers it is concealed, and then returns; and it is very strong in it, and it is magnified a lot because of the taking of a bath and vehement work.
Mays si per humiditat, lahoras es leon e no es occultat quan premes am la tua ma, ni es constrengut, ni es cregut.	But if it is due to humidity, then it is a lion and will not be hidden when you touch it with your hand, nor constrained, nor crushed.
E si es per sanc, lahoras am aquestz senhals apareys le apostema a negror declinant.	And if it is due to blood, then these signs will appear as an ulceration turning black in color.
Mays si es per carn nada, lahoras es apostema greu, gros e dur, e es ficat segon una quantitat.	But if it is due to a wound, then it is a heavy, thick and hard ulceration, and its size depends on the amount of damage.
Mays si es per ventositat, lahoras le tocament de lu es leon.	But if it is due to windiness, then its touch is sharp like a lion's.
E la operacio en lu es que consideras lahoras si la eminencia de l’umbilic es per sanc de arceria, o de vena, o per ventositat; lahoras cove que sias prohibit de la curacio de lu, quar en aquela es temor e paor ayssi cum t’e ensenhat en le capitol en le qual he dit les apostemas per arceria e per vena.	And the operation on it is that you consider whether the protrusion of the navel is due to arterial blood, or venous blood, or windiness; then you must abstain from treating it, for in that place there is fear and danger as I have taught you in the chapter where I spoke of ulcers from arteries and veins.
E si la eminencia del umbilic es per le budel o per la tela, lahoras cove que comandes al malaute que tengua le ale sieu, e sia stant extendut; e aprop senha am tenta en le circuit de tot le umbilic, e aprop comanda a lu que stia envers entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos, e aprop circunda am spatum lat en le circuit del umbilic sobre le loc le qual has senhat am la tenta; e aprop exten la maytat del apostema a las partidas desus am unci gran; e aprop lia en le circuit am fiel fort o am ceda e la manieyra del liar decent.	And if the protrusion of the navel is due to the intestine or hernia, then you must command the patient to hold his breath and be standing extended; then you touch all around the circumference of the navel, and you command him to breathe in while you press your hands against his chest, and then you encircle with a wide sponge the circumference of the navel over the area which you have marked with your touch; then extend half of the ulcer up towards its roots with a large swab; and bind it around with strong linen or ceda and the manner of binding decently.
E aprop huebre le mieg del apostema extendut sobre le liament e intromet le dit tieu en aquel indic e quereys le budel; e si tu l’as atrobat ni guardat per le liament, lahoras tu extratz alxorati e impelleys le budel a las partidas dedintz del ventre.	And then open the middle of the extended ulcer towards the navel and put your finger in that opening and feel for the intestine; and if you have caught it or held it with the ligature, then you extract gently and push the intestine back into the interior of the abdomen.
E si has atrobada la tela, lahoras pren aquel am unci; e inscideys las superfluitatz de lu.	And if you have caught the hernia, then take it with a swab; and cut off the excesses of it.
Mays si es contraria a tu arceria o vena, lahoras circunda aquel mot, e aprop retorna a la tua operacio; e pren dos agulhas e met en aquelas dos fiels fortz e entromet dos agulhas en le circuit le qual has feyt entorn le apostema en manieyra de crotz, las quals fassas penetrar; e aprop strenh le apostema en quatre partidas sobre las agulhas.	But if it is contrary to your artery or vein, then encircle that part, and then return to your operation; and take two needles and put in those two strong threads, and insert the two needles in the circumference which you have made around the ulcer in the shape of a cross, letting them penetrate; then tighten the ulcer in four places on the needles.
E si tu vols, osta las agulhas e leyssa le loc entro que poyresca la carn extenduda e caia per si; o inscideys aquel quan es subtiliat e se poyreys, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And if you wish, remove the needles and let the extended flesh fall back into place and heal by itself; or cut off what is superfluous and let it drop, then treat that with a poultice so that it may heal.
E si la eminencia del ombilic es de carn nada en lu o per humiditat, lahoras cove que tu conquaves le apostema ayssi cum havem dit e estraguas le sanc o la humiditat, la qual atrobas en lu, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove e que consolide le loc.	And if the protrusion of the navel is due to a wound in it or due to humidity, then you must hollow out the ulcer as we have said and draw out the blood or humidity which you find in it, then treat that with water so that it may be healed and consolidated.

De curacio de cranc.	On the treatment of hernia.
Ja havem dit, en la divisio, de specia de cranc e en qual manieyra es via a la curacio de lu am medicinas, e que es squivador en lu la curacio am ferr per so que no sia ulcerat; e havem dit cranc engendrat en la mayra e cautela de la curacio de lu.	We have already said, in the division, of the species of hernia and in what manner there is a way to its cure with medicines, and that it is distinguished in it the cure with iron so that it not be ulcerated; and we have said that hernia is engendered in the mother and cautery of its cure.
E diyssero les antics que alcunas veguadas cranc es en loc on es possibla la eradicacio de lu, ayssi cum de cran le qual es en las mamillas o en la coyssa e a lor semblantz dels membres allocat a estrayre tot aquel, e majorment quan es comensant petit.	And the ancients said that sometimes hernia is in a place where its eradication is possible, as of the kind which is in the breasts or in the groin and to their like parts assigned to be extracted entirely, and especially when it begins small.
Mays quan es antiquat e es gra, no cove que te propries a lu, quar yeu non pogui sanar de aquel alcu ni no he vist autre, ni que sia pervengut ad aquo.	But when it is old and large, you must not expect from it any better, for I have not seen any of those heal nor come to that.

And the operation on it is, when it is assigned as we have said, that you precede and leave the patient and purge him of black bile sometimes, then you bleed him, if there is found a manifest fullness.
E aprop prepara le malaute am preparacio en le qual sia locat am operacio, e aprop prohiceys en le trauc uncis les quals cove ad aquel; e aprop concava de tota part am la codena sego bona perexcrutacio entro que no romangua alcuna causa de las razitz de lu.	And then prepare the patient with preparation in which he may be placed for operation, and then pierce through the tract claws which are suited to it; then hollow out all around with a good sharp saw without breaking any of its roots.
E layssa correr le sanc, e no abscidas aquel leugierament, e exprem les locs, e abstergeys le sanc gros tot am la tua ma o am instrument am le qual es a tu possible dels instruments.	And let the blood flow, and do not extract it too gently, then squeeze out the places, and wipe away the clotted blood all over with your hand or an instrument with which it is possible to you of instruments.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat de sanc gros inscizio de vena o de arceria, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que·l flux del sanc sia cessat, e aprop cura aquel am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	But if it opposes you with clotted blood from an artery or vein, then cauterize that so that the flow of blood may cease, and then treat that with another cure so that it may be healed.
Capitol .liv.	Chapter 54.
De curacio de ydropici.	On the treatment of dropsy.
Nos ja havem recomtat, en la divisio, de las specias de ydropici de l’aygua, e les senhals de quascuna especia, de la curacio de lu am medicinas.	We have already recommended, in the division, of the species of dropsy from water, and the signs of each species, of its cure with medicines.

And when you have treated that species of dropsy timpany with medicines and it does not confer your medicine, then consider, for if the patient already has acquired debility, or is to another malady another dropsy, as it is in him hoarseness or abdominal pain and like to those, then beware that you do not treat it with iron, for fear is over that.

sia de dos partz agudas lonc, de aguda extremitat ayssi cum spatum; mays empero sia en lu alcuna brevitat petit a petit, per so que en la operacio am aquel no passes entro al budel, e que ledas aquel.	It is of two pointed parts long, of acute extremity just as the swab; but indeed it be in him some brevity little by little, so that in the operation with that you do not pass into the intestine, and that you lead that.
E aprop considera si la generacio de ydropici es de part dels budels, quar lahoras cove que tu am la seccio te alonhes del ombelic per la quantitat de tres ditz a las partidas dejos, en le dreyt de lu sobre le pentenilh.	And then consider if the engendering of dropsy is from parts of the intestines, for then you must with section lengthen the navel by the quantity of three digits to the lower parts, in the right of it over the perineum.
Mays si la generacio de hydropici es per malautia del fietge, lahoras la tua seccio sia sinistra del ombilic per tres ditz.	But if the engendering of dropsy is from malady of the liver, then your section be left of the navel by three digits.

E no cove que la tua seccio sia sobre le costat sobre le qual vol jaser le malaute per que no corron las superfluitatz ad aquel loc freul.	And beware that your section be over the side upon which the patient wants to lie so that the superfluities do not run to that place.

And then pierce with the instrument all around, and insert into that section, and lift your hand with the swab between the navel and the pubis, and you squeeze that; and if it is the quantity of a fingernail or inch.
E aprop perforo le ciphac entro que pervengua le spatum al loc vuoyt, e es loc de l’aygua.	And then pierce the pubis so that the swab may reach the place desired, and it is a place of water.

e es semblant a canula de argent subtil; es fayt de argent o de eram o de lato leon, al qual en la partida pus bassa de lu es un petit trauc, e en les costatz de lu so tres traucs: dos de una partida e un del autra partida; e fayta es la extremitat de lu insciza segon la manieyra de pluma, ayssi cum vezes:	And it is like a cannula of subtle silver; it is made of silver or of brass or of lead lion, to which in the lower part of it there is a small hole, and in the sides of it there are three holes: two from one side and one from the other side; and its extremity is split according to the manner of a feather, as you see:
E en la extramitat de lu pus sobirana es armilla, quar quan le instrument perve al aygua, lahoras aquela tantost deysen sobre le instrument, donc evacua de l’aygua en la ora miega quantitat, quar si tu evacuas de aquela mes que no cove en la hora, fort leu mor le malaute per resolucio del sieu spirit animal, o accideys a lu cincopi que es appropinquada la mort.	And in the extremity of it above is an armilla, for when the instrument reaches the water, then that immediately goes up on the instrument, therefore evacuates from the water in the moment quantity, for if you evacuate from that more than you should not in the moment, the patient dies by resolution of his animal spirit, or attacks him fainting which is drawing near death.
Mays evacua de aquela segon la quantitat de la vertut de lu e segon que significan a tu las disposicios del malaute de la vertut del pols de lu e de la bontat de lu.	May you evacuate that according to the quantity of his strength and according to what are to you the dispositions of the patient of the strength of his pulse and of his goodness.
E aprop extrats le instrument, e rete l’aygua la qual causa es quar tantost es retenguda per la codena la qual rete le trauc que es sobre le ciphac del qual e recomtat a tu que perfores aquel segon aquela manieyra. And repeat the instrument on another day if the patient can tolerate it, and extract a small amount of water and do that for a few days out of caution, and beware of making a mistake until the water does not break but a little.
Mays si tu temes sobre le malaute, e leyssas de l’aygua gran quantitat, lahoras cura aquel am sepultura en arena cauda, e mota suzor en banh, e al solelh espere per lonc temps; e cura aquel am medicinas dessicativas entro que sia sanat.	But if you fear for the patient and release a great quantity of water, then cure that with an incision in the sand, move it in a bath, and wait in the sun for a long time; and cure that with drying medicines until it is healed.

Capitol .lvi.	Chapter 56:
De albater le qual accideys en le prepucii en le cap de la vergua e de corropcio e negror e adherencia del prepucii del cap de la vergua.	Of whitlow which happens in the foreskin of the head of the penis and of callus and blackness and adhesion of the foreskin of the head of the penis.
Motas veguadas accideys aquest albater en la vergua e es eminencia de carn laga.	Many times that whitlow happens in the penis and is an eminence of meat there.
E de aquela una es maligna e autra es no-maligna.	And one is malignant and the other is not malignant.
No-maligna, cove que suspendas am unci subtil e abscindas aquela entro que aquela mondes tota; e aprop pausa sobre aquela coto submirgit en enguent egipciac; e aprop aquel, cura le am enguent diafinicon entro que sia sanat.	Not malignant: suspend that with a subtle hook and cut off all of it until that one is entirely removed; then place on that site immersed in Egyptian ointment; and then that, cure it with fine ointment day by day until it is healed.
E si albater es maligna, de lega color, lahoras cove que tu aministres cauteri aprop la inscizio de lu e la razio de lu.	And if the whitlow is malignant of a dark colour, then you must administer cauterization after the incision of it and its reason.
Mays si albater es en le prepuci del cap de la vergua no-circumcis, e la una partida de albater es dedintz le prepucii e l’autra partida es defora, lahoras cove que tu ostes albater le qual es dedintz al comensament entro que es consolidat; e lahora tu cura aquel deforo, quar quan tu curas aquel ensemps le prepuci, no es asegurat que no sia trinquat.	But if the whitlow is in the foreskin of the head of the penis not circumcised, and one part of the whitlow is within the foreskin and the other part is outside, then you must draw out that whitlow which is within at its beginning until it is consolidated; then you cure that defect, because when you cure both the foreskin, there is not assurance that it will not be drawn.
E ja eysamen accideys en les genetius e en le prepuci negror e corruccio, adonc cove que tu conquavas tot aquo que ja es denigrat e que ja se vol corrompre o que ja es corrumput; e aprop lineys sobre aquel aprop aquo am mel, le qual es contusit am farina de scorsa de milgrana e de errs trissatz e crivellatz.	And it has already happened in the genitals and in the foreskin blackness and callus, then you must excavate all that which is already blackened and which wants to become rotten or which is rotten; then you line over that with wax, which is ground with bran of pomegranate peel and of nuts pounded and sifted.
E aprop cura aquel am l’autra curacio entro que sia sana.	Then cure it with the other cure until it is healed.
Mays si endeve flux de sanc, lahoras aministra cauteri lunar segon aquesta forma:	But if bleeding ensues, then administer lunar cauterization according to this form:
quar cauteri juvatiu es a dos disposicios ensemps, so es a flux de sanc e a la plagua quan es corrumpuda.	because lunar cautery is at two dispositions together, it is with bleeding and the wound when it is rotten.
E si le cap de la vergua es corrodut e es destruit tot en la hora, lahoras cove que tu intrometas en lo meat del prepucii una canula de plom per so que le malaute urina per aquela.	And if the head of the penis is eaten away and is destroyed all at once, then you must insert into the foreskin a lead cannula so that the patient urinates through it.
En la adherencia del prepucii am le cap de la vergua (et aquesta adherencia no accideys sino en aquel del qual le prepucii es sa, e sobre lu no es exhigida circumcizio; e quan accideys adherencia per plagua o per apostema) cove que excorjas am spatum obtus entro que sia dissolvut le liament e sia deliurat le cap de la vergua de tota partida.	In the adhesion of the foreskin with the head of the penis (and this adhesion does not happen but in him from whom the foreskin is uncircumcised; and when it happens by plague or by blister) you must excise it with a blunt spatula until the ligament is dissolved and the head of the penis is freed from all sides.
E si es dificil desirnir aquelas exquisidament, lahoras cove que tu excorjes am spatum alcuna causa del cap de la vergua e del prepucii, e aysso es quar le prepucii, quan es subtil, fort leu es perforat per la sua subtilitat leugierament.	And if it is difficult to separate them thoroughly, then you must excise with a spatula some part of the head of the penis and of the foreskin, and that is because the foreskin when it is subtle is easily pierced through its thinness.
E aprop separa entre·l prepucii e·l cap de la vergua am dra7 de li subtil, le qual ja es mulhat en l’aygua frega per que no adherescan autra veguada.	Then separate between the foreskin and the head of the penis with a very thin ligature, which is already moistened in water rubbed so that they do not adhere to another part.
E aprop sia curat am vi stiptic entro que sia consolidat.	Then let it be cured with white vitriol until it is consolidated.
Capitol .lvii.	Chapter 57:
De mundificacio dels enfants e de la curacio de aquo que accideys ad aquels de circumcisio.	Of the purification of children and of the cure of that which happens to those who are circumcised.
Circumcisio no es solucio de continuitat ayssi cum las autras plaguas: mays empero cum sia de la nostra operacio e de nostra voluntat, e lus de aquela sia propriament en les enfants, es necessari que asignem en aquela milhor operacio e via pus leugiera perdusent a salut.	Circumcision is not a cure of continence but like the other plagues; however, when it is of our operation and our will, and when its cause is properly in children, it is necessary that we assign to that a better operation and a way that loses more life than the others.
Donc dic que les antics no diyssero circumcisio en alcu dels lors libres, quar no n’usan en las suas leys, e no es sino quar havem aquisit per speriment, la qual causa es que yeu he atrobat la major partida dels artifexs e dels barbies usar circumcisir e mundificacio am novacula e am torores; e usan de liament am fiel e de inscizio am la ungla.	Therefore we say that the ancients did not use circumcision on some of their free ones, because they do not use it in their laws, and it is not except that we have acquired by experience, which cause is that I have overcome the greatest part of the artisans and the midwives to use circumcision and purification with a knife and with torches; and they use for ligature wax and for incision the nail.
E yeu ja he prohadas totas aquestas manieras e no atrobegui milhor mondificacio am forfexs, am liament am fiel que en mondificacio cum la ungla, quar motas vetz efugeys la codena pus desus, quar la codena del prepucii a dos tunicas, e roman la tonica pus dejos, e fort leu es forsat ad autra inscizio e dolor sicura.	And I have already proved all these manners and not overcome a better mondification with tweezers, with wax ligature that in mondification with the nail, because many times the string escapes above it, because the string of the foreskin is at two tunics, and the tunica pulls from below, and it is very easy to another incision and secure pain.
E am mundificacio le qual es fayta per alphecati, e es digital, del qual usan les sabatiers, no es segurada la inscizio de la extremitat del membre viril, quar fort leu intra en le trau de lu.	And in mondification which is done by aphetaty and it is digital, of which the scissors are used, the incision of the extremity of the virile member is not secure, because very easily it goes into the trauma of it.
Mays en la operacio am ungla, fort leu obazeys ferr e corromp la tua operacio.	But in operation with a nail, very often you break iron and corrupt your operation.
E la codena del enfant es breu per natura, e motas veguadas nays en tal manieyra que no ha necessitat de mondificacio, e yeu he vist aquel.	And the string of the child is short by nature, and many times it happens in such a way that there has not been necessity for mondification, and I have seen that.
Mays de la mondificacio que·s fa am forfexs e liamentz am fiel, la bontat, experiment descrobic a mi, quar las forfexs so de proporcional inscizio, per aquo quar la acuitat que es desus es ayssi cum la acuitat que es dejos; e donc cum tu premes la tua ma so proporcionadas dos acuitatz, e inscideysso segon una comperacio en un temps; e es fayta compressio del fiel am figura contenent la codena de la vergua de tota partida, am le qual no catz error de tot.	From the purification that is done with forceps and ligaments with gall, the goodness, experiment discovered to me, because the forceps are of proportional incision, therefore the acuity that is above is like the acuity that is below; and then as you press your hand so proportioned two acuities, and incise according to a comparison in one time; and compression of the gall is made with a figure containing the chain of the whip of all cut, with which there is no error at all.
E la manieyra de la operacio primeyra es que tu fassas estar le enfant majorment si es de aquels que entendo un petit, que no fassas sino que tu lies le fiel en la sua vergua tant solament, e que leysses aquel entro al autra dia.	And the manner of the first operation is that you cause the infant to be mostly if it is of those who understand a little, that you do not make but that you tie the gall in its whip only so much, and that you leave it within another day.
E aprop fay aquel alegrar en tota aquela manieyra que es a tu possibla de aquo que recep la sua intelligencia.	And then cause him to be cheerful in all that manner that is possible for you of that which receives his intelligence.
E aprop fa aquel estar entre las tuas mas estatuir preparadament, e no sia ges cezent; e occulta las forfexs en la tua ma o dejos le tieu pe, que l’enfant no veia aquelas ni degun autre dels instruments.	And then cause him to be between your hands established in preparation, and let there be no noise; and hide the forceps in your hand or under your foot, that the infant does not see those nor any of the other instruments.
E aprop entremet la tua ma a la vergua de lu e suffla en la codena, e tira aquela entro que sia eyssit le cap de la vergua, e aprop mondifica aquel de aquo que es agregat en ela de sordicia.	And then introduce your hand to the whip of it and breathe into the chain, and draw that within that is exited the head of the whip, and then purify that of what is aggregated in it of dirtiness.
E aprop lia le loc signat am fiel dobla, e aprop ligua pus bas de aquel un petit le segon liament, e aprop te am le dit pous e endic tieu le loc del liament dejos am bona retencio, e inscideys entre dos liaments.	And then tie the marked place with gall doubled, and then tie below that a little the second ligament, and then have your fingers and press the place of the ligament below with good retention, and incise between two ligaments.
E aprop eleva la codena sus leugierament e estratz le cap de la vergua; e aprop leyssa le sanc corre petit e petit, quar es milhor ; e pausa polvera desus e sobre la polvera pausa drap en le qual es spandut mugol de huou coyt en ayguaros concosit am oli rozat recent bo; e layssa aquel sobre aquel entro al autra dia; e cura aquel am curacio entro que sia sanat.	And then raise the chain slightly and separate the head of the whip; and then let the blood run little by little, for it is better; and place powder above and over the powder place cloth in which is spread mule's milk cooked in rosewater with recent oil roasted gently; and leave that within until another day; and cure that with ointment until it is healed.
La forma de las forfexs a mondificacio, aquesta es la forma:	The form of the forceps to purification, this is their form:
Sian las unas extramitatz no-talhantz e las autras sian talhant, que non sia yssit le ram del clau, e sia la longitut de las doas acuitatz ayssi cum la longitut de dos manubres engualment.	Let the one ends be blunt and the others be sharp, so that the nail of the claw is not exited, and let the length of the two acuities be like the length of two handles equally.
Mays la error en mundificacio es quar fort leu efugeys la codena intrinseca tota, o partida de lu deves la inscizio.	But the error in purification is that the intrinsic chain exited out completely or was parted from it at the incision.
Donc cove que tu extendas aquela de la tua hora am la tua ungla denant la apostemacio del loc e que inscidas aquela segon equalitat.	Therefore, whenever you extend that of your finger before the apposition of the place and incise that according to equality.
E si no la podes tenir am la tua ungla, lahoras extratz aquela am unci e inscideys aquela.	And if you cannot hold it with your finger, then pull out that with tweezers and incise that.
Mays si son passatz tres dias, e roman aquo que es imflat dejos la vergua apostemat, lahoras tu leyssa aquo entro que sia cedat le apostema caut, e excorja aquel am fecilitat, e inscidex aquel segon que a tu es preparat.	But if they have passed three days, and the thing that is inflated below the whip remains, then you leave that within until the aposteme is cauterized, and cut that with ease, and incise that according to what is prepared for you.
E guarda te del cap de la vergua, quar no nosera a lu aquo.	And guard yourself from the head of the whip, for it will not hurt him.
E donc cura aquel am aquo que la plagua consolida de las polveras las quals havem recomtadas en le tractat de las polveras.	And then cure that with what the plague is consolidated by the powders which we have recounted in the treatise of powders.
E si es inscidit de la codena sobre mesura, e obezeys a las partidas desus, aquo no notz a lu.	And if it is incised above measure, and the parts above, that does not matter to him.
E mays cura aquel am aquo que havem dit entro que sia sanat.	And cure that with what we have said within until it is healed.
Capitol .lviii.	Chapter 58.
De curacio de urina retenguda en la vesiqua.	Of the cure of urine retained in the bladder.
Retencio de urina en la vesica es fayta per oppulacio fayta per peyra o per sanc congilat, o per poyre o per carnada, e semblantz ad aquels de aquo que havem dit de las manieyras de curacio en la divisio.	Retention of urine in the bladder is made by oppression made by stone or by blood clot, or by hernia or by tumor, and resembles those of whom we have said of the manners of cure in the division.
E si no es dissolvuda la urina, e veses retencio de lu esser per peyra le qual ja es en le col de la vesica, lahoras cove que le malaute sia encorbat sobre les sieus denolhs.	And if the urine is not dissolved, and you see retention of him being by stone which is already in the neck of the bladder, then let the patient be bent forward over his knees.
E aprop conponeys les pes de aquel sobre le sieu dos e extendas le sieu ventre de la partida pus desus del sieu dos, e le malaute estrengua le sieu ale tant quant es a lu possible.	Then press the feet of him on his back and extend his belly from the part above his back, and let the patient strain himself as much as is possible for him.
Donc lahoras le col de la vesica es costreyt ha espulsio de la peyra a las partidas detras, per que la urina es absolta.	Then the neck of the bladder is constricted and there is expulsion of the stone to the parts behind, by which the urine is evacuated.
E si no es dissolvuda am aquo que havem dit he vehement es fayta la causa sobre le malaute, lahoras cove que aministres extraccio de lu am instrument le qual es apelat siringua, del qual aquesta es la forma: Sia de argent e sia subtil leon conquau, ayssi cum canula de pena de ausel am subtilitat de ray lonc en similitut d’un palm e mig, al qual sia cana subtil en le cap de lu.	And if it is not dissolved with what we have said and the cause is made vehement upon him, then let the instrument called syringe be administered, of which this is the form: Let it be of silver and let the tube be slender, also with reed of bird's feather with slender tip in similitude of a long needle in similarity of one palm and a half, to which let the tube be slender in the head of it.
E la manieyra del eyssiment de la urina per aquel es que prenguas le fiel doblat e lies en la extramitat de lu lana o coto per bona liadura; e entrometas las extramitatz del fiel en la partida dejos de la ciringua, e inscideys am las forfexs si superflueys alcuna causa de la lana, mays intromet la en la canula am vehemencia E aprop enongeys la ciringua am boder e am album de huou.	And the manner of the issue of urine by that is that you take the gall doubled and tie in the extremity of it wool or linen with good ligature; and introduce the extremities of the gall into the part below the syringe, and incise with forceps if any superfluous cause of the wool, but insert it into the tube with vehemence. And then fill the syringe with oil of rose.
E fay cezer le malaute sobre la selha, e embroca la vesiqua de lu e la vergua am olis umitz, e oli de oliva e ayguaros.	And cause him to sweat over the fire, and moisten the bladder of him with warm oils, and olive oil and rosewater.
E aprop entromet la ciringua am facilitat entro que pervengua a la razit de la vergua; e aprop dobla la vergua desus a la partida del embelic; e aprop empelleys la ciringua dintz aquela; e aprop empelleys aquela entro que pervengua a la vesica, e aquela centa le malaute esser pervenguda a la causa vuoda, e no es fayt asso segon aquest orde, sino le meat en le qual va a tortuositat.	And then insert the syringe with ease until it reaches the root of the whip; and then fold the whip above at the part of the embelic; and then press the syringe into that; and then press that within until it reaches the bladder, and let him be bent in the position he was before, and there is not made pain according to this order, but the passing into the bend.
E aprop exten le fiel am la lana petit a petit, quar la urina siec la lana.	And then extend the gall with the wool little by little, for the urine will suck the wool.
Aprop extratz aquela e fay per curacio urina, e usa ciringua, no cesses fer aquo e usa ciringua entro que sia evacuada la vesica e le malaute atrobe alleviacio.	And then pull out that and do by cure urine, and use syringe, not cease doing that until the bladder is evacuated and the patient has ease.
Capitol .lix.	Chapter 59.
De qualitat de clisterizacio de la vezica am clampcedra e am semblantz instrumentz les quals sian acordants ad aquo.	Of quality of catheterization of the bladder with pepper and with similar instruments which are in agreement to that.
Quan accideys en la vesica ulceracio o apostema, o sanc congilat en aquela, o es coartat poyredura, e vols en aquela destillar ayguas e medicinas, lahoras sia fayt am instrument le qual es apelat clampcedra, e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When there happens in the bladder ulceration or aposteme, or blood clot in it, or is constricted herniated, and you want in that to distill waters and medicines, then let it be made with instrument which is called clampcedra, and this is its form:
sino que en la extramitat de lu es sorda, so es clausa.	Unless that in the extremity of him is deafened, it is closed.
Et en aquela so tres traucs: dos de la una partida , ayssi quo vezes.	And in that so are three holes: two of one part, thus with respect.
En le comensament es loc concau, en le qual es aquo que es enpellit, e sia segon quantitat que oppile aquel, ses addicio, entro que quan alcuna causa es ab aquel tirada de las humiditatz, sia atirada, e quan es expellida, am aquo sia atirada, e quan es expellit lonc, segon que fa clampcedra am la qual es phicat naphta en las batalhas de mar.	In the commencement is a hollow place, in which is that which is inpillied, and let it be according to quantity that oppilies him, its addition, within that when some cause is by him pulled of the humidities, is pulled, and when it is expelled, with that is pulled, and when it is expelled long, according as does clampcedra with which naphtha is in the battles of sea.
Donc cum tu vols prohicir humiditatz en la vesica, entromet la extremitat de clapcedra en la humiditat, e atira am aquel aquo que es empellit a las partidas desus, quar la humiditat es atirada en la conquavitat de clapcedra.	Therefore, when you want to push humidities in the bladder, insert the extremity of clampcedra in the humidity and pull with that which pushes on the parts above, for the humidity is pulled in the hollows of clampcedra.
E aprop entromet la extramitat de clapcedra en la vergua segon que havem recomtat en la ciringua; e aprop empelleys la humiditat am aquo que empelleys, quar aquela humiditat perve a la vesica tantost, e le malaute cent aquela.	Then insert the extremity of clampcedra in the whip according to what we have recounted in the syringe; and then press the humidity with that which presses, for that humidity goes immediately to the bladder, and let the patient be bent over that.
Forma del cristeri subtil am le qual la vesica es cristerizada, e es aquela la forma:	Form of the subtle catheter by which the bladder is catheterized, and it is this form:
E sia fayta de argent o de lato, de la qual le cap pus aut sia semblant a petita pluma, e dejos lu cana dedintz liament.	And let it be made of silver or brass, of which the head also is like small feather, and below it tube within ligament.
E aprop pren vesica de moto, e pausa en aquela la humiditat que vols cristirizar en la vesica, e aprop lia aquela entre dos am fort liguatura am fiel doble, e escalfa aquela humiditat sobre le foc.	And take a bladder of the animal you want to use, and place inside it the moisture you want to crystallize in the bladder, and tie that between two strong pieces of string with a double knot, and heat that moisture over the fire.
E aprop entromet la extremitat del cristeri en la vergua.	And then insert the end of the crystallizer into the bladder.
E aprop estrenh la tua ma sobre la vesica am la humiditat am strectura descent entro que·l malaute centa que aquela humiditat ja es pervenguda a la vesica.	Then squeeze your hand over the bladder with the moisture, until it is completely within the patient's body, and you feel that the moisture has reached the bladder.
Mays si a tu no es present vesica, lahoras tu pren una pessa de parguames e fay de aquel cercle; e perfora aquel de tota la sua retonditat; e aprop entromet fiel fort en aquels traucs, ayssi quo so revolgut; e aprop agregua le cercle ayssi quo es agreguat alsofatur, pus que tu pausas en aquel aquo que tu vols de las humiditatz, e olis e ayguas.	But if you do not have a bladder available, take a piece of parchment and make a circle out of it; and pierce that all around its rim; and insert a strong needle into those holes, so that it rotates freely; and attach the circle as you would attach a tourniquet, pushing in whatever moisture, oils and waters you want.
E aprop tu lia aquel en le instrument e fay am aquel ayssi cum has fayt am la vesica, e exprescio am la tua ma entro que la humiditat pervengua a la vesica.	And then tie that in the instrument, and do with it as you did with the bladder, squeezing with your hand until the moisture reaches the bladder.
Capitol .lx.	Chapter 60.
De extraccio de peyra.	On the removal of stones.
Nos ja havem dit en la divisio las specias de peyra e curacio de lu am medicinas, e la diferencia entre peyra engendrada en los ronhos e peyra engendrada en la vesica, e les senhals de aquela.	We have already described the different kinds of stones, their treatment with medicines, and the difference between stones formed in the kidneys and those formed in the bladder, as well as their signs.
E havem dit la peyra en la qual catz operacio am ma, e seccio.	We have also described the kind of stone that requires an operation with the hand, and cutting.
E la peyra engendrada en la vesica propriament es aquela que es ficada en la vesica.	Stones formed in the bladder itself are those which are lodged in the bladder.
E yeu so narrant aquel am exposicio manifesta e abreviacio.	And these we will now describe briefly and openly.
Donc dic que peyra engendrada en la vesica majorment ve als enfantz; e dels senhals de lu es que la urina que es eyssida de la vesica es semblant a aygua en la sua subtilitat, e apar en aquela arena; e le malaute fregua la sua vergua, e motas veguadas pen, e aprop es dressada; e am aquo yeys foro le cul en motz de aquels.	Therefore I say that stones formed in the bladder most often affect children; and their signs are that the urine which exits the bladder is like water in thinness, and sand appears in it; and the patient rubs his penis, and goes many times to urinate, and then is relieved; and through this they form a hole in those.
E es laugiera la sanacio dels enfants de aquela entro que han conseguitz xiiii ans; e es dificil curacio en les viels.	And it is easier to cure in children who have reached the age of 12; and it is difficult to cure in the old.
Mays en les joves es migiera per aquo quar es entre aquels.	But in the young it is easier because of what is among them.
E de aquel del qual la peyra es major e la curacio es pus leugiera; E si es pauca, es contraria ad aquela.	And if the stone is larger and its cure is more difficult, then the contrary is true.
Donc cum pervenem a la curacio de aquela, cove al comensament de aquela que mondifiquem le malaute am cristeri le qual extragua tota la fenda la qual es en les sieus budels; quar aquela fenda alcunas veguadas prohibeys la envencio de la peyra deves la inquisicio de lu.	Therefore, when we come to the cure of this, first of all let us cleanse the patient with a crystallizer which extracts everything from the slit which is in his intestines; for that slit sometimes blocks the expulsion of the stone after its examination.
E aprop sia pres le malaute am les sieus pes e sia contosit e maugut enjos per so que la peyra descenda al preon de la vesica, o que saute de loc aut alcunas veguadas.	And then let the patient be held by his feet and shaken and beaten on his back so that the stone descends to the bottom of the bladder, or it jumps out in some way.
E aprop fay aquel cezer entre las tuas mas preparat, e las mas de lu sian dejos las coysas de lu, per so que la vesica tota sia fayta declinant a las partidas dejos.	And then let him lie between your hands with his legs hanging down and his chest raised up, so that the bladder is completely turned upside-down.
E aprop perquier aquela e tota aquela deforo.	And then push it out completely.
Donc si sentes la peyra en l’espazi, lahoras tu te coyta tantost am seccio sobre lu.	Therefore if you feel the stone in the space, then cut him immediately.
E si no catz de tot dejos le tieu tocament, lahoras cove que tu untes am oli le tieu dit indic de la ma sinistra, si malaute es enfant, o le dit miga si es jove complit, e entrometas aquel en le sieu cul.	And if you cannot get it out with your fingers at all, then anoint your left index finger with oil, and insert that into the patient's anus if he is a child, or the little finger if he is a fully grown young man, and push it in.
E perquier de la peyra entro que stia dejos le tieu dit.	And push out the stone as it lies below your finger.
E converteys aquela petit a petit entro al col de la vesica.	And gradually pull it into the neck of the bladder.
E aprop prem sobre aquel am lo tieu dit, e expelleys aquel a las partidas defora ves le loc del qual vos la seccio.	And press on that with your finger, and expel it out through the hole where you cut him.
E comanda al ministra que prema la vesica am la sua ma; e comanda a un autra ministra que am la sua ma dextra extenda les genetius a las partidas desus, e am la sua autra ma remaugua la codena la qual es dejos les genetius, en partida del loc en le qual se fa la seccio.	And order the assistant to press on the bladder with his hand; and order another assistant that with his right hand extend the testicles up above, and with his other hand push down the scrotum, in the area where you are cutting.
E aprop entromet espatum be inscident del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And then insert a pointed piece of steel which is shaped like this: [illegible]
e scindeys en lu aquo que es entre·l cul e·ls genetius, no en le mieg loc, abantz al latz de la coyssa sinistra; e sia la seccio sobre aquela peyra e·l tieu dit sia en le cul, e sia fayta seccio transversa, per que la seccio defora sia ampla e dedintz streyta segon la quantitat que egrecio de la peyra sia a lu possibla, e no major, quar fort leu comprem le tieu dit le qual es en le cul la peyra deves la seccio, e es foro-getada ses defacultat.	and split what is between the anus and the testicles, not in the middle place, towards the left side of the scrotum; and let the cut be made on the stone and your finger be in the anus, and let the cut be made crosswise so that the opening out is wide and the inside narrow according to how much room there is for the insertion of the stone, and not larger, for if you strongly press your finger which is in the anus towards the stone after the cut has been made, it will be driven out from its place.
E sapias que de la peyra es alcuna a la qual so angle e margers, per que le eyssiment de lu es fayt deficil per aquo.	And know that some stones have angles and edges, making their emission difficult because of this.
E de aquela aquo es leon semblant a glan, e es redonda, e es fayt de lu leugier eyssiment.	And some are like a lion's tooth, and are round, and their insertion is easier.
Donc si es aquela al qual so angles e marger, ajusta en la fissura.	Therefore if it is one with angles and edges, push it into the fissure.
E si no es ayssi foro-getada, lahoras cove que tu engenes sobre aquel, o que strenguas sobre aquel am gesti decentment, la extremitat del qual sia ayssi cum lima am le qual strenguas sobre la peyra, e no evasesca de lu; o que entrometas dejos lu instrument subtil de curvada extremitat.	And if it is not driven out, then let you push on that, or press on it decently with instruments, the end of which is curved and thin, so that you push on the stone, and it does not escape from him; or insert below it a thin instrument with a curved end.
Mays si tu no podes sobre aquel, lahoras tu amplifica le trauc un petit, e si tu veus flux de sanc, abscindeys en strenh aquel am vitriol trissat.	But if you cannot push on it, then let you enlarge the cut a little, and if you see any flow of blood, bind up that firmly with a thread soaked in vinegar.
Mays si la peyra es mays de una, lahoras al comensament tu impelleys la ma a la boca de la vesica, e aprop inscideys sobre lu; e aprop impelleys un petit aprop aquo; e semblantment fay si son motas mays de doas.	But if the stone is larger, then at the beginning push your hand towards the mouth of the bladder, and then insert it in there; and then push in a little bit more there; and do likewise if they are more than two.
E si es peyra mot gran, lahoras ignorancia es que tu inscidas aquel am gran seccio, quar accideys al malaute una de doas causas: o que mora o que endevengua a lu destillacio de urina continuabla, per aquo quar le loc no es de tot consolidat.	But if the stone is very large, then it is ignorantly done that you insert it with a great cut, for two reasons occur to the patient: either he lingers or he receives continuous distillation of urine, because the place is not completely consolidated.
Mays aministra expulcio de lu entro que sia fora-getada, o engenia en la fractura de lu am las forfexs entro que extragua aquela en pessas.	But the assistant must expel it as soon as it has been driven out, or push on it in the fracture with forceps so that he pulls it out in pieces.
Donc cum tu auras cumplit la tua opperacio, lahoras omple la plagua de enses de aloe e de sanc de drago, e strenh aquel.	Therefore when you have completed your operation, then fill the wound with cotton wool soaked in aloe and dragon' blood, and bind that firmly.
E pausa sobre aquel drap enfus en oli e vi, o en oli rozat e aygua frega, per so que apostema caut sia cedat.	And place over it a cloth steeped in oil and wine, or in rose-oil and water, so that the wound may heal quickly.
E aprop resupina le malaute sobre le sieu col, e no deslias le liament entro al tertz dia.	And then support the patient on his back, and do not loosen the bandage until the third day.
E cum aquel auras desliat, embroca le loc am aygua e mot oli, e aprop cura aquel am enguent diafinicon e am enguent diabazilicon entro que sia sanat.	And when that has been loosened, wash the wound with water and oil, and then cure it with a ointment of diaphenicon and an ointment of diabazilicon until it is healed.
Mays si en la plagua accideys apostema caut, adhust e corrosiu, e de aquel semblantz ayssi cum si le sanc es en la vesica congelat, e per lu es la hurina prohibida (e aquo es conogut per la egressio del sanc am urina), a donc entromet lo tieu dit en la plagua e extratz aquel sanc, quar si roman provoca la vesica a corropcio de la vesica e de lu putrefaccio.	But if in the wound occurs an ulcerated boil and corrosion, and from that it seems as though the blood is frozen in the bladder and because of that the urine is prohibited (and that is called for the flow of blood with urine), then insert your finger in the wound and push out that blood, for if it provokes a convulsion of the bladder and putrefaction, and rot in there.
E aprop lava la plagua am vi agre, aygua e sal, e am opposicio a tota specia, am aquo que conveneys a lu de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	And then wash the wound with wine, water and salt, and with everything that suits it for its cure until it is healed.
E cove en las horas de tota la curacio que tu lies amdos las coyssas e ajustes las medicinas las quals so pausadas sobre le loc.	And then in the hours of all the cure, let you apply both the thighs and adjust the medicines which are placed over the wound.
E si la peyra es petita e es en le meat de la vergua, e es ficat en lu, e eyssement de urina es prohibit, lahoras cura aquel am aquo que yeu recomti denant que pervenguas a seccio, quar tropas veguadas per aquesta curacio yest acusat de seccio; e ja yeu e esproat aquo, e es que tu prenguas un perforador de ferr alfelut, del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And if the stone is small and lodged in the meat of the penis, and emission of urine is prohibited, then cure it with what you see before making the cut, for forces are applied to it through this cure; and it has already been tried and proven, and that you take a punch of iron-ore, of which this is its shape:  [illegible figure]
de triangulada extramitat, agut, ficat en fust.	from triangular end, sharp, placed in wood.
E aprop pren fiel, e lia am aquel la vergua dejos la peyra per so que no retorne a la vesica.	Then take gall, and apply it to the stone below the bladder so that it does not return to the bladder.
E aprop entromet le ferr en la vergua, perforant am fecilitat entro que·l perforador vengua ad aquela peyra.	Then insert the iron into the stone, piercing it with ease until the piercing tool reaches the stone.
E revolveys le perforador am la tua ma en aquela peyra petit a petit, e tu perforsa la perforacio de lu entro que fassas aquel del autra part penetrar; quar la urina tantost es absolta.	And rotate the piercing tool with your hand in the stone little by little, and you will pierce it from both sides; for the urine is immediately released.
E aprop prem la tua ma sobre aquo que es romas de la peyra de la partida deforo de la vergua, quar aquela es trinquada, e es foro-getada am la urina, e le malaute es sanat.	Then press your hand over that part of the stone which is broken and split by the urine; for it is bound up and is opened up by the urine, and the patient is healed.
Mays si aquesta curacio no es a tu aparelhada per alcuna causa la qual prohibeys de aquela, lahoras lia un fiel dejos la peyra, e autra fiel desus la peyra.	But if for some reason this cure is not prepared for you, then apply gall below the stone and gall above it.
E aprop encideys sobre la peyra en aquela vergua entre doas liaduras.	Then press upon the stone in that opening between two ligatures.
E aprop extratz aquela.	Then extract it.
E aprop deslia le liament e mondifica le sanc congilat, le qual es fayt en la plagua.	And then untie the ligature and cleanse the clotted blood which is made in the wound.
E no es necessari liament de fiel dejos la peyra, sino per que no retorne a la vesica, e l’autre liament desus sino, quar quan es desliat le fiel aprop la egrecio de la peyra, la codena retorna a son loc e cobra la plagua.	And it is not necessary to have a ligature of gall below the stone except that it should not return to the bladder; and the other ligature above except that when the gall is untied the stone returns to its place and heals the wound.
E per aquo es a tu necessari quan lias le fiel desus, que tu eleves la codena a las partidas desus, o que retorne deves le tieu compliment, e cobra la plagua ayssi co havem dit.	And for that reason when you tie the gall above it is necessary for you to lift the scrotum upwards to the upper parts or that it return backwards and heals the wound as we have said.
Capitol .lxi.	Chapter 61.
De extraccio de peyra de las femnas.	Of extraction of a stone from women.
Peyra en las femnas pauc es engendrada.	A stone in women is seldom generated.
Mays si ve peyra ad alcuna de aquelas, lahoras dificil es la curacio de lu, e es prohibida per tropas manieyras.	But if one sees a stone in any of them then the cure for it is difficult and prohibited by many things.
La una de lor es quar la femna fort leu es verges.	One of them is that the woman is very thin.
E la segonda es quar tu no trobas femna be scient que descroba si meteyssa al metge quan es casta, o es de las femnas haventz maritz.	And the second is that you do not find a woman who will undress to show her genitals if she is chaste or if she is a married woman.
La tersa es quar tu no hatrobas femna be sabent aquesta art, majorment la operacio am ma.	The third is that you do not find a woman who knows this art well, especially the operation with the hand.
E la quarta es que·l loc de la seccio sobre peyra en las femnas es longinc del loc de la peyra, per que indigeys de seccio preonda, e en aquela es temor.	And the fourth is that the site of the incision on a stone in women is distant from the location of the stone so it requires a long incision and in that there is fear.
Mays si necessitat provoca a tu ad aquo, lahoras cove que tu prenguas una femna metga be scient, e pauc es atrobada.	But if necessity compels you to do so then know that you must take a female doctor who is well-skilled and few are found.
Mays si tu es privat de aquela, lahoras cerca metga quast e subtil, o presenta una femna matrona be esenhada en le feyt de las femnas, o femna que en aquesta art ennueys partida del art.	But if you are deprived of that then seek a doctor who is curious and subtle or present a midwife well-versed in the diseases of women or a woman who has experience in this art.
Donc fay aquela present, e comanda a lu que fassa tot aquo que tu li mandaras, de la enquisicio sobre la peyra al comensament; la qual causa es que reguarde si la femna es verges, lahoras cove que meta lo sieu dit en le cul de lu e quiera la peyra.	So do that and command her to do everything you order her to do from the examination of the stone at the beginning; for it is necessary that she check whether the woman is a virgin then know that she inserts her finger into the anus of her and feels the stone.
Donc si atroba aquela, coarte aquela dejos le sieu dit, e lahoras comanda a lu que inscida sobre aquela.	So if she finds it then prevent it from going below her finger and then command it to be inserted into that.
Mays si no es verge, lahoras comanda a la matrona que entrometa lo sieu dit en le conh de la malauta e enquiera sobre la peyra, pus que pausa la sua ma sinistra sobre la vesica, e comprem aquela am bona comprecio.	But if she is not a virgin then command the midwife to insert her finger into the vagina of the patient and feel around for the stone while placing her left hand over the bladder and compressing it with good pressure.
Donc si atroba aquela, lahoras cove que gradantment maugua aquela de l’orrifici de la vesica a las partidas dejos am somman de la sua vertut entro que pervengua am aquel a la razit de la coyssa.	So if she finds it then know that she gradually pushes that down from the opening of the bladder to the parts below with the palm of her hand facing upwards so that it comes to the root of the scrotum.
E aprop inscida sobre aquela apposicio de la maytat del conh deves la razit de la coyssa de qualque part sia a lu parada e cent la peyra en aquela partida, e·l dit de lu no sia remaugut de la peyra coartan dejos lu.	Then insert into that the tip of the thumb of the hand facing upwards over the root of the scrotum from whatever part it is stopped at and hold the stone in that part; and the finger must not be pushed back by the stone but must restrain it.
E la seccio sia pauca al comensament; e aprop entrometa lo ray sobre aquela seccio, e si sent la peyra, lahoras ajuste en seccio segon la quantitat la qual sap que la peyra sira getada de aquela.	And the incision should be small at first; then insert the nail over that incision and if she feels the stone then increase the incision according to the amount which she knows the stone is pushed down from there.
E sapias que las specias de peyra son motas: quar de aquelas es pauca e gran, e leon e aspra, e longua e redonda, e havent ramps.	And know that the forms of stones are many; for they are small and large and round and long and they have bumps.
Donc tu sapias quantas specias so de lu per aquo que tu signifiques sobre aquo que vols.	So you know how many species there are from what you wish to indicate about what you want.
E si tu veus flux de sanc, ajusta en le loc vetriol trissat e te aquela per una hora entro que sia abscindit le sanc, e aprop retorna a la tua operacio entro que la peyra sia fora-getada.	And if you see blood flowing then apply vinegar to the wound and keep it there for an hour until the blood is stopped; then return to your operation until the stone is expelled.
E fay que prepares am tu dels instrumentz les quals e ditz en la extraccio de peyra en les homes, per so que sias ajudat per aquels en la tua operacio.	And prepare from yourself the instruments which are used in the extraction of stones in men so that you may be aided by them in your operation.
E si tu veus flux de sanc, e sabes que la expulcio del sanc es de la arceria que es insciza, lahoras tu pausa polvera sobre le loc e estrenh aquel am pulvils e strictura descent, e no iteras aquo; e layssa la peyra e no extraguas aquela, quar fort leu morira la malauta.	And if you see blood flowing and know that the discharge of blood is from the artery which is cut then you place powder over the wound and tighten it with threads and do not interfere with that; let the stone go and do not extract it for the woman will surely die.
E aprop cura la plagua.	Then heal the wound.
Donc cum es cedada la acuitat del sanc aprop alcus jorns, e·l loc se poyreys, lahoras tu retorna a la tua operacio entro que la peyra sia fora-getada.	So when the keenness of the blood has ceased then after a few days when the wound is healed you return to your operation until the stone is expelled.
Capitol lxii.	Chapter 62.
De seccio sobre ernia acoza.	Of incision on a hernia that is acrid.
Hernia ayguoza no es sino agregacio de humiditat en le ciphac blanc lo qual es dejos la codena dels genetius contenent le huou, e es nompnat ciphac.	An acrid hernia is nothing but an accumulation of moisture in the white veil which is below the scrotum and is named veil.
E alcunas veguadas es en le propri pannicol le qual a lu preparec natura en la partida del huou, entro que sia cuyat que ja es autre huou; e es la codena del genetiu entre le ciphac blanc le qual havem dit, e no es aquo sino tart.	And in some cases it is in the upper layer of the veil which nature prepares in the part of the scrotum so that it is split that there is another veil; and it is the veil of the testis between the white veil which we have said and it is not anything but fat.
E la generacio de aquest hernia es per debelitat la qual accideys als genetius, per que ad aquels es efundunda aquesta materia, e alcunas vetz accideys per percuscio fayta sobre les genetius.	And the generation of this hernia is by weakness which occurs in the testes for the matter is poured into them and in some cases it occurs by a blow made on the testes.
E aquesta humiditat es havent motas colors, quar la color de lu o es declinant a citrina o a sanguinent, o rog, o es negra feculenta, o es ayguosa blanqua, e es aquo que es mays.	And this moisture has many colours for the colour of it inclines to yellow or is blood-red or red or is black and fetid and it is what is most common.
E les senhals per les quals es saubut on es aquesta agreguacio de aygua so aquestz: quar si es en le ciphac blanc le qual havem dit, lahoras le apostema es redon declinant un pauc a longitut ayssi cum figura de huou, e appar le genetiu, quar la humiditat conte aquel de tota part.	And the signs by which this accumulation of moisture is known are these: for if it is in the white veil which we have said then the lump is round declining a little to length as the shape of the testis and appears through the testis for the moisture contains it on all sides.
E si la humiditat es en le propri pannicol, lahoras le apostema es redon am partida del huou e per aysso hom estima que es autre huou.	And if the moisture is in the upper veil then the lump is round at the part of the scrotum and for that reason one estimates that there is another testis.
E si la humiditat es entre la codena dels genetius e·l ciphac blanc, lahoras catz dejos le centiment.	And if the moisture is between the veil of the testes and the white veil then it falls below the sensation.
E cum tu vols la cognicio de la color de la humiditat, lahoras tu esproa la color de la humiditat en le apostema am entromes cayrat del qual la forma es precedida; e segon aquo que es eyssit en le vestigi del entromes, jutga de aquo que es dedintz lu.	And if you wish to know the colour of the moisture then you test the colour of the moisture in the lump by testing the tip of the probe whose shape is preceded; and according to what it comes out in the trace of the probe judge what is contained within it.
Donc quan nos vinem a la curacio de lu am ferr, lahoras cove que comandem al malaute que sia fleubotomat si aquo es a tu possibla, e vezes le cos de lu ple.	So when we come to the cure of it with iron then know that we command the patient to be bath-soaked if that is possible for you and see the body of him stretched out.
E aprop sia resupinat sobre le sieu dos sobre alcuna causa un pauc auta, e pausa dejos lu motz draps.	Then let it be re-dampened over the back for some cause a little more and place below it some soft cloths.
E aprop setz tu sobre la part sinistra de lu, e comanda al ministra que segua a la dextra de lu, le qual extenda la sua vergua a hun de dos latz a la codena dels genetius e a la partida del mirac del ventre.	Then stand over the left side of him and command the minister to follow on the right of him so that he extends his scrotum to one side of two leagues at the root of the testes and to the opening of the navel.
E aprop pren spatum lat e scindeys la codena dels genetius del mieg loc per la longitut entro prop le pentenilh.	Then take a flat lance and cut the veil of the testes from the middle part for the length within prop to the testis.
E sia fayta la seccio segon rectetut engualment distant de la linha que deveseys la pel dels genetius, entro que pervengua al ciphac blanc comprehendent.	And the incision should be made according to the rules, evenly spaced from the line that separates the hair of the pubic region, so as to reach the white flesh underneath.
E excorja aquel, e observa, e guarda te per aysso que tu no inscidas aquel; e la tua excoriacio am la qual aquel excorjas per partida jassia que sia suspenduda am le huou mays e subtilment escruta am la excoriacio segon la quantitat a tu possibla.	Examine the wound and be careful not to cut yourself; then, with the tool you are using to examine the wound, gently scrape away at it so that you can see into its depth.
