But the suction cups that are after scraping be over the heart, and on the liver and spleen, and over the navel, in the places of the joints, and the armpit of the broad, because those members do not undergo scraping upon themselves.
E no es querit per aquelas sino atraccio de sanc de membre, ayssi cum pausam ventosa sobre mamilha en malautia de flux de sanc del sanc de las nars; e usam de aquela per que sia dissolvuda ventositat freja inviscade del membre, ayssi cum pausam sobre le ventre e l’umbelic; quar aquela rarifique le membre e scalfa lu e ramau la dolor quar resolveys ventositat.	And it is not used for those except for bloodletting from a member, as they use the cupping over the breast in the disease of flow of blood of the blood of the veins; and they use that to dissolve thick rawness invaded by the member, as they apply it over the belly and navel; because that rarifies the member and scrapes it and removes the pain from which it resolves the cupping.
E ja es pausada sobre les ronhos quan accideys en lor opilacio o poyra, quar per vertut de atraccio fort leu huobre opilacio e erradica le poyra de son loc.	And it is also applied to the knees when they become swollen in their joint or burst, because by strength of attraction strong its joint opilacion and eradicates the pain from its place.
E semblantment fa quan es pausada sobre le fetge e la melsa deves ventositat en aquels enclausa.	And similarly it does when it is applied to the heart and liver after cupping in those who are enclosed.
E aquestas ventozas so administradas vuedas amb succio tant solament; e alcunas veguadas so administradas am foc.	And these suctions are administered dry with suction only; and some times they are administered with fire.
E alcunas veguadas so administradas plenas de aygua tebeza en las malautias de la melsa.	And some times they are administered full of water in the diseases of the liver.
E aquo es per que la ventoza sia umplida e sia pus gran, so es aygua cauda sola o aygua en la qual sian cuytas herbas ad aquo convenientz.	And that is why the cupping should be filled and be large, it is water alone or water in which are cut herbs to that appropriate.
Forma de ventoza aministrada am foc: sia la amplitud del orrifici de dos ditz, segon que nos la havem formada; e la quantitat del preon sia la maytat de un palm; e sia en lo latz de lu, en le loc que es en le circuit, la maytat de lu, le trauc sia petit segon la quantitat que intre en lu una agulha.	Form of cupping administered with fire: it is the width of the orifice of two fingers, according as we have formed it; and the quantity of the fire be the length of a palm; and be in its breadth, in the place that is in the circuit, the length of him, the fire be small according to the quantity that enters it an awl.
Sia fayta de eram rog o citri, de grosses marges, leon, enguals e terses per so que no leda le membre deves la sua posicio sobre lu.	It is made of oak wood or citronwood, of thick edges, lions, dogs and horses in such a way that it does not lead the member by its position on him.
E sia al mieg de lu vergua transversa de eram o de ferr, on es pausada candela am lo foc.	And be at its middle a transverse branch of oak or of iron, on which is applied candle with the fire.
E ja sia aquesta ventoza gran major de aquela la qual havem recomtat; e la pauca mendre de aquela segon las malautias e la etat de aquel que usa de aquela.	And let this cupping be large greater than that which we have recommended; and the small less according to the diseases and the condition of him who uses it.
E las ventosas dels efantz e extenuatz so autres que las ventozas dels joves e de grosses corssas.	And the cuppings of children and weakened ones be smaller than those of young people and large bodied.
E la qualitat de pausar aquesta ventoza am foc sobre le membre es que extenda la meca am foc de lenha decentment denant una pauca candela de cera, e pausa aquela sobre le mieg de la vergua transversa en le mieg loc de la ventoza, per que le foc sia accendut enviro la partida dejos per que no sia comburit le cors del malaute.	And the quality of applying this cupping with fire over the member is that it extends the fire with decent fire before a few candles of wax, and apply that over the middle of the transverse branch in the middle place of the cupping, so that the fire be set around with straws so that the patient's body is not burned.
E aprop sia pausada sobre le membre del malaute, e le dit sia sobre le trauc que havem dit, entro que quan tenem las ventozas e non indigem que osten le dit e que yesca la vapor sobre aquel trauc, lahoras la ventoza sira tantost dissolvuda.	And then it be applied to the member of the patient, and his finger be over the hole that we have said, between while we hold the cupping and do not feel the finger and that the vapor rises over that hole, the cupping is dissolved as soon as possible.
E prop igneys la meca segon la sua manieyra, e itera aquela si indigeyssas de aquela.	And prop the fire the heat according to his manner, and repeat that if he feels it of that.
Mays en ventosa que es aministrada en la malautia de plauressi, am aygua, en la qual no ha vergua transversa ni trauc, e no es aministrada sino que sia umplida de aygua, e es pausada sobre le membre tant solament.	But in cupping that is administered in the disease of pleurisy, with water, in which there is no transverse branch nor hole, and it is not administered except that it be filled with water, and it is applied to the member only by itself.
E aquesta es la forma de lu: E aquesta ventoza quant plus es gran, tant es milhor, per que puya recebre gran quantitat de aygua.	And that is its form: And this cupping when it is larger, it is better, so that it can receive great quantity of water.
Capitol .xcvii.	Chapter 97.
Sanguissuguas no so administradas en motz membres sino en les membres en les quals non es possible posicio de ventosas, per la parvitat de aquels, ayssi cum le pot e gingiva e semblantz a lor; o en membre denudat de carn, ayssi cum le dit e·l nas e lors semblantz.	Leeches are not applied to small parts of the body, but to those where it is not possible to place cupping glasses due to their size, such as the lip and gum and similar areas; or on a part of the body that has been stripped of flesh, like the finger and nose and similar areas.
E la qualitat de usar de aquelas que si has trobadas sanguisugas que so en las ayguas dossas de poyredura mundas.	And the quality of using those leeches that you have found in the waters of pure spring water.
E aprop sian layssadas le dia e la nueyt en aygua dossa entro que sian famolentas, e que no romangua alcuna causa en le ventre de aquelas; e aprop sia evacuat le cors en le comensament am fleubotomia e am ventozas; e aprop fregua le membre del malaute entro que s’enrojezesca; e aprop sian pausadas sobre lu.	And let them be left in the water for one day and night, so that they become hungry, and let no cause remain in their bellies; and let the body be evacuated at the beginning by phlebotomy and cupping; and let the patient's limbs be rubbed until they turn red; and let them be placed upon him.
E cum son umplidas e caso.	And when they are full, then.
E si es possible succio del loc am ventoza, es mays derier en juvament.	And if it is possible to suck the wound with a cupping glass, it is more beneficial in healing.
E sino, lahoras lava le loc am vi agre e aprop am mota aygua; e sia freguat e expremut.	And if not, then wash the wound with sweet wine and then with warm water; and let it be rubbed and expressed.
E si es prolonguat le cors del sanc aprop le cazement de las sanguissuguas, e es aquo resudan, lahoras tu enfon un drap de li en aygua freja, e pausa aquel de sobre entro que sia abdida la resudacio.	And if the flow of blood continues due to the application of the leeches and it is oozing, then you dip a cloth in warm water and place it over the area so that the oozing stops.
E si le sanc es multiplicat, lahoras polveriza sobre lu vitriol trissat, o guallas e semblantz a lor de las causas stipticas, entro que·l sanc sia abscidit; o sian pausadas sobre le loc las maytatz de favas excocicadas, e sian layssadas entro que las favas aderescan al loc, e es le sanc abscidit.	And if the blood is profuse, then you powder the wound with powdered vitriol, or guaiacum and similar substances from astringent causes, until the blood stops; or place on the wound the pods of beans that have been roasted and let them adhere to the wound, and let the blood stop.
E cove, si es necessaria, iteracio de sanguissuguas, quan es possible mudar aquelas.	And, if necessary, repeat the application of leeches, when it is possible to change them.
E si las sanguissuguas son prohibidas de suspenssio, lahoras sia freguat le loc am sanc recent o fique una agulha en les locs entro que yesca sanc; e aprop sian pausadas, quar aquelas quan sento alcun sanc tantost adarysso.	And if the leeches are prohibited from being suspended, then let the wound be rubbed with fresh blood or leave a needle in the wounds until blood comes out; and then let them be placed, for when they feel some blood they will immediately adhere.
E quan voles que cajan, polveriza sobre aquelas un pauc de aloen trissat, o sal, o cendre, e cazo tantost.	And when you want them to fall off, powder them with a little ground aloe, or salt, or ash, and they will soon do so.
Ayssi comensa lo prolec de la tersa partida: de restauracio.	Thus begins the treatment of the third part: of restoration.
Aquest capitol es motas veguadas necessari en la art de medicina; e es restauracio de fractura e de dislocacio accident en les osses.	This chapter is very necessary in the art of medicine; and it is a restoration of fracture and accidental dislocation of bones.
O, filh, sapiatz que jactan se de aquest capitol les fols metges e les vulguars e aquels que degun temps no reguardero les libres dels Antics ni legiro de aquels una letra.	Oh son, learn that the foolish doctors and the vulgar and those who have never read the books of the Ancients nor understood a letter of them boast about this chapter.
E per aquesta causa es fayt que aquesta manieyra dels scients in terra nostra es privat; e yeu no ho e obliat en aquo degun temps be de tot; e no he adhibit aquo que apres, sino per longitut de lectio dels libres dels Antics e studi sobre le entendement de aquels, entro que extrayssi la sciencia de aquels.	And for this reason this manner of the wise men in our land is hidden; and I have not been obliged to do so at any time until now; and I have not used what I have learned, except through long study of the books of the Ancients and contemplation upon their wisdom, so that I might extract knowledge from them.
E aprop adirigui a experiment e studi en la longitut de la mieua vida.	And also by adding my own experience and study over the course of my life.
E yeu ja he de aquo descrit en aquest capitol tot aquo que conte la mieua sciencia e sobre le qual es passat lo mieu experiment; pus que agui abreujat aquo a vos autres e deliuregui aquo de occupacio de elonguacio; e abreujegui aquo en la fi de abreujacio; et e monstrat aquo en la fi de declaracio; e formegui en aquo motas formas dels sturmentz que so administratz en aquel, cum es fayt per addicio de declaracio, ayssi cum he fayt en dos capitols precedentz.	And I have already described in this chapter everything that my knowledge and experience encompass; for I have condensed it for you and relieved you of the burden of reading lengthy explanations; and I have condensed it to the end of the explanation; and demonstrated it at the end of the demonstration; and formed many forms of the instruments administered in it, as I have done in the two preceding chapters.
Capitol primier.	First chapter.
Summae et collectiones ex esse fracturae ossium, ex eis quarum praemissio necessaria est, antequam incipiamus rememorationem membrorum fraftorum et diversorum si uniuscuiusque.	Summary and collections from being fractured bones, from which their premise is necessary before we begin to remind the members of the fracturing and various of each.
Cove donc que diguam en le prohemi de aquest capitol las summas del sermo; e les capitols al entendament dels quals en le comensament es forsat le artifexs e a stacio sobre la veritat de aquels; so es vos e aquels que so promptz que sapian o aprenguan aquesta art nobla autres de vos.	And therefore, we will give in the beginning of this chapter the summaries of speech; and the chapters at the understanding of which at the beginning are perhaps the artificers and to station upon the truth of those; so are you and those who are prompt that know or learn this noble art from you.
E donc dic que quan accideys a alcu fractura o dislocacio o torcio o cazement, lahoras cove que tu te coytes al comensament am fleubotomia o aleyar aquel, o quascu ensemps, si no prohibeys alcuna causa, ayssi cum debelitat de vertut, o es aquel al qual accideys effant, o viel en decrepitat, o es temps de vehement calor, o de vehement freg.	And therefore I say that when it happens to someone fracture or dislocation or twist or hernia, then you should first apply phlebotomy or bleeding of that, or any embrocation, if no counterindication, such as debility of strength, or the person is an infant, or elderly in decrepitude, or it is a time of violent heat, or violent friction.
E aprop sia content en vianda sieua de erbas frejas e de carns de auzels e de crabotz; e prohibem carns grossas e umplir si de viandas e de tota vianda que umple las venas de sanc, entro que siras segurat de apostema caut, e si no temes efusio de materia al membre.	And let him be fed on a diet of fresh herbs and meats of birds and crabs; and abstain from fattening foods and from all foods that fill the veins with blood, so that you ensure the formation of a firm scab, and if you do not fear the effusion of matter into the limb.
E lahoras retorne le malaute al sieu regiment primier am le qual corr costuma de lu.	And then return the patient to his usual diet with which he is accustomed.
E donc cum le os trencat comensa esser restaurat, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia pascut de viandas nutritivas de nutriment mot e gros e greu en les quals sia viscositat, ayssi cum so viandas faytas de froment cueyt am aygua, e ris, e caps, e pes, e ventres de vacas, e huous, e peys fresc, e vi gros e semblants ad aquels, e am aquest regiment es fayta coagulacio de fractura pus leugierament e miels.	And therefore when the broken bone begins to be restored, then let the patient be fed on nutritious foods of light and heavy foods in which there is viscosity, such as foods made from wheat cooked in water, rice, capers, fish, cow's belly, eggs, fresh peas, wine, and heavy foods similar to these; and with this diet coagulation of the fracture is made more quickly and gently.
E sapias que les osses trinquatz quan so en les homes que so en la primiera vilura e en los decrepitz, no es possible que sian continuatz e sian consolidatz segon lur natura per la exsiccacio dels membres de lor.	And know that the bones are broken when they are in the first youth and in the elderly, it is not possible for them to be continued and consolidated according to their nature due to the withering of their limbs.
E son consolidatz e continuatz segon lor natura tot temps per la exsiccacio de aquels membres, e so continuatz e consolidatz aquels que so de lor en la fi de la lenitat, ayssi cum les osses dels petitz effantz.	And they are consolidated and continued according to their nature at all times by the withering of those limbs, and they are continued and consolidated in the end of softness, as are the bones of young children.
Mays empero natura ajusta e amnecteys sobre le os trencat de tota partida alcuna causa semblant a glut en le qual es grossitut que adhereys e strenh aquel entro que so ensemps conglutinatz e liatz ensemps, entro que venen la fi de fortitut e de fermesa, ayssi cum foc al comensament, entro que denguna causa no prohibeys aquel de las suas obres.	However, nature adjusts and connects the broken bone of every part any cause similar to glue in which there is thickness that adheres and strengthens together, so that it comes to an end of strength and firmness, as fire at the beginning, so that no cause prohibits it from its works.
E per aquesta causa es necessari que pauses las viandas del malaute, viandas en las quals so gravitat e viscozitat e grosseza, ayssi cum havem dit.	And for this reason, it is necessary to stop the patient's foods, foods in which there is weight and viscosity and thickness, as we have said.
Mota diversitat de fractura segon diversitat del membre.	Great diversity of fracture according to the diversity of the limb.
E sapias que las specias de fractura son diversas segon la diversitat dels membres, quar fractura del os de la camba es diversa de la fractura del os del cap; e la fractura del os del pietz es divers de la fractura del os del dos; e semblantment totz les autres membres son diverses entre lor.	And know that the kinds of fracture are diverse according to the diversity of the limbs, for the fracture of the bone of the leg is different from the fracture of the bone of the head; and the fracture of the bone of the foot is different from the fracture of the bone of the toe; and likewise all the other limbs are diverse among themselves.
E yeu venc am rememoracio de tota specia de fractura, expausada en le sieu capitol distincta del autre.	And I have experienced the reminder of every kind of fracture, explained in its distinct chapter from the others.
Mota diversitat de fractura en si meteyssa.	Great diversity of fracture within itself.
E son diversificadas las specias de fractura del os en lor meteyssas; quar es fayta fractura arcuada otra aquo que accidan en lu stellas; e alcunas veguadas es fayta fractura segon la longitut del os: e so las fracturas de lu satagia e astelhas e addicios procedentz e no-procedentz, ayssi cum es fayt en la pena quan es preparada a escriure, e es fractura am plagua e disrupcio en le cap, e es fractura fissura petita.	And the kinds of fracture of the bone in their metapyses are diverse; for there is made arcuate fracture some that occur in them stellate; and some fractures according to the length of the bone: and so are the fractures of the satagia and astragalus and accessory and non-accessory bones, as occurs in the pen when it is prepared for writing, and there is made fracture with crack and disruption in the head, and fissure fracture is made small.
E a tota specia es engen o turment propri en restauracio de lu segon que vindra rememoracio de lu distincta en les sieus locs.	And every kind has its own pain or torment peculiar in its restoration according to what comes to mind distinctly in its locations.
Mota senhal de fractura del os.	Great sign of fracture of the bone.
E per aquo es conoguda fractura del os: es tortuositat de lu, e de aquel eminencia e appericio de lu al sentiment, e so de lu quan compremes aquel am la tua ma.	And by that is known fracture of the bone: its crookedness and its protuberance and appearance to the touch, and also when you press it with your hand.
E donc quan no es en le loc tortuositat apparent ni so no es feyt deves le tieu tocament quan toques le os am agitacio e le malaute no atroba gran dolor, lahoras no es aqui fractura.	And therefore when there is not in the location apparent crookedness nor is it made due to your touch when you press the bone with agitation and the patient does not complain of great pain, then it is not here fracture.
Habantz es possible que sia tortuositat o petita fissura, adon no cove que tu mauguas aquel am la tua ma e am compressio de tot; habantz pausa sobre lu de las medicinas de las quals ve rememoracio aprop aquel moment le qual conveneys al loc; e aprop sia streyt per strictura subtil.	There may be tortuosity or a small fissure, so do not be afraid to massage it with your hand and with compression all over; pause on it some medicines of which you will find reminder in the appropriate moment for that place; and let it be tight by subtle constriction.
E sapias que·l loc quan es arcuat e no es scindit en dos o otra aquo que no accidan en lu satagie, cum es remauguda tota partida de la sua compar, lahoras cove que comenses de la tua hora a rectificacio de lu habantz que a lu accida apostema caut.	And know that the place where it is arched and not split into two or anything else that does not happen in it, when it is all swollen to its counterpart, then you should start by rectifying it by cauterization so that it happens to it an abscess.
E si a lu accida apostema caut, lahoras layssa aquel per alcus dias entro que cesse le apostema; e aprop engualha aquel segon quascuna manieyra que podes de levitat e de engen.	And if an abscess happens to it, then leave it for a few days until the abscess goes down; and then heal it in whatever way you can, with elevation and ingeniosity.
E sapias que restauracio de lu e agulacio de lu es pus leugiera que del os en le qual accideysso sathagie.	And know that restoration of it and piercing of it is worse than the pain from the bone in which it happens.
E aprop strenh aquel segon que vindra la rememoracio de lu.	And then strengthen it according to what you will be reminded of.
Mays si en le os so satagias, lahoras es necessaria extencio de aquest membre trencat de doas partz, si es la ma o le pe; o am la tua ma si le membre es petit; o am doas cordas o am una corda e la ma.	But if in the bone there is swelling, then extension of this broken member from two parts is necessary, if it is the hand or foot; or with your hand if the member is small; or with two strings or one string and the hand.
E sia la tua posicio am la qual pauses le membre loc engual segon la sua figura natural, mentre que las partidas so extandudas del membre trenquat, lahoras te perforsa que fassas retornar aquelas addicios am engen e segon quascuna manieyra que poyras en lor locs.	And let your position be such that you hold the member in its natural place while the parts are extended from the broken member; then you must force these joints to return ingeniously and in any way you can in their places.
E guarda te segon la tua forssa que no accida sobre le malaute per la tua operacio delor ni lesio; e perforsa te segon le tieu poder que tu appliques la un os am l’autre son companho segon lors milhors formas.	And watch yourself according to your strength that no pain or injury happens to the patient by your operation; and force yourself according to your power to apply one bone to another's companion according to their best forms.
E cove que en aquela hora aprofitablament tu toques am la tua ma aquel, e si vezes aqui alcuna causa diversa, rectifiqua aquel e enguala aquel per la quantitat de la tua vertut.	And if you opportunely touch it with your hand and see any diverse cause, rectify it and heal it by the quantity of your skill.
E exquiva vehement extenssio e compressio, ayssi cum fan mots fols metges que motas veguadas fan accidir apostema caut per la sua operacio, o fan accidir contraccio en le membre ayssi cum havem vist aquo per la operacio de lor motas veguadas.	And avoid violent extension and compression, as many foolish doctors do many times make an abscess happen by their operation, or cause contraction in the member as we have seen happen many times by the operation of them many times.
E aprop annecteys, aprop equacio e decent operacio e strictura de aquel membre, e repaus e tranquilitat; amoneste le malaute sobre aquo e fay le squivar que no maugua aquel en la hora de las suas vigilias e del sieu dormir, e ves la sua revolucio e agitacio, e deves la sua egestio, e deves totz les sieus movementz am tota la sua vertut; e aguarda se que la posicio del membre sia posicio am la qual sia asegurada la dolor, la qual causa es quar quan sent en la disposicio de la posicio del membre delor o lesio; lahoras cove que permutes aquel ad autra disposicio de aquela am la qual non senta dolor; e guarda am aquo que la posicio de lu aquela sia dreyta e engual, per so que al membre non accida tortuositat quan es restaurat.	And then connection, equalization, and decent operation, and constriction of that member, and rest and tranquility; warn the patient about it and make him avoid paining himself in the hours of his vigils and sleep, and watch his revolution and agitation, and attend to his excretion, and attend to all his movements with all your skill; and look to see if the position of the member is a position by which there is security from pain, the cause of which is that when he feels in the disposition of the position of the member pain or injury; then change it to another disposition by which he does not feel pain; and watch over it so that its position be straight and equal, so that no tortuosity happens to the member when it is restored.
E la qualitat de la strictura del membre tranquat es aquela que yeu recomti; per que sapias que·ls membres trencatz so diversificatz en lor parvitat e en lor grandeza e en la forma de aquels.	And the quality of the constriction of the broken member is that you recognize it; because you should know that broken members are differentiated in their smallness and in their greatness and in the form of those.
E de aquels que son petits ayssi cum le bras e·l dit e·l focil e semblantz ad aquels, lahoras cove que la envolucio sia de drap mol subtil.	And of those which are small like the arm and the finger and the elbow and similar to them, then let the wrapping be of very thin cloth.
Mays aquels que so grosses ayssi cum la cuoyssa o la camba, cove que en aquels sia envolucio lada e dura, quar la liadura lada connecteys le membre gran e strenh aquel de tota part am strictura engual, enayssi que en lu no intre macula.	But those which are large like the thigh or the leg, let there be wrapping of tough cloth, for the tough binding connects the large member and strengthens it from all parts by equal constriction, so that no stain enters it.
E aprop comensa, aprop la tua evacuacio de equacio, pausar liament convenient ad aquo, sobre le loc de aquela fractura am tres envolucios o quatre segon que·l membre mereys; e strenh la tua ma un petit am le liament.	And then begin, and your evacuation of equalization, pause the convenient ligament over that fracture with three wrappings or four according to what the member deserves; and strengthen your hand a little with the ligament.
E aprop ve am aquel a la partida pus sobirana del loc de la fractura, e strenh mens que no foc la tua strictura am la qual has strengut le loc de la fractura.	And then go to it at the most superior part of the place of the fracture, and strengthen so that your constriction with which you have strengthened the place of the fracture is not relaxed.
E aprop elongua te am envolucio del loc de la fractura un pauc, e mollifiqua la strictura petit a petit, entro que prenguas del loc sa una gran partida.	And then lengthen yourself by wrapping the place of the fracture a little, and soften the constriction little by little as you take from it a great part.
E aprop pren una autra benda e envolveys aquela autra veguada sobre le loc trenquat am envolucio, e aprop ve am las envolucios a la partida pus dejos de la fractura; e sia la tua operacio en la strictura de la envolucio e en mollificacio de aquela segon que havem dit en la envolucio primieyra desus.	And then take another bandage and wrap that other part over the broken place, and then go to the wrappings at the most inferior part of the fracture; and let your operation be in the constriction of the wrapping and in softening that according to what we have said above about the first wrapping.
E aprop pausa entre las volucios de stopa leon o drap am le qual sia engualada la tortuositat de la fractura, si en lu es tortuositat; e sino, no pauses en lu alcuna causa.	And then pause between the wrappings of cotton or cloth with which the tortuosity of the fracture is equalized if there is tortuosity; and if not, do not pause in it for any cause.
E aprop pausa sobre lu autra benda, e aprop enguala sobre aquestas envolucios stelhas decentment faytas tantost, si en le loc no es imflacio o apostema caut, e lahoras pausa sobre lu aquo que sede le apostema aquel e que oste la imflacio; e layssa aquela per alcus jorns; e lahoras tu strenh sobre lu las stelhas.	And then pause another bandage over it, and then heal it over these decently made strips just as much, if there is no inflammation or abscess in the place, and then pause on it what seats the abscess and which eases the inflammation; and leave it for several days; and then strengthen the strips over it.
E sian las stelhas de la maytat de canna lada raza, e be formada saviament; o sian de fust de pi; o de ramps de palma ; e sia le ample de quascuna stelha segon aquesta forma e aquesta figura:	And let the strips be of the thickness of a thin rod, and be cleverly formed; or be of wood of pine; or of reeds of palm ; and let the width of each strip be according to this form and figure:
Empero cove que la astelha que es pausada sobre aquela fractura sia pus grossa e pus lada un petit que las autras astelhas, e la longitut de la stela segon qu’es legut al membre en magnitut e parvitat; e aprop strenh sobre las astelhas am autra benda segon la tua primieyra strictura; e aprop lia desus am fiel decentment segon que havem dit de strictura, e es que sia la tua strictura segon le loc de la fractura mes, e quant mes es alonguat de la fractura, es mendre la strictura.	However, let the strip that is paused over that fracture be thicker and tougher a little than the other strips; and the length of the strip according to how it lies on the member in greatness and smallness; and then strengthen over the strips with another bandage according to your first constriction; and then tie above it with a decent thread according to what we have said about constriction, and let your constriction be less as the member is more lengthened from the fracture.
E cove que les fils sian migiers en grossesa e subtilitat, e sian de li mol; e si les fils so grosses, ayssi cum yeu he vist per la operacio de alcus fols pausantz les lors fils de cordas de li tort, e es error gran, quan catz la strictura fora equalitat.	And let the threads be thin in thickness and subtle, and let them be of tough thread; and if the threads are thick like how I have seen through the operation of some foolish doctors with their threads of rope twine, it is a great error when constriction is unequal.
E eyssament fils subtils no so convenientz, quar tu no consaguiras per strictura am aquels aquo que voles, e no cove que entre astela e astela haja mens de un dit.	And thin threads are not convenient, because you will not accomplish by constriction with them what you want, and there will not be room between strip and strip for a finger.
E si le malaute es ledit per las extremitatz de las stelas aprop la strictura en les locs sas, lahoras pausa dejos aquelas de stopa leon o lana carmenada entro que aquo no li fassa lesio.	And if the patient is hurt by the ends of the strips when you tighten the constriction in its places, then pause under them cotton or wool so that it does not hurt him.
Alcunas veguadas fractura es am plagua, e accideys disrupcio en la codena, e yeu vindre am rememoracio en aquela en le capitol segon singularitat.	Sometimes the fracture is in a vein, and disruption happens in the tendon, and I come to remembrance in that in the head according to uniqueness.
E sapias que ges tot membre trencat no es streyt am stelhas al primier dia; la qual causa es quar le membre, quan es gran, no cove que pauses sobre lu stelhas sino aprop v dias o vii o mays, segon la tua seguratat de adveniment de apostema caut.	And know that every broken member is not tightened with strips on the first day; the cause of which is that the member, when it is large, let no strips be paused over it except after a few days or seven or more, according to your security from happening of an abscess.
E aquesta es la manieyra dels emplaustres am les quals les Antics restauravan, les quals so pausatz sobre fractura e dislocacio e torcio.	And this is the manner of the splints with which the Ancients restored, which were paused over fracture and dislocation and twist.
Manieyra de emplaustra comu abruejat de restaurament de fractura, convenient a motas compleccios e majorment a las femnas e als efantz, quar es de aquo sobre le qual no ventz calor ni freg: e es que prenguas de polvera de moli, e es la medula de la farina que pen deves le movement de la mola en las paretz del moli.	Manner of splint as a dressing for restoration of fracture, convenient to many complications and especially to women and children, because it is that about which there goes no heat nor friction: and let be taken from flour dust, and the bran is the meal that comes from the movement of the mill in the walls of the mill.
E comfeys aquel ayssi cum es, sino que cribelles aquel am album de huou, e pausa la comfeccio de lu no-spessa ni subtil; e aprop usa de aquela.	And dry it as it is, except that you moisten it with egg white, and do not pause the application of it thick nor subtle; and then use it.
Autra manieyra de emplaustre restaurant fractura e dislocacio e torcio: recipe de assafetida, de lapdanum, de acacia, de enula, e migrach, que es razit de milgraner salvage, de totz ana drac. x; de mirra e aloen ana drac. v; alochil ana drac. xx; totz sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian mesclatz am aygua alichil o am album de huou si la compleccio del malaute es scalfada; e aprop usa de aquest emplaustre, quar es de bona composicio e restaura les osses trencatz leugierament, e confereys a motz homes.	Another method of an ointment for healing fractures and dislocations and twists: take assafetida, frankincense, acacia, enula, and mastic which is ground from wild myrrh, all in equal amounts of one drachma each; add myrrh and aloe at half a drachma each, and mix them with oil of helichrysum or with egg white if the patient's complexion is scaly; and then use this ointment, for it has a good composition and quickly restores broken bones, and confers health to many people.
Autra manieyra de emplaustre le qual comfereys a fractura e torcio: recipe migrach e met de altea blanca ana drac. x; de mirra e de aloen ana drac v; de acacia drac. vi; de bol armenic drac. .xx.	Another method of an ointment that confers health to fractures and twists: take mastic and white mustard in equal amounts of one drachma each; add myrrh and aloe at half a drachma each, acacia at six drachmas, and bol armenic at twenty drachmas.

Manieyra de emplaustre a juncturas e osses separatz de lors locs, e seda dolor accident en aquels e a fissuras e fractaduras: sia presa lana sutza e sia submersa en vi agre e oli cuyt e sia pausat sobre le loc.	Method of plastering for joints and bones separated from their sockets, and also for wounds and fractures: take soft wool which has been dipped in warm wine and oil and place it over the affected area.
Mays en aquest emplastre no es vertut de restauracio, de apostema caut e expelleys dolors propriament.	Let this plaster be used not only for healing, but also for preventing suppuration and drawing out pains justly.

Another way of making a plaster which heals broken bones: take the leaves of the wild fig tree and the leaves of the wild poppy; pound them all together to make a plaster from them.
Manieyra de emplastre abreujat aministrat deves la restauracio de fractura de os e quan tu voles resolucio del romanent de apostema: recipe razitz de altea, de camamilla e flors de violes, de farina de ers, de totz ana partida .i.; sian totz trissatz e sian cofitz am vi, si·l membre no es scalfat.	Method of plaster which heals broken bones and also resolves suppuration from a wound: take the roots of horehound, camomile flowers, violet flowers, and bran, each one part; let all be pounded together and mixed with wine, if the patient's skin is not scalded.

Autra manieyra de emplastra pus fort en resolucio que aquest primier, quan accideys apostema dur deves la restauracio del membre: recipe de razitz de altea e de semensa de li, e de balaustia, e mellilot, majorana, flors de viol, de camamilla, de totz ana partida i engual; totz sian trissatz e sian cofitz am aygua de sauze o am aygua dousa o am vi, tot aquo segon la qualitat del membre e le repaus de la color de lu.	Another stronger method of plaster for resolving suppuration which is more effective than the previous one, when suppuration happens because of a broken bone: take the roots of horehound and of larkspur, and of mallows, and of marjoram, and violet flowers, camomile flowers, all in equal parts; pound them together and mix with water of vinegar or warm water, or wine, depending on the quality of the affected member and its color.
Mays Ypocras no diyssec en le sieu libre que sia pausat sobre le membre trenquat deves la restauracio de lu sino cerot fayt de cera e de oli e no autre causa; e recomtec que sia migier entre grossitut e subtilitat.	But Hypocras does not dry on its own, so it should be placed over the broken member for its healing, unless a poultice is made of wax and oil for some other cause; and let it remain between the thickness and the thinness.

But it is seen that plasters are placed over the broken member for its healing and the causes in which there is dryness with a little warmth are also like those that we have counted.
Manieyra de emplastre que comfereys a lesio e dolor: recipe migat, de cezes, de pels de home inscizes o pena de auzel, e de altea, e sal, partidas enguals; sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian cofitz, e sia fayt emplastre.	Method of plaster which works for wounds and pain: take powdered myrrh, cedar wood, human hair or owl feathers, horehound, and salt, all in equal parts; pound them together, sift and mix to make a plaster.
Mays la quantitat segon la qual cove que romangua la liadura e aprop sia disliada, es que consideres si no es accidit dolor ni pruziment ni le os es trencat no es maugut de son loc, lahoras tu no deslies de motz jorns.	But the quantity depends on how large the wound is and how it has healed: consider that if there is no pain or swelling, and the bone has not been broken and has not come out of its socket, then you do not have to wait for many days.

And take a linen cloth and sea sponge which is damp with lukewarm water, and dip the affected area in the lukewarm water and wash the wound until the swelling and pain cease; then let the member rest for an hour, and place soft wool which has been dipped in wine and oil or rose oil over it for one night so that suppuration is secure from cauterization, and so that the inflammation of the member is reduced.

And if none of the causes that we have mentioned happen to the member, then do not remove it but rather leave it for three or four or five or seven days; and some times it is left for twenty days according to how it appears to you from the appearance of the affected member, as we have said, until the fracture is healed and the meat closes over that.

And then adjust the compression according to how it was before in your first compression, and adjust the thickness of the bandage on the patient's body, according to how his memory precedes it.
Mays si tu vezes le loc de la fractura ja desiccar e extenuar mays que no cove, lahoras sapias que·l nutriment es prohibit pervenir ad aquel; e donc embroca aquel am aygua tebeza deves tota veguada que delias aquel; e sia aquo en totz tres dias; e alleuja la strictura un petit, e per aquesta operacio corr al membre le nutriment, e es sanat leugierament.	But if you see the fracture already dried and exhausted but not closed, then know that food is prohibited from coming to it; and therefore moisten it with lukewarm water for three days totally, and loosen the compression a little, and through this operation draw the member's food, and it will heal quickly.
Mays aquo que fan les fols restauradors de la fractura del membre autra veguada quan no es restaurat al comensament, segon que cove, e es restaurat segon tortuositat, es error segon la operacio de lor, e temor gran, e si fos dreyturier aquo agrandit les Antics en lors libres e agueran am aquo obrat.	But what the foolish healers of a broken member do when it is not healed at first, as it appears, and is healed according to tortuosity, is error according to their operation, and great fear; and if they were right-handed those who increased the Ancients in their sockets and fought against them.
E yeu no he vist ad alcu de lor aquo far, per que es pus razonable que aquo no fassa.	And I have not seen any of them do that, for it is more reasonable that they do not do so.
Capitol segon: De fractura quan accideys en le cap.	Chapter according to: Of fracture when it happens in the head.
Las specias de fracturas son motas, e las figuras de lor son diversas, e las causas son distinctas, quar de fracturas alcuna es fayta per percussio de spaza, e la percussio osta tot le os entro al ciphac, le qual es dejos le os, ayssi cum fay ayssa en le fust, e per aquo aquesta specia es nompnada ascial; o la spaza inscideys alcuna partida del os, e inscideys la carn de lu e no passa la inscizio entro al derier de lu; e aquesta specia de fractura es nompnada levatio absoluta.	The species of fractures are many, and the figures of them are diverse, and the causes are distinct; for some fractures are caused by blow of a staff, and the blow pushes all the bone inside the head, which is below the skull, just as it pushes in the trunk, and because of that this species of fracture is called compression; or the staff penetrates one part of the bone, and penetrates the flesh around it, and the penetration does not go through the end of it; and this species of fracture is called absolute elevation.
E la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca, e de fractura que es contricio o atricio; e causa de lu es percussio am poyra o cazement sobre peyra, e a lor semblantz.	And the wound of these two fractures is large or small, and the fracture which is compression or crushing; and the cause of it is blow with fists or clubs on stone, and to them similar.
E aquesta fractura o es penetrant que ja apropinqua al pannicol le qual es dejos le os; o es en la facia del os, e la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca.	And this fracture is penetrating so that it approaches the membrane which is below the bone; or it is in the bone's face, and the wound of these two fractures is large or small.
E de fractura es que es ameguada en le os, en la subtilitat del cabel petita, e per aquo es nompnada aquesta specia fractura capillar.	And of fracture which is dulled in the bone, in the thickness of the hair, and because of that this species of fracture is called capillary fracture.
E es fractura que es fayta o per cazement o per percussio de peyra e a lu semblantz, que fa intrar alcuna lamina del os a las partidas dedintz, e es fayta en le loc concavitat ayssi cum accideys als payroles de eram quan accideys a lor percussio e es partida de lor intrada a las partidas dedintz.	And of fracture which is caused by blow or penetration of stone to them similar, and makes some lamina of the bone enter into the gaps between the teeth, and is caused in the concave place just as it happens to the fingers when a blow is struck and is split into the gaps between the fingers.
E majorment es fayt aquo en les cors de osses humitz, ayssi cum so caps de efantz.	And this happens mostly in bodies of fat people, as well as children's heads.
E so a totas aquestas specias fracturas satagias, so son pessas ayssi cum stelhas separadas.	And there are all these species of fractures, they are like broken stars.
E yeu vindre am reremoracio de tot aquo en son loc.	And then you will have the memory of everything in its place.
E conoyssem totas aquestas specias de fractura per deteccio sobre aquelas e per inquisicio de lor am tentas e ostament de carn corrumpuda que es sobre lor.	And know all these species of fractures by examination on these and by inquiry with their fingers and appearance of the corrupted flesh that is on them.
E specia capillar es conoguda per aysso que es descubert sobre le os, e es abstergit, e linit sobre lu am tentha, quar la fractura appar negra.	And hairline fracture is known by what is uncovered over the bone, and it is wiped away, and liniment is applied over it, because the fracture appears black.
Mays en la curacio de fractura considera al comensament les accidentz del malaute, e lahoras si tu vezes per los accidentz que signifique per significacio manifesta sobre paor, ayssi cum es vomit de colera, e extencio, e perdement de entendament, e abscizio de votz, e sincopi, e febre acuta, e eyssiment dels huels e rogor de aquels, e semblantz a lor dels accidentz en las majors disposicios, ses dopte no es sanat.	But in the cure of fractures consider at the beginning the accidents of the patient, and then if you see through the accidents that indicate by obvious indication fear, such as vomiting of cholera, and extension, and loss of understanding, and loss of voice, and fainting, and acute fever, and sweating of those, and appearance to them of the accidents in the greater dispositions, six days are not healed.
E si vezes accidentz no-correntz tu speras salut, lahoras tu comensa la curacio de lu.	And if you see no-running accidents, then you expect health, then you begin the cure of it.
La qual causa es quar si es vengut a tu le plaguat en le comensament cum es plaguat e aquo es en les dias de ivern, lahoras cove que tu studias en le ostament del os denant le dia xiiii segon tota disposicio.	The reason for this is that if the victim has come to you in the beginning as he was victim and that is in the days of winter, then you should study in the appearance of the bone before day fourteen according to all disposition.
E si es en les dias d’estiu, lahoras cove que te coytes ostar le os denant le vii dia, habantz que aquo que es dejos le os sia corromput del pannicol, e que accidescan les accidentz que havem recomtatz.	And if in the days of summer, then you should cut the bone before the seventh day, having that what is under the skin be corrupted from the padding, and that the accidents we have counted happen.
E si la fractura ja es pervenguda al pannicol cubrent le cervel, e es am partidas menudas e atricio, lahoras cove que inscidas la partida conminuta e atrita, segon que yeu recomtare a tu.	And if the fracture has already reached the padding covering the brain, and it is in minute pieces and crushed, then you should insert the crushed and ground up piece according to what I will recount to you.
E es que tu razas le cap del malaute plaguat, e descuebres sobre le os segon costuma e manieyra a tu possible segon la figura de la plagua, e que sia leugier sobre le malaute.	And it is that you shave the head of the victim who has been victimized, and uncover over the bone according to habit and manner possible to you according to the figure of the plague, and that be lighter on the victim.

And if you have to do the detection of the bone, blood flow or pus cauterize, then you should oppose it with what covers, and it is that you dress the place of drapes infused in wine and rose oil, and let the plague rest while the pustule is settled, and be certain of the blood flow; and then begin in the circuit of the bone and in its removal.
E aquo sia segon una de dos manieyras de operacio.	And that be according to one of two manners of operation.
E la una manieyra es que tu inscidas le os am inscisori de streyt tal, e aquesta es la forma de lu: E aprop administra un autre inscissori aquest, un pauc pus lat que aquel; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And the one manner is that you insert the bone with a narrow incision knife, and this is its form: And then administer another incision knife this, a little wider than that; and this is its form:
E aprop administra mays le inscissori pus lat que·l segon.	And then administer the incision knife wider than the second.

And it should be that you have many incision knives, of which some are wider than others; and some are shorter than the others and are in the thickness of their sharpness, and are of iron sharpened or filed.

And if the bone is strong and hard, then you should bore in the circuit of it before you administer the incision knives with the drills, which are named non-deep drills.
E no so nomnatz ayssi sino quar aquels no pausan le terme de l’os del test ad aquo que es aprop lu, per so quar al taravel es redonda extremitat o marge sobre aquel que es dejos le cap de lu agut semblant a marge o a cercle petit, le qual prohibeys esser submergit e passar la spissitut del os.	And they are not named so but because those do not stop the end of the bone to it that is aprop it, so that to the drill is round extremities or margin over that which is under the head of it sharp resembling a margin or small circle, which prohibits being submerged and passing the thickness of the bone.
E es convenient que tu prenguas de aquestz taravels gran nombre dels quals quascu convenesca a la spicitut de quascun os, entro que sia a tu present en tottz testz del cervel la extremitat del qual sia aguda, la quantitat en longitut e brevitat sia segon la quantitat de spicitut de aquest test.	And it is convenient that you take of these drills great number of which each suits the thickness of each bone, while being present in all bones of the brain the extremities of which are acute, the quantity in length and brevity is according to the quantity of thickness of this test.
E aquesta es la forma de tres specias de teravels: La qualitat de perforar en le circuit del os trencat es que pauses le teravel sobre le os e revolvas aquel am les tieus ditz entro que sapias que l’os ja es penetrat; e aprop permuda le terevel ad autre loc, e pausa aquo que es entre tot trauc la quantitat de la grosseza del ray o enviro aquo.	And this is the form of three species of drills: The quality of drilling in the circuit of the broken bone is that you pause the drill over the bone and rotate it with your fingers while you know that the bone has been penetrated; and then change the drill to another location, and pause what is between all the way the amount of thickness of the ray or environment that.
E aprop inscideys am inscissoris aquo que es entre quascun trauc del os, e fay aquel pus subtil que podes sobre aquo en fi de levitat, ayssi cum havem dit, entro que erradiques le os, o am la tua ma, o am alcuna autra causa per alcus sturmentz les quals auras apparelhatz ad aquo, ayssi cum tanalhas e forceps subtils.	And then you insert with incision knives what is between each crack of the bone, and make that more subtle than you can over that at end of elevation, as we have said, within erradiques the bone, or with your hand, or with any other cause by some tools which you will have equipped as pins and forceps subtle.
E cove que tu guardes am tota cautela que l’inscissori no toque alcuna causa del ciphac.	And it should be that you keep with great care that the incision knife does not touch any cause of the brain.
E donc cum auras circuit le os perforan, e sira separat del ciphac si es continuat am lu, e auras aquel extrayt, cove que razas e enguales aquel en la asperitat de lu de aquo que es en le os am autra sturment semblant a inscissori, mays empero cove que sia pus teon e pus subtil que les autres inscissoris.	And then when you have bored the bone perforated, and separated from the brain if it is continued with it, and have that extracted, then shave and bite that in the roughness of it from what is in the bone with another instrument similar to an incision knife, but however let it be thicker and more subtle than the other incision knives.
E si roman alcuna partida dels osses petitz e satagias, lahoras pren aquela am facilitat am aquo que es deves tu dels sturmentz; e aprop aquo cura la plagua am lichinis e enguentz les quals havem ditz.	And if any part of the small and broken bones, then take that with facility with what it is due to you of the instruments; and then that cure the plague with poultices and ointments which we have said.
E l’autra manieyra de operacio es leugiera, longinqua de paor, la qual diyssec Gualia e la lauzec per gran lausor; e aquest es le sermo de lu: necessari es a tu en le comensament que comenses descobrir la partida del os del loc en le qual es la fractura pus vehement e pus manifesta, entro que quan auras descubert aquela partida e auras pausat dejos lu la extremitat de aquest inscissori lent e alegre del qual aquesta es la forma:	And the other manner of operation is gentle, distant from fear; and it is called Gualia and is called by great laziness; and that is the name of it: it is necessary for you in the beginning to begin to uncover the part of the bone of the place where is the fracture most violent and most manifest, and then when you have uncovered that part and have paused below it the end of this incision knife long and gentle of which this is its form:
E es que la partida lenticular es leon e no inscideys alcuna causa, e la partida aguda es de lu en dos latz avantz en longitut, ayssi cum vezes; que la partida lenticular sia ajustada al ciphac am la facia de lu inscident aguda en le os.	And the lenticular part is round and does not insert any cause, and the acute part is of it in two sides in length, as you see; that the lenticular part be fitted to the brain with the facet of it inscribing acute in the bone.
E aprop percuteys sobre le inscissori de una partida am un petit malhet entro que inscidas tot le os am facilitat ayssi cum es revolvut, e tu sias segur del pannicol que no accida en lu accident que temas en denguna manieyra, e si le medicant14 era le pus fol de totz les homes e le mays ignorant de lor; certament, e si era dorment.	And then you pierce on the incision knife of one part with a small needle within that you insert all the bone with facility as it is rotated, and be certain of the padding that no accident happen to you in any manner which you fear in any way, and if the patient was the most foolish of all men and most ignorant of them; certainly, and if he was sleeping.
Lahoras si romania alcuna causa annexa al os del pannicol en alcus locs de os, inscidira aquel de lu am la extremitat del inscissori aquel lenticular, e deliuraria aquel de lu am facilitat, quar es deliurat de lu ses nocument e ses paor.	Then if it penetrates any cause attached to the bone of the padding in some locations of bone, pierce that from it with the end of the incision knife lenticular, and loosen that from it with facility, because it is loosened from it without harm and without fear.
E si fractura del os no penetra entro al pannicol, e aquo que es abscidit o es ostat del os es la facia de lu, e roman en lu asperitat e satagias subtils, lahoras cove que razas aquela asperitat e erradiques aquelas satagias am razoris subtils per les quals tu has preparat le nombre, de diversas quantitatz per que sia a tu possible administrar de aquels en tot loc les pus convenientz de lor e le pus dreyt de aquels segon aquo en que te perduzeys la tua operacio aquel os trencat e la figura de lu.	And if the fracture of the bone does not penetrate within the padding, and what is severed or is left of the bone is the facet of it, and you have in it roughness and minute cracks, then shave that roughness and loosen those cracks with subtle rasors by which you have prepared the number, of diverse quantities so that be to you possible to administer them in all locations the most convenient of them and the most direct of those according to what in which you are involved your operation that broken bone and the form of it.
E cove que administres en la tua razio am la qual razes le os al comensament le pus lat de aquels razoris, e aprop usa aprop lu del pus subtil de lu, e no cesses far aquo segon continuitat entro que pervenguas ad aministrar le pus teon e·l pus subtil de totz aquels.	And it should be that you administer in your reason by which you shave the bone at the beginning the wider of those rasors, and then use after it the most subtle of them, and do not cease doing that according to continuity until you arrive to administer the most thick and the most subtle of all those.
Mays en quascuna de las autras fracturas petitas capillars e fractura subtil, cove que administres cura segon aquo que perduseys ad rectificacio de lu.	But in each of the other small and fine fractures and subtle fracture, let you administer cure according to what you have arrived at rectification of it.
E es causa que no es ameguada sobre totz les quals han studi en aquela art.	And it is caused by not being removed from all those who have studied in that art.
E stec sobre aquo que nos scriut havem mostrat en grans fracturas.	And as for this, what we write about, we have shown in great fractures.
E si le pannicol es retangut quan tu erradiques le os, lahoras cove que prenguas drap de li segon la quantitat de la plagua, e submergeys aquel en oli rozat, e pausa aquel sobre le orrifici de la plagua; e aprop pren autre drap doblat o triplicat e submergeys lu en vi e oli rozat e pausa aquel sobre drap prim e fay aquo al pus leugierament que podes sobre aquel, que no graves le ciphac; e aprop administra sobre aquel liament lat, e no strenhas aquel sino per quantitat que tengua la plagua tant solament.	And if the skin is stretched when you remove the bone, then take a piece of cloth according to the amount of the wound, and soak it in rose oil, and place that on top of the opening of the wound; and then take another piece of folded or doubled cloth, soak it in wine and rose oil, and place it over the first piece of cloth, and do this lightly with pus on that, so that you don't press hard on the head. And then apply salt water to it, and do not tighten it except for the amount that the wound is, only.
E layssa aquel am aquesta cura per un dia o per dos entro que sias segur de apostema caut; e aprop deslia aquel e aprop aministra medicinas am las quals es superflua siccitat, ayssi cum razitz de lin e farina de errs, e polvera de enses e de aristologia, e de semblantz ad aquels.	And let him remain with this treatment for one or two days until you are sure of cauterization; and then loosen that, and administer medicines that get rid of superfluous moisture, like flax and linseed flour, and powder of fennel and of aristology, and of similar things to those.
E es que tu fassas de aquestas medicinas polvera que sia pulverizada sobre la plagua, ayssi cum son secas; e universalment, administra en aquel tota medicina de proprietat de la qual es que abstergesca e no mordique.	And it is that you make of these medicines powder that is sprinkled over the wound, as they are dry; and generally, administer in that all medicine of the property of which is that cleanses and does not bite.
E guarda te segon la tua vertut que la plagua en la tua curacio sia neta; e no sia en lu surdicia de enguent ni autra; ni no layssas agreguar virulencia en lu; quar quan es ajustada sobre le pannicol del cervel, corromp aquel e poyreys aquel, e accideys sobre le malaute aprop aquo malicia maligna.	And be careful according to your virtue that the wound in your treatment is clean; and let there not be in it any filth of ointment or other; nor let you allow virulence to accumulate on it; for when it is applied to the membrane of the brain, it corrupts it and destroys it, and malicious evil occurs over the patient accordingly.
E accideys en le ciphac del cap, cum de lu es mondificat le os e majorment quan es menspresada la cura de lu, e es negror en la superficia de lu; e donc considera lahoras si accideys al malaute les accidentz que havem ditz, sapias que es parnicios ses tot dopte.	And accidents occur in the head, as the bone is removed from it and especially when the treatment of it is diminished, and there is blackness on its surface; and therefore consider if the accidents that we have said occur to the patient, know that they are fatal without a doubt.
E si no accideys negror sino de la medicina que es pausada desus, e es en vertut de aquela medicina que fassa aquela negror, lahoras cove que tu prenguas de mel una partida e de oli rozat partidas .iii., e am aquels linieys un drap, e aprop pausa aquel sobre le ciphac; e aprop cura aquel am las specias de curacio que conveneys entro que sia sanat.	And if blackness does not occur but from the medicine that is placed on it, and it is due to that medicine that causes that blackness, then take honey in one part and rose oil in three parts. And soak a piece of cloth with those, and then place that on the head; and then cure that with the spices of treatment that are convenient until it is healed.
Capitol .iii.	Chapter .iii.
De restauracio del nas quan es trincat.	On the restoration of the nose when it is broken.
Sapias que no es trencat del nas sino doas partidas ensemps pus sobiranas, o una de aquelas alcunas veguadas, per so quar en lu has dos osses, quar la partida dejos es cartillaginosa, e no es trencada e no accideys a lu sino atricio e tortuositat e sinuitat.	Know that the nose is not broken except in two parts, both above, or one of those some few times, because in it there are two bones, and the lower part is cartilage, and is not broken, and nothing occurs to it except curvature and twisting and sinusitis.
Mays si es trencada la una de las doas partidas de lu, lahoras cove que tu intrometas le dit petit en le sieu nas, e que engualhas aquela fractura dedintz am le tieu dit indic, e am le dit pous defora, entro que retorne le nas segon la sua figura natural.	But if one of the two parts of it is broken, then you must put your thumb in his nose and close that fracture with your index finger and your thumb, so that the nose returns according to its natural shape.
E sia fayt aquo per tu am facilitat, e guarda te que no caja per aquela tua operacio sobre le malaute delor.	And let it be done by you with facility, and be careful that it does not hurt the patient through that operation.
E si la fractura es en la pus sobirana partida del nas, e le dit no perve ad aquela, lahoras cove que sia equat am la extremitat del ray en le qual sia petita grossitut.	And if the fracture is in the highest part of the nose and the finger does not reach it, then let it be split with a sharp edge at its tip to make it a little thicker.
E si la fractura es en doas partidas, lahoras tu fay le semblant de aquo.	And if the fracture is in two parts, then you do the same thing.
E coyta te am restauracio de lu en le primier dia de la fractura, si es possible; e sino, lahoras aprop le vii o·l x deves le repaus del apostema caut.	And try to restore it in the first day of the fracture, if possible; and if not, then you must allow the cautery wound to heal for two or three days.
E aprop entromet en la extremitat del nas una meca de drap de li, si la fractura es en una partida, o metz doas calguas, si la fractura es en doas partidas, e sia en la calgua grossitut de tanta quantitat que umpla le trauc del nas.	And then insert at the end of the nose a plug of linen cloth, if the fracture is in one part, or insert two plugs, if the fracture is in two parts, and let there be in the plug thickness of such quantity that it fills the crack in the nose.
E diysso alcus dels antics restauradors que las calguas sian enfundudas en boder, e sian permudadas en tot dia, mays no es vist a mi; habantz cove que la meca sia enfunduda en album de huou comfit am polvera de moli; e aprop layssa la qualgua entro que l’os sia fermat e sia endurazida la cartillage.	And some of the ancient restorators say that the plugs are wrapped in fat, and are changed every day; but I have not seen it; I had rather that the plug be wrapped in yolk of egg with powdered sugar, and let the bone be bound and the cartilage hardened.
E alcunas veguadas sia entromes en le nas, en loc de calgua, pena de auca pus que es envolopada de drap de li leon; e sia que ja te la fractura del nas pus vehement e que le malaute no sia prohibit de inspiracio.	And sometimes let a plug be inserted in the nose instead of a plug, which is a goose feather wrapped in linen cloth; and let the fracture of the nose be very strong, and let the patient not be prohibited from breathing.
E aquesta causa no es a tu necessaria; e si voles, fay aquo, e si voles, fay calguas.	And this cause is not necessary for you; and if you want to do it, then do it, and if you want to do plugs.
E si accideys autra veguada apostema caut, emplastra le nas am cerot o am coto enfus en vi agre e oli rozat, o am diaquilon.	And if another cautery wound occurs, plaster the nose with a poultice or with cotton soaked in wine and rose oil, or with diaquilon.
Mays si no accideys apostema caut, lahoras cove que emplaustres aquel defora am farina de sizami e am polvera de enses cofitz am album de huou; e aprop pausa sobre lu stopa leon, e no lies le nas am alcuna causa.	But if a cautery wound does not occur, then plaster that outward with sesame flour and fennel powder mixed with yolk of egg; and then place on it a plug of linen cloth, and do not tie the nose for any reason.
Mays si so trencats les osses del nas am fractura petita o so conminuitz, lahoras cove que scindas sobre aquels, e extraguas aquels am insturmentz que conveno ad aquels; e aprop cos la scissura, e cura aquela am aquo que encarna e consolida, e am emplastres ad aquo convenientz.	But if the bones of the nose are broken with a small fracture or are crushed, then split them and extract them with instruments that are appropriate for those; and then sew the wound, and cure it with something that causes flesh to grow and harden, and with plasters that are convenient for that.
E si accideys plagua dedintz le nas, lahoras cove que cures aquela am calguas e administra canulas de plom entro que sia de tot sanat.	And if a wound occurs inside the nose, then cure that with plugs and administer lead tubes so that it is completely healed.
Capitol .iiii.	Chapter .iiii.
De restauracio de la mandibula quan es trincada.	On the restoration of the jaw when it is broken.
Quan la mandibula dejos es rompuda e la fractura de lu no es am plagua, reguarda lahoras si la fractura es deforas tant solament, e no es trencada en dos e es curvada a las partidas dedintz, lahoras la sua cognicio es leugiera.	When the jaw is broken and its fracture is not with pus, then be careful if the fracture is outward only and is not split in two and curved inwards, then its cognition is obscure.
E cove donc, si la fractura es en la part dreyta, que tu intrometas le tieu indic senestre en la boca del malaute; e semblantment si la fractura es an la mandibula senestra, lahoras intromet le dit indic de la ma dreyta; e impelleys am aquel la gilbositat de la fractura dedintz am facilitat a las partidas defora, am la tua autra ma de la partida defora del os; am aquel decentment equa aquelam.	And therefore, if the fracture is on the right side, then insert your left index finger in the mouth of the patient; and similarly if the fracture is on the left side, then insert your right index finger; and push with that the crookedness of the fracture inward with facility from the outward sides, with your other hand from the inward side of the bone; with that decently split that.
E si la fractura de la mandibula ja es separada en doas, lahoras cove que administres extensio de doas partz segon rectitut entro que sia possibla la equacio de lu.	And if the fracture of the jaw is already separated in two, then let the extension of its two parts be according to rightness so that the equality of it is possible.
E si accideys conmocio de dentz a disrupcio, lahoras strenh aquelas de las quals speras que romandran am fil de aur o de argent o de ceda; e aprop pausa sobre la mandibula trencada cerot, e aprop pausa sobre lu drap duplicat, e pausa sobre le drap gran stelha decentment fayta, o una pessa de sola engual a la longitut de la mandibula; e aprop lia aquela desus segon que a tu es apparelhada la liadura de lu e que conveneys la applicacio, entro que no es destruida.	And if tooth concussion to disruption occurs, then strengthen those of which you expect they will break with thread of gold or silver or gut; and then place on the broken jaw a poultice, and then place on that doubled cloth, and place on the cloth great star-shaped holes decently made, or a sole ingot at its length; and then ligate that above according to how you are equipped for its application, so that it is not destroyed.
E comanda al malaute que use de repaus e tranquilitat, e pausa la vianda de lu sorbicios leons.	And command the patient to have rest and tranquillity, and give him wine to drink.
E si extimas que ja es alterada la figura en alcuna manieyra, lahoras tu te coyta e deslia aquel al tertz dia; e aprop rectifica aquo que ja es alterat de lu e emplaustra aquel am polvera de moli, am album de huou, o am farina de cisami, pus que tu auras ostat le cerot de lu, e pausa sobre le emplastra lana leon.	And if you think that the figure is already altered in some way, then cover and loosen it on the third day; and then rectify what is already altered of it and plaster that with sesame flour, with yolk of egg, or with farina of sesame, after you have removed its poultice, and place on the plaster wool of linen.
E adonc cum sta annex e ajustat aquel emplastre sobre lu, e la disposicio del os no es alterada, layssa aquel, que no le deslies entro que sia sanat e strenh la fractura; quar motas veguadas aquesta fractura es streyta en tres sempmanas.	And then when that plaster and bandage are on it, and the disposition of the bone is not altered, leave that, so that it is not loosened until it is healed and the fracture strengthened; for many times this fracture is tightened in three weeks.
E si autra veguada accida apostema caut, lahoras administra aquo que havem dit motas veguadas en la sedacio de lu entro que sia sanat, e sia remaugut aquel apostema.	And if another cautery wound occurs, then administer what we have said many times in its swelling so that it is healed, and let the cautery wound be cleaned.
E si la fractura es am plagua, lahoras considera si es pessa del os separada o satagias, lahoras tu te subtilia que ostes aquelas satagias am aquo que conveneys ad aquo en la remocio de aquelas dels sturmentz.	If the fracture is compound, then consider whether the bone is separated or shattered. Then you must skillfully move those shards with what is convenient in the removal of those [shards] with instruments.
E si le orrifici de la plagua es streyt, lahoras tu le amplifique am le fleubotomi segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.	And if the opening of the wound is narrow, then widen it with phlebotomy according to the amount of your need.
E aprop quan tu auras ostat aquelas satagias, e de aquelas no sira remaugut re, lahoras tu cos le orrifici de la plagua si es ampla; e sino, pausa sobre aquela un dels emplaustres que conveneysso ad aquo e encarnan aquela, entro que sia sanada.	Then, when you have moved those shards, and none of them remain exposed, then close the opening of the wound if it is wide; but if not, place one of the appropriate ointments over it, which will help it to heal.
Capitol .v.	Chapter 5:
De restauracio de la furcula quan es trinquada.	Of the restoration of the collarbone when it is dislocated.
Motas veguadas es trencada la furcula de la partida denant deves le muscle, e aquela fractura es fayta en una de tres manieyras.	Many times the furcola of the front part is broken due to a blow from a muscle, and that fracture happens in one of three ways:
Quar o es trencada, o seperada, o es seperada en doas partz otra que no accidan satagias; e es leugier a la restauracio de lu; o es ayssi que accideysso en lu satagias, e es dificil a restauracio de lu; o es ayssi que la fractura es am plagua.	Because it is broken, or separated, or separated into two parts without shattering; and its restoration is easier; or it happens that shards occur in it, and its restoration is difficult; or the fracture is compound.
E la operacio en aquela, quan la fractura es ses plagua, es que tu fassas esser present dos ministres, per so que la un tengua le adjutori e siegua la furcula trencada, e l’autre extenda le col ves aquela partida.	And the operation on it, when the fracture is compound, is that you have two assistants, so that one holds the joint and follows the broken collarbone, and the other pulls the neck towards that side.
E aprop enguala la fractura am les tieus ditz entro que sia fayta la forma de lu segon que cove, e no sia en lu eminencia pauca ni concavitat.	Then, attach the fracture with threads so that it is made according to its shape, and there is not a little prominence or concavity.
E si indigeysses mes de extencio, lahoras cove que pauses dejos le titillic del malaute spera de drap o de lana, e sia la grandesa de lu segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat; e exten e eleva la furcula e coarta la spera am la tua ma entro que enguales la frectura segon que cove.	And if you need more extension, then place a cord made of cloth or wool under the patient's armpit, and let its size be according to the amount of your need; and extend and raise the collarbone, and hold the cord with your hand so that it ties the fracture according to its shape.
E si no podes atirar la extremitat de la furcula a las partidas defora, per so quar es pervenguda al preon, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sua cervitz, e pauses sobre le muscle de lu un coyssi migier en grandeza.	And if you cannot bring the end of the collarbone to the sides outside, because it has been reached by the shoulder, then let the patient be supine on his neck, and place a cushion under his armpit, half in size.
E le ministre prema le muscle de lu a las partidas dejos entro que l’os de la furcula sia elevat que es en le preon en sus, e lahoras tu rectifique la fractura e enguala aquela am les tieus ditz.	And the assistants press his armpit down to the sides below so that the collarbone bone is elevated higher than the shoulder above, and then you straighten the fracture and attach it with threads.
Mays si sentes satagias de la furcula e so maugudas, lahoras cove que fendes sobre aquela e extraguas aquelas satagias am facilitat.	But if you feel shards of the collarbone and they are exposed, then cut there and extract those shards with ease.
E si es retenguda en le os, lahoras tu ingenia inscisio de lu am un dels inscissoris les quals has apparelhatz ad aquo, pus que havias pausat dejos la furcula le sturment que serve le ciphac; e es sturment de fust o de ferr del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And if it is retained in the bone, then you invent an incision on it with one of the instruments which you have prepared for that, after having placed under the collarbone the instrument which serves the ciphac; and the instrument is of wood or iron, of which this is the shape of it:
E es semblant a culier del qual aquesta es la concavitat; e sia la sua latitut segon aquo que has necessitat de lu, segon la grandeza del os o la pauqueza de lu.	And it is like a spoon of which this is the concavity; and its breadth should be according to your need for it, according to the size of the bone or the thinness of it.
Mays la longitut de lu sia segon que es a tu possible a la operacio; que haja doas extremitatz ayssi cum vezes, e la una extremitat sia ample e l’autre streyta.	But the length of it should be according to what is possible for you in the operation; and let it have two ends thus divided, and one end be broad and the other narrow.
E si la disrupcio de la plagua la qual has inscidida quan has extraytas la satagia del os es ampla, e yest segur de apostema caut, lahoras tu ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura.	And if the opening of the wound which you have cut when you extracted the shard is broad, and it is sure that there will be an abscess, then bring together the two lips of the wound with a suture.
E si la disrupcio es pauca, o temes apostema caut, lahoras tu uemple la plagua am draps e pulvils segon la quantitat de la scissura de la plagua.	And if the opening is small, or you fear an abscess, then fill the wound with cloths and powders according to the amount of the split in the wound.
E si accideys apostema caut, lahoras infon drap en vi agre e oli rozat e vi, e pausa sobre aquel.	And if an abscess occurs, then soak a cloth in hot vinegar and oil, and place it over that.
Mays la strictura del os quan es ses plagua e ses seccio, es que pauses emplastre fayt de farina de moli am album de huou, e pausa sobre lu stopa leon, e aprop pausa la spera dejos le titillic de lu, si indigeyssas de aquela, e aprop pren humemate, so es torca la qual teno les Sarrazis , que sia mot longua, e sia latitut de lu de un palm o entorn aquel; e aprop pausa pulvils duplicatz sobre la stopa e l’emplastre; e aprop pren una stela de taula subtil de la qual la latitut d’ela sia de tres ditz e en longitut semblantment; e aprop envolopa aquela en drap, e aprop envolopa aquel drap am la stela en lo loc sobre le loc de la fractura; e aprop pausa humemati ayssi cum es revout, e revol aquela sobre le col de lu e dejos le titillic de lu sa e dejos le titillic de lu malaute, e reduzeys aquela sobre tota partida, e quan vezes que la strictura de la fractura am strictura descent, e es aquo que no es occultat sobre tu.	But the straitening of the bone when it is compound and severed, is that you pause an ointment made from flour of mill with egg white, and place over that a stopa made of lion's tongue, and then place the cord under his armpit if needed, and then take humemate, which is the one they call in Turkey, and let its length be of a palm or around that; and then spread powders doubled over the stopa and the ointment; and then take a subtle stake of wood, of which the breadth of it is three digits and its length similar; and then wrap that in cloth, and that cloth with the stake in the place over the fracture; and then pause the humemate as it is turned over, and turn that over the neck of him and under his armpit on both sides, and reduce that to every part, and when you see that the straitening of the fracture by straining, it does not hide from you.
E tot, que no sia mauguda la stelha desobre le os trencat; e per so cove que tu vejas le malaute quascun dia, que quan le liament es mollificat o vezas la stela ja esser remauguda, lahoras tu rectifica aquo e strenh la liadura.	And altogether, that the stake is not exposed over the broken bone; and so that you see the patient every day, that when the ligament softens or you see the stake already exposed, then you straighten that and strengthen the binding.
E aprop pausa le dormir del malaute sobre le col de lu, e pausa dejos le titillic de lu deves le dormir de lu en la nueyt un petit coyssi; per so que am aquel sia elevat le adjutori de lu del latz de aquel, e donc es elevada la la fractura de la furcula a elevacio del muscle; o sia le bras de lu liat al col de aquel.	And if the patient is broken in two or three parts, then make a stopa over which you have spread powders doubled with rose vinegar, and place that over the collarbone, and then attach it with threads.
E no deslies le liament si no accideys en le loc prusiment o apostema, entro a xii dias.	And do not loose the ligament unless an abscess occurs in the place or pus, until 12 days have passed.
E aprop renovelha le emplastre si has vista la facia de lu ad aquo, e ajusta en la strictura e restaura aquel e layssa entro que sia restaurat e sia coagulat la fractura de la furcula.
