E per aysso no cove que sia maugut ni stendut en la hora de la apostemacio, quar motas veguadas fa venir spasme e dolors ledentz.	And for that reason let it not be bent or stretched during the inflammation, because many times it causes spasms and pains in them.
Mays quan aquo accideys, lahoras cove que tu te coytes a la flaubotomia del malaute, e aprop sia layssat entro que repause le apostema; e aprop le membre sia embrocat am aygua cauda e oli, e aprop sia reduzit am facilitat.	But when that happens, let you care for the phlebothimia of the patient, and then let it be left until the inflammation subsides; and then the limb should be embrocated with warm water and oil, and then reduced with facility.
E tot membre sia curat am aquo del qual la rememoracio vindra en son loc.	And every limb should be cured by that of which the remembrance will come to its place.
E yeu ja e ordenatz les capitols de dislocacio segon que es precedit en fractura; de la partida del cos pus sobirana entro a la partida pus dejos.	And you have ordered the chapters of dislocation according to that which precedes in fracture, from the highest part of the body to the lowest part.
Capitol .xxiiii.	Chapter 24.
De curacio de dislocacio de la mandibula dejos.	Of the cure for dislocation of the lower jaw.
So dislocadas las doas mandibulas si no tart; e la dislocacio de amdos es fayta segon una de dos manieyras: que o son remaugudas de lurs locs per pauca remocio, e so mollificadas un petit; o so dislocadas per entiera dislocacio e complida, entro que sian mollificadas a la partida de la junctura entro que corro saliva del malaute e que no puesca tenir aquela ni puesca claure la sua boca, e la lengua de lu sia envolopada en sa paraula.	Both mandibles are dislocated if not tart; and the dislocation of both is done according to one of two ways: that they are swollen from their place by little motion, and become soft a bit; or are dislocated by entire dislocation and complete, so that they are swollen at the joint where saliva runs from the patient and he cannot hold that nor close his mouth, and his tongue is wrapped in its speech.
Mays quan la dislocacio de lu es pauca, lahoras en las majors disposicios retorna per si an pauca causa.	But when the dislocation of it is little, then in the major dispositions it returns by itself for little cause.
Mays si la dislocacio es entiera e complida, lahoras cove que sia administrada reduccio de lu leugierament, e no sia tardada de tot.	But if the dislocation is entire and complete, then let the reduction of it be administered gently, and not be delayed at all.
E es que·l ministre tengua le cap del malaute, e entrometa lo metge le dit pous de la una sieua ma en la razit de la dislocacio de la mandibula dedintz la boca de lu, si la dislocacio es de la una part; o que entrometa les sieus dos pouzes ensemps, si la dislocacio es de doas partz, e les autres ditz de las mas de lu sian defora am les quals enguale; e comanda al malaute que cesse las suas mandibulas e absolva aquelas anar de quascuna partida; e le metge engualhe la mandibula e enpellisca la mandibula entro que retorne al sieu loc.	And let the minister hold the patient's head, and let the doctor insert his finger of one hand in the root of the dislocation of the mandible within the mouth of him if the dislocation is on one side; or that he inserts both fingers together if the dislocation is on two sides, and the other fingers be out with which he hugs; and command the patient to cease his mandibles and release those from every part; and let the doctor hug the mandible and press the mandible so that it returns to its place.
E si dificil es la reducio de lu, e majorment si amdos las mandibulas so essemps dislocadas, lahoras aministra evoporacio am aygua cauda e oli, entro que sia fayta leugiera la reduccio de amdos e no tardes la reduccio de amdos de tot, ayssi quo havem dit.	And if the reduction of it is difficult, and especially if both mandibles are dislocated together, then administer embrocation with warm water and oil, so that the reduction of both be made gently and do not delay the reduction of both at all, as we have said.
E donc cum retornam e so engualadas, e es clausa la boca del malaute e no es mollificada, lahoras pausa sobre aquelas polvils de drap am cerot, e sia fayt de cera e oli rozat; e aprop sia liat am facilitat am liamens mols.	And then when they return and are hugged, and the mouth of the patient is closed and not made soft, then place over them powders of cloth with cerot, and let it be made of wax and rosin rubbed; and then let it be bound by facility with mild ligatures.
E sia le dormir del malaute sobre le sieu dos, e·l cap de lu sia stant entre dos aurelhes, per so que no maugue aquel a la partida dreyta ni a la sinistra; e no li fassas per forsa masteguar alcuna causa; habans la sieua vianda sia forbicio leon, entro que quan las dolors sian remaugudas e las mandibulas so nozadas, lahoras maugue aquo que vol.	And let the patient sleep on his back, and his head be between two pillows, so that he does not turn to the right nor to the left; and do not force him to open for any cause; having his food be lean meat, so that when the pains are reduced and the mandibles are swollen, then let him open what he will.
E aquo sia aministrat am facilita, e no trebalhe sobre la apercio de la boca deves la comestio e beure e ocitatio, entro que la mandibula sia nozada e sanada.	And let this be administered with ease, and do not labor over the opening of the mouth because of eating, drinking, and speech, while the jaw is numbed and healed.
E si es dificil la reduccio de duas mandibulas quan so dislocadas en alcuna hora e no so convertidas als lors locs, lahoras motas veguadas accideysso febres e soda assidua, e fort leu es alerguat le ventre del malaute, e fort leu e vomeys colera pura.	And if it is difficult to reduce both mandibles when they are dislocated at any time and are not returned to their places, then often sudden fevers occur, as well as continuous vomiting, and the belly of the patient quickly becomes swollen, and he vomits pure bile.
E quan tu vezes aquo, lahoras sapias que es perdicio; e motas veguadas mor aquel al qual accideys aquo en x dias.	And when you see this, then know that it is lethal; many times the person upon whom this happens dies within ten days.
Capitol .xxv.	Chapter 25
De reduccio de la dislocacio de la furcula e de la extremitat del muscle.	On the reduction of a dislocation of the collarbone and of the end of the muscle.
Furcula no es dislocada del latz dedintz per la sua continuacio am le pietz; e alcunas veguadas es dislocada a la partida defora, e aquo es declarat al sentiment.	The collarbone is not dislocated on the inside by its connection to the feet; and sometimes it is dislocated at the outer end, and this is indicated by sensation.
E la restauracio de lu es que·l malaute jagua sobre le sieu dos e extenda les sieus brasses.	And its restoration is that the patient lies on his back and extends his arms.
E aprop coarta le loc am la tua palma am fort coartacio, quar ela retornara.	Then press the spot hard with your palm, for it will return.
E aprop pausa sobre aquela emplastre e pulvils e strenh aquela.	And apply plaster and powder to that spot, and strengthen it.
Mays la extremitat de aquel que siec le coyde e·s continuat am aquel, no es dislocada en alcun dia; lahoras cove que sia reduzida e engualhada segon que havem dit e segon que es a tu aparelhat.	But the end of that which is connected to the collarbone and continued from it is not dislocated at any time; therefore it must be reduced and bound as we have said, and as your tools allow.
E aprop pausa sobre aquela emplastre, e pulvils, e extrictura, e comanda al malaute adherir a trenquilitat e a repaus entro que sia sanat.	And apply plaster and powder and a binding to that spot, and command the patient to adhere to tranquility and rest until he is healed.
E am aquesta meteyssa curacio es reduzida la extremita del muscle quan es separada del sieu loc.	And by this treatment the end of the muscle is reduced when it is separated from its place.
Capitol .xxvi.	Chapter 26
De la reduccio de la dislocacio del muscle.	On the reduction of a dislocation of the muscle.
Sapias que·l muscle no es dislocat sino segon tres manieras, de las quals es la una que sia dislocat a la partida del titillic a la partida dejos.	Know that the muscle is not dislocated except in three ways, of which one is that it is dislocated at the end of the tendon at the lower part.
E la segonda es que sia dislocat a la partida desus del muscle, e aquo es fayt tart; e no es dislocat a las partidas detras per la spalla; e no es dislocat a las partidas denant per les nervis.	And the second is that it is dislocated at the upper part of the muscle, and this occurs seldom; it is not dislocated at the sides by the shoulder, nor at the front by the nerves.
E majorment es dislocat e defora eyssit a las partidas dejos deves le titillic, e majorment en aquels dels quals las carns son paucas, leugierament es dislocat; mays en aquels en les quals so motas carns, es eyssit fora am dificultat.	And mostly it is dislocated and exits out at the lower parts by the tendon, and mostly in those of whom there is little flesh, it is dislocated with ease; but in those in whom there is much flesh, it exits out with difficulty.
E fort leu accideys ad alcus homes percussio o cazement, e le muscle de lu es apostemat de apostema caut, e es cujat per aquo que ja sia dislocat.	And quickly occurs in some men by concussion or blow, and the muscle of them is apoplectic from apoplexy, and it is cured because it has already been dislocated.
Adonc cove que tu sproes aquo entro que estias sobre-sertetut de lu, e lahoras procesiscas en la curacio de lu.	Therefore know this while you are in supination of it, and then proceed in the cure of it.
E es conoguda la dislocacio de lu quan es a las partidas dejos deves le titillic; per so que distingescas entre le muscle dislocat e·l muscle sa, quar tu atrobas entre aquels diversitat manifesta; e atrobas en le cap del muscle concavitat e dejos le titillic deves le tocament del cap del muscle ayssi quo un huou, e al malaute no pot redusir la sua ma a la sieua aurelha, ni maure aquela per totz movementz.	And the dislocation of it is known when it is at the lower parts by the tendon; so that you may distinguish between the dislocated muscle and the sound muscle, for you will find between them manifest difference; and you will know it in the head of the muscle concave and below the tendon because of touch, and the patient cannot reduce his hand to his ear on that side, nor move it at all.
Si es dislocat deves le pietz o ensus, e tu lahoras atrobas manifest tocament, e no es amaguat.	If it is dislocated behind or inside, and you feel touch clearly and it is not concealed.
E de aquesta dislocacio es fayta leugiera reduccio quan es fresca e le malaute es enfant.	And this dislocation has an easier reduction when fresh and the patient is young.
E la reduccio de lu es que·l ministre eleva la ma de lu a las partidas desus; e aprop pause les tieus pouses dejos le titillic de lu, e eleva la junctura am fortaleza en sus al sieu loc, e·l ministre eleva la ma de lu, e extenda aquela en sus; e aprop pausa aquela dejos quar ela retorna leugierament.	And its reduction is that the minister lifts the arm of him up above; and then place your fingers below the tendon of him, and elevate the joint with strength towards its place, and the minister lifts the arm of him, and extends it upwards; and then place that below because it will return easily.
Mays si per aquo que havem dit no retorna, e so del comensament que accidic la dislocacio, motz dias, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia banhat en aygua cauda e sia aministrada enbrocacio que mollifique e liniesca ayssi cum si so coytz razitz de altea, e fenugrec, e melillot en aygua, e sia administrada.	But if by what we have said it does not return, and only after the dislocation occurred, then let the patient be bathed in warm water and be administered an embrocation that softens and lubricates as if his thigh were razor-cut, with fenugreek, and honey in water, and be administered.
E aprop le malaute sia ressupinat sobre le sieu dos e sia pausat dejos le titillic de lu espera de lana que sia engual entre levitat e strictura, e aprop le metge pause le sieu talo sobre la spera, e eleva le cap del muscle am vertut, e atire la ma del malaute per que no sia mauguda a las partidas dejos, e autre ministre tengua le cap del malaute, que no sia maugut a las partidas dejos, quar aquela tantost retorna al sieu loc.	And then the patient is supinated on his back and a pillow is placed below the tendon of him, and he awaits in elevation and compression, and the doctor places his heel over the joint, and lifts the head of the muscle with strength, and pulls the hand of the patient so that it is not pulled down to the lower parts; and another minister holds the head of the patient so that it is not pulled down, for then that returns at once to its place.
E si voles, reduzeys aquel segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu fassas esser prezent un home le qual sia pus lonc que·l malaute, e estia de la part de aquel latz, e entrometa le sieu muscle dejos le titillic del malaute e eleve le titillic de lu a las partidas desus entro que·l malaute sia suspendut en ayre, e autre ministre tire la ma del malaute de las partidas dejos del sieu ventre.	And if you wish, reduce it according to this manner: and have a man present who is taller than the patient, and let him stand on that side, and insert his muscle below the tendon of the patient and lift the tendon of him up above while the patient is suspended in air; and another minister pulls the hand of the patient from the lower parts of his belly.
Mays si le malaute es leugier, lahoras cove que am lu que autre causa sia suspenduda, per so que grave aquel, quar la dislocacio retorna tantost.	But if the patient is light, then know that with him who for another cause is suspended, for gravity brings about the return of the dislocation at once.
E es reduzit eysament segon autra manieyra: e es que sia ficat en terra un fust lonc le cap del qual sia redon de figura, ayssi cum pilo de mortier, que no sia gros ni subtil, e aprop sia pausat dejos le malaute; pus que so pausatz sobre·l cap del fust draps leons, e·l malaute sia stant segon la longitut del fust, e aprop sia extenduda la ma de lu a las partidas dejos del autra part; e sia extendut le cos de lu del autre part am fortaleza, quar la junctura retorna al sieu loc am velocitat.	And it is reduced likewise according to another manner: and let a long post be placed in the ground, the head of which is round in figure, like mortar, that is not thick nor thin; and then let the patient be placed below, and let sheets of linen be placed over the head of the post, and the patient stand according to the length of the post, and then let his arm be extended from the lower parts on the other side with strength, for the joint returns to its place with swiftness.
E si es dificil reduccio de lu per totas las causas que havem ditas, lahoras usa de aquesta cura: e es que tu prenguas un fust la quantitat del qual sia en le lonc de dos brasses, e latitut de aquel sia de quatre ditz, e la grossetut de lu sia aleujat en le preon del tittilic segon aquesta forma:	And if its reduction is difficult for all the causes we have said, then use this cure: and take a post whose quantity is in the length of two cubits, and the breadth of it is of four digits, and the thickness of it is removed in the length of the tendon according to this form:
E aprop sobre le cap redon sian liatz drap leons per so que·l fust no ledesca le malaute.	And then over the round head are tied linen sheets so that the patient does not slide down.
E aprop sia pausat dejos le titillic del malaute, e sia extenduda la ma o le bras sobre·l fust entro a las partidas dejos, e sia liat le fust sobre le adjutori e le bras e la extremitat de la ma.	And then the tendon of the patient is placed below, and his arm or hand is extended over the post to the lower parts; and the post is tied over the helper, and the arm and the end of the hand.
Aprop sia pausat le bras sobre un scalo de scala segon la latitut, e la ma sia extenduda a las partidas dejos, e l’autre cos sia suspendut de l’autre part, quar la junctura intra tantost.	Then the arm is placed over a rung of a ladder according to its breadth, and the hand is extended to the lower parts; and the other body is suspended from the other side, for the joint enters at once.
E cum le intrament de lu es complit segon quascuna maniera que es a tu possibla, e lahoras cove que tu pauses dejos le titillic spera de lana de engual quantitat; e aprop pauza emplastre perparat de polvera de moli am enses e album de huou sobre tot le muscle, ayssi quo es revolvut desus, e aprop strenh dejos le titillic am strictura decent; e le liament sia revolvut sobre le emplastre, e la ma de lu sia annectida al col de lu, e sia leyssat, e no sia mauguda la ma de lu per vii dias.	And when the instrument of it is completed according to whatever manner is possible for you, and then know that you place below the tendon a sponge of wool of equal quantity; and then place plaster prepared from powder of moly with honey over all the muscle, as it is rolled above; and then bind it below the tendon with binding decently; and the bandage is rolled over the plaster, and his hand is attached to his neck, and he is let loose, and his hand is not pulled for seven days.
E cove que sia pausada la vianda del malaute pauca, entro que·l membre sia confortat, quar es pus leugier a la sanacio de lu.	And know that the food of the patient be lessened while the member is comforted, for it is easier for the cure of him.
E aprop la vianda sia donada major aprop vii o v e sia exercitat un movement; e donc si es fermat e no es mollificat, lahoras ja es sanat.	And then food is given more freely, and exercise is added; and if it is firm and not soft, then it is healed.
Mays si la junctura es dislocada motas veguadas per humiditat que accideys a lu o per autra causa, lahoras cove que en aquela sia administrat cauteri am tres traucs, segon que denant es dit en le capitol de cauteri.	But if the joint is dislocated many times by moisture that occurs in him or for another cause, then know that in that be administered cautery with three punctures, according as it is said before in the chapter of cautery.
E si tot aysso es fayt e aprop vii dias es desliat le liament e la junctura no es fermada, e le emplastre e la strictura son reduzitz sobre lu alcunas veguadas, e no es fermada e catz e no pot elevar aquel bras a las partidas desus, lahoras sapias que·ls nervis de lu, les quals so al cap del muscle, ja so inscizes o extendutz o mollificatz, e sapia que la junctura nul temps no sira ficada en loc sieu.	And if all of this is done, and then after seven days the bandage and binding are removed from him, and the joint is not firm, and it is cut and catched, and he cannot lift that arm to the upper parts, know that the nerves of him which are in the head of the muscle are already incised or extended or soft, and know that the joint never returns to its place.
De la dislocacio de aquela qu’es fayta deves le pietz e la mamilha o las partidas detras, la reduccio es fayta am impulcio e extencio am las mas, entro que retorne.	From the dislocation of that which is done from behind the feet and the breasts or the parts, the reduction is done by impulse and extension with the hands, while returning.
E sia administrada en aquela l’autra strictura, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And be administered in that other constriction, and cure that one until it is healed.
E si accideys aprop la sanacio gravitat en le membre e tarditat en le movement de lu, lahoras le malaute uze de banh motas veguadas entro que aquela gravitat sia alleujada e que retorne a la natura de lu primiera.	And if the healing of the body part happens slowly and with difficulty in its movement, then the patient should take many warm baths until that heaviness is relieved and the body part returns to its original state.
Capitol .xxvii.	Chapter 27.
De curacio de dislocacio del coyde.	On the treatment of dislocation of the neck.
Sapias que la junctura del coyde es dislocada am difficultat e semblantment retorna am difficultat; e aquela es dislocada a totas partidas, e majorment a la partida denant a la partida detras, e la dislocacio de lu no es amaguada a tu quar es cazent dejos le vezement o dejos le tocament segon qualque figura sia dislocat, e quan ajustes le coyde disloguat am le sa, aquo es a tu declarat manifestament, quar la junctura es concavada e no pot doblar le bras, ni tocar am aquel le sieu muscle.	Know that the neck joint is dislocated with difficulty and returns with difficulty; and it is dislocated from all sides, and especially from the front to the back, and its dislocation is not hidden from you because when you move the neck joint or touch it according to how it is dislocated, this will be made clear to you, for the joint is hollow and cannot bend the arm, nor can it reach with that hand.
E cove que·t coytes, e reduzescas la dislocacio tantost denant que vengua a lu apostema caut, quar si ve a lu apostema caut, dificil es la reduccio de lu, e fort leu no es sanat de tot; e majorment quan es a las partidas detras, quar pus mala es de totas las autras specias de dislocacio, e de major dolor, e motas veguadas deyssen am aquela la mort.	And when you see this, and reduce the dislocation immediately before it comes to an abscess, for if it comes to an abscess, its reduction is difficult, and often it will not be healed at all; and especially when it is on the back side, for it is worse than all other kinds of dislocations, and more painful, and many times results in death.
E la restauracio de lu, quan es aquela que es possibla reduzir, es que la ma de lu sia extenduda am doas mas, e le bras de lu sia expandut, e las mas del metge sian sobre le coyde e dejos lu, e el empellisca la junctura am les pouzes de las suas mas ensemps, o am la razit de la sua palma entro que torne en son loc.	And its restoration, when it is possible to reduce it, is for the hand to be extended with two hands, and for the arm to be expanded, and for the doctor's hands to be on the neck and below it, and for him to push the joint with his finger tips, or with the edge of his palm until it returns to its place.
Mays si la dislocacio es a las partidas denant, lahoras retorna ayssi que dobla la ma am la sua ma, entro que percuta le coyde am la razit de la sua palma.	But if the dislocation is on the front side, then it returns as he bends his hand with his own hand, while he strikes the neck with the edge of his palm.
E si la dislocacio no obezeys a la reduccio, lahoras aministra vehement extencio e mot fort.	And if the dislocation does not obey reduction, then administer a violent extension and a very strong push.
E es que dos ministres extendan le bras, e tenguan aquel eyssament dos ministres per so que no sia remaugut deves la extencio.	And two ministers should extend the arm and hold that joint so that it is not wrenched because of the extension.
E aprop sia revolvut le bras deves tota part, pus que es envolopat drap doblat lonc sobre la ma de lu, o liament.	Then the arm is wrapped around with a long piece of folded cloth or bandage.
E quant le metge toca la junctura am la sua ma, unte aquela am alcun oli per so que aquo sia aquelas causas las quals ajudan en lubricitat de la junctura am facilitat; e aprop empellesca la junctura am empulcio vehement entro que retorne.	And when the doctor touches the joint with his hand, he should smear it with some oil so that it may be caused by those things which help in lubricating the joint with ease; and then push the joint with a violent impulse until it returns.
E aprop la reduccio de lu cove que sia pausat sobre aquela empastre en le qual sia stipticitat e excequacio am album de huou, e sia extrenhut am strictura descent, e·l bras sia suspendut del col, e sia layssat per alcus dias.	And then its reduction should be made over that plaster in which it has been stiffened and dried with white of egg, and tightened with a descending bandage, and the arm suspended from the neck, and left for several days.
E aprop sia desliat; e donc si la junctura es formada en le sieu loc, lahoras tu deslia le liament de lu e layssa aquela.	And then it should be unwrapped, and if the joint is formed in its place, then you should unravel the bandage from it and leave it.
E si vezas la junctura no be strenher, lahoras tu itera le emplastre e·l liament, e layssa aquela per alcus dias entro que sia extrenhuda; e aprop deslia aquela.	And if you see that the joint is not stronger, then you should repeat the plaster and bandage, and leave it for several days until it is tightened, and then unravel it.
Mays si accideys a lu gravitat aprop la reduccio de la junctura, e la disposicio de lu es en movement, lahoras aministra humectacio en banh e fricacio subtil, e comprecio, entro que sia aleujat; o pausa sobre la junctura aleliati, so es coyssa de moto grassa; e aprop sia liada, e layssa aquela sobre le os le dia e la nueyt.	But if it happens to him that the heaviness remains after the reduction of the joint, and its disposition is for movement, then administer moistening in a bath and subtle friction, and compression, until he is relieved; or pause on the joint, olive oil so it is a fat of quick action; and then bandage it, and leave it for the day and night.
E aprop osta aquela, e met aquel en banh; e quan suza, lahoras tu fregua la junctura am fricacio temprada, e aprop itera sobre aquela aleliati, so es ronhonal de moto, una veguada, e la segonda, e la .iii.a.,	And then wash that one and put him in a bath; and when he has bathed, then you should rub the joint with tempered friction, and then repeat on that olive oil, so it is of quick action, once, and the second, and the third.
corrupcio ja es pervenguda sobre le denolam intrament de banh, entro que sia linit.	Corruption has already come upon the inner part of the brain, as it were a membrane.
E si voles, pausa sobre aquela fenda de vaca humida e scalfada am boder e stren sobre aquel; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas, quar aquela es humida e reduzeys a la sua disposicio.	And if you wish, place over that cow's udder which is wet and warmed with butter and stretched over it; and do this several times, for this is wet and reduces to its disposition.
Capitol .xxviii.	Chapter 28.
De curacio de dislocacio de malassen, so es de la junctura que es entre·l bras e la ma.	On the treatment of dislocation of the elbow joint, which is between the arm and the hand.
Malassen de la ma alcunas vetz es deslocada, e la reduccio de la dislocacio de lu es leugiera, e·l contrari es de las autras juncturas, mays empero cove que sia velocitat en la reduccio de lu en la hora en la qual es deslocada, denant que le loc sia apostemat o que accida en lu apostema caut.	The elbow of the hand sometimes becomes dislocated, and its reduction is easier than that of other joints, except when it happens in the hour in which it is displaced, before the place becomes abscessed or an abscess comes to it.
E la reduccio de la dislocacio de lu es que tu pauses la junctura de la ma del malaute sobre una taula e le ministre extenda la ma de aquel, e le metge pause la sua ma o o la sua palma sobre la iminencia de la junctura, e empellisca aquela entro que retorne al sieu loc.	And the reduction of its dislocation is that you place the joint of the patient's hand on a table and the minister extends his hand from him, and the doctor places his hand or his palm over the prominence of the joint, and pushes it until it returns to its place.
Mays empero cove que sia considerat si la palma ja es ostada al ventre de la ma, lahoras le malaute pause le dos de la sua ma sobre una taula deves la extencio e la reduccio; e si la dislocacio es precedent deves le dos de la ma, lahoras sia la posicio de la ma de aquel intrinicequement sobre la taula, per so que la ma del metge caja sobre aquela iminencia de la junctura.	But if it is considered that the palm has already been placed on the belly of the hand, then the patient should place both of his hands on a table because of extension and reduction; and if the dislocation is preceding from the hand, then let the position of the hand of him be intrinically over the table, so that the hand of the doctor falls on that prominence of the joint.
E donc si retorna tantost, bon es; e sino, lahoras strenh aquela am empastre cedant le apostema e layssa aquel; e no iteres aquo, quar sino, no soferta ni no podes sobre la reduccio de lu pus que passan a lu dias.	And therefore if it returns immediately, it is good; but if not, then tighten that with plaster, let the abscess pass and leave it; and do not repeat this, for otherwise, he will not bear nor be able to endure the reduction of it more than days have passed.
Mays empero la junctura roman segon la sua tortuositat; e no notz al malaute alcuna causa, sino que la ma es mollificada e no pot strenher alcuna causa; lahoras sapias que les nervis son trincatz o trissatz, e lahoras no es engen en lu sino que sia strenhuda am cauteri prop le cazament de lu e fort leu aquo confereys alcuna causa.	But if the joint becomes twisted according to its tortuosity; and the patient feels no cause, except that his hand is made soft and cannot be tightened for any cause; then know that the nerves are torn or cut, and then there is not pain in him except that it is tightened with cautery near the place of it and very often this indicates no cause.
Donc cum malassem es retornada, lahoras pausa sobre lu empastre le qual havem recomtat, e sia layssat e strenhut per v dias; e aprop sia desliat e sia layssat e la ma de lu sia excercitada.	Then when the elbow is returned, then place over it the plaster which we have recommended, and let it be left and tightened for a few days; and then unravel it and leave it, and the hand of him be exercised.
Mays si le movement de lu es ostat e accideys en lu alcuna gravitat, lahoras leniys aquela am aygua cauda e am fricacio alcunas veguadas, entro que sia alleujat.	But if its movement is hindered and some heaviness comes to it, then loosen that with warm water and with friction several times, until he is relieved.
Capitol .xxix.	Chapter 29.
De la curacio de dislocacio dels ditz.	On the treatment of dislocation of the fingers.
Alcunas veguadas so dislocatz les ditz a tota partida.	Sometimes they are dislocated on all sides.
E quan es dislocat alcun dit de aquels al dos de la palma o al ventre de lu, lahoras sten le dit e impelleys la dislocacio de lu am les tieus pouses, entro que retorne.	And when some finger is dislocated on the side of the palm or the belly of it, then push the finger and drive out its dislocation with your fingers, until it returns.
E aprop sostenta le cap del dit, e suspen aquel deves la part a la qual es dislocat, e layssa aquel per dos dias.	And then support the head of the finger, and suspend that from the part to which it is dislocated, and leave it for two days.
E aprop suspen aquel e exten aquel entro que dreyt sia engualhat en aquel sieu dia.	And then suspend that and extend that until it is straightened out in that its day.
E quan sira noyt, lia aquel segon aquela narracio, e no cesses desliar aquel en le dia e exercitar am movement, e lia aquel en la noyt; e fay aquo per alcus dias entro que sia streyt.	And when evening comes, loosen that according to that narration, and do not cease to unravel it in the day and exercise with movement, and loosen it at night; and do this for several days until it is tight.
E fay semblant am aquo, si es dislocat al ventre de la ma, e lia aquel ad aquela partida e fay am aquo la tieua primiera operacio, entro que sia sanat.	And make it like that if it is dislocated on the belly of the hand, and loosen it to that side and do to it its first operation, until it is healed.
E semblantment fay am aquo quan es dislocat a las autres partidas.	And likewise do to that when it is dislocated on other sides.
Capitol .xxx.	Chapter 30.
De la curacio de dislocacio dels spondils del dos.	On the treatment of dislocation of the shoulder joints.
Quan accideys ad alcun dels spondils del dos o del col dislocacio complida, e so remaugutz motz spondils de lors locs, lahoras en aquela no es curacio, quar la mort se coyta al malaute.	When dislocation comes to one of the shoulder joints or the neck, and only dislocated joints remain in their places, then there is no cure for this, for death draws near the patient.
E senhal de aquo es que la egestio del malaute es fora-eyssida ses voluntat, e no pot retenir aquela; e motas veguadas so mollificatz alcus membres de lu o doas cambas de lu o dos brasses de lu, o un de aquels; o es remaugut un spondil de son loc, quar motas veguadas es remaugut e motas veguadas es fayta la remocio de aquels a quatre partidas.	And a sign of this is that the patient's excrement is discharged without their will, and they cannot retain it; and sometimes some of his limbs or both legs or both arms, or one of those, are made soft, or a vertebra in his spine is dislocated, for many times it is dislocated and many times the removal of those [vertebrates] is done in four parts.
Donc aquela ja es remauguda a las partidas detras e es nompnada gelbozitat.	Thus that which has been dislocated to the back is called scoliosis.
Mays la curacio de lu es que lahoras consideras si la gelbozitat accidey de puerissia, quar lahoras en aquela no es curacio ni de aquela no es sanacio de tot.	But its treatment is that when you consider if the scoliosis happens in children, because then there is no cure for it nor any healing at all.
Mays en aquela que ve per cazement o per percussio o per semblant ad aquels, ja diyssero les Antics las manieras de curacio am sermo prolixs, del qual lo mays retorna am profieyt; mays yeu ja e abreujat de aquel del qual lo pauc escusa del trop de lu, per la mieua propinquitat a la entencio mieua exposicio, am la qual he aquo expausat et format ex instrument divers de aquel am le qual mostrero aquo e espausero aquel.	But for that which comes from falling or hitting or similar to those, the Ancients spoke of many ways of treatment with lengthy speech, of which the most beneficial is to return it [the vertebra] with profit; but I have abridged that of which little excuses itself through too much of it, due to my proximity to its intention and exposure, by which I have expounded and formed from diverse instruments of that by which I will show and space out that.
E dic que en gelbosita que accideys de la partida denant en le pietz, no es engen ni sanacio de aquela; e semblantment en aquela que es fayta a dos latz.	And I say that in scoliosis that happens from the front in the feet, there is no remedy nor healing for it; and similarly in that which is done on two sides.
E de aquelas no es curada sino aquela que accideys en le dos propriament am aquo que yeu recomti.	And of those there is no cure except that which happens specifically in the back with what I will account.
E es que·l malaute sia extendut sobre la sua cara sobre pug engual prop de paret, e sia extendut dejos lu esturment molh per so que no sia lidit le pietz de lu.	And that the patient should be laid down on his back close to a wall, and that he be extended downward by his feet being raised so that they are not bent.
E aprop un fust dreyt sia pausat, ficat en la terra en la extremitat del pug entorn le cap de lu, e autra fust en aviro les pes de lu en l’autra extremitat del pueg.	And then a straight post should be placed and fixed in the ground at the end of the bed near the patient's head, and another post under his feet at the other end of the bed.
E·l ministre tengua le fust, e no sia fermat en fossa; e autre ministre tengua l’autre segon aquela forma.	And the minister should hold the post, and it should not be fixed in a hole; and another minister should hold the other second in that form.
E aprop envolopa sobre le cap del malaute e dejos les titillic liamen leon ferm; e exten la extremitat del liamel al fust le qual es deves le cap de lu, e lia aquel en lu; e aprop strenh l’autre liament sobre las ancas de lu les denols de lu, e deves las cambas de lu; e aprop ajusta totz les liamentz e lia aquels en l’autre fust le qual es deves les pes de lu.	And then wrap around the patient's head and down under his armpits a lion-skin firm; and extend the end of the skin to the post which is near the patient's head, and attach that there; and then tighten the other strap over the patient's hips and his knees, and attach those to the other post which is near his feet.
E aprop le ministre cascu extenda le liament a la partida del fust, e no sian remaugutz les dos fustz e les liamentz dels sieus locs en les quals son ficatz, mays empero no so fermatz ayssi cum havem dit.	And then each minister should extend the strap to the end of the post, and that the two posts and the straps at their locations where they are attached are not dislocated, but rather are tightened as I have said.
E le metge pause las suas palmas sobre le spondil am fortaleza entro que retorne, o que pause sobre aquela una taula, e aprop que ajuste sobre la taula les sieus pes entro que retorne.	And the doctor should place his palms on the vertebra with strength while he returns it, or that he leans over it on a table, and then that he tightens his feet over the table as he returns it.
Mays si no retorna per aquesta forma, lahoras pren una taula de la qual la latitut o la longitut sia en aviro de tres brassas, e cava en la paret de la qual havem dit que es prop le malaute un loc en le qual intre la extremitat de la taula.	But if it does not return by this form, then take a table of which the breadth or length is in the direction of three cubits, and dig into the wall of which we have said that is near the patient a place in which fits the end of the table.
E aprop pausa la maytat de la taula sobre le spondilh, e·l metge pause les sieus pes sobre l’autre extremitat, e estrenha be entro que le spondil sia coartat e que retorne al sieu loc.	And then place the middle of the table over the vertebra, and the doctor should place his feet over the other end, and tighten well while the vertebra is constricted and returns to its place.
E si tu voles, obre am torn le qual es revolvut am la ma; e es que tu fiques en terra deves le cap del malaute en le derier del pug dos fustz, la longitut dels quals sia d’un bras, e deves le cap de lu en le derier del pug eyssament dos fustz; e sia la longitut que es entre quascun fust un palm, e ja es fayt en quascun fust trauc en le qual corr torn, e quascun sia mot fermat en terra per so que no sia maugut.	And if you wish, open with a turn which is rolled by the hand; and it that you fix in the ground beneath the patient's head two posts, the length of which is one cubit, and fix the patient's head at the end of the bed two posts; and let the length between each post be a palm, and now there are made in each post holes in which runs a rope, and each should be tightly fixed in the ground so that it is not dislocated.
E sia mes un fust redon en le qual es le torn, e sia revolvut en les dos traucs dels dos fustz.	And there should be another round post in which is the turn, and it should be rolled in the two holes of the two posts.
E en la extremitat de lu es un trauc en le qual es format le fust, la longueza del qual es un palm am aquo que es revolvut; e en les dos autres fustz es semblant de aquel.	And at its end is a hole in which is formed the post, the length of which is a palm by which it is rolled; and in the other two posts there is similar to that.
E aprop strenh les liamentz que has streyt en le pietz del malaute en le trau le qual es deves le cap de lu, e les liamentz que has streyts en las coyssas de lu en le torn le qual es deves les pes de lu.	And then tighten the straps which you have tightened in the patient' s feet at the hole by which is his head, and the straps which you have tightened in his thighs at the turn by which are his feet.
E aprop deves quascun torn e stia un ministre que torssa le torn am la sua ma, e le metge engualhe le spondil segon que havem dit.	And then fix each turn and have a minister who twists the turn by his hand, and the doctor similarly the vertebra as we have said.
E aquesta es la forma del torn:	And this is the form of the turn:
E aprop pus que le spondil es retornat, e le loc es engualhat, lahoras cove que pauses empastre exciccatiu am album de huou, e aprop estopa; e aprop pause sobre le empastre astela de taula de la qual la latitut sia de tres ditz o enviro aquels, e la longitut de lu sia quantitat que prengua le loc de la gelbositat, e sobre la partida del spondil sa.	And after the vertebra is returned and the location is warmed, then put that you apply a plaster of honey with albumen, and then stop it; and then lean over the plaster a board of which the breadth is three digits or surrounding those, and its length is quantity that takes up the location of the scoliosis, and over the end of the vertebra as well.
E aprop sia liat am liament le qual havem dit, e uze le malaute de nutriment subtil entro que sia sanat.	And then it should be tied with the strap which we have said, and let the patient take subtle food until he is healed.
E si roman alcuna iminencia en le loc en la fi de la sanacio, lahoras cove que sian aministradas medicinas que moilifico e liniscan am aministracio de la taula per lonc temps, la qual havem recomtada; e ja es aministrada en aquel loc lamina de plom.	And if there remains any swelling in the location at the end of the healing, then put that are administered medicines which moisten and smooth with administration of the table for a long time, which we have recounted; and now is administered in that location leaf of lead.
E alcunas veguadas accideys imminencia en le derier dels spondils del dos, e es cujat per aquela dislocacio; e es aquel os le qual ja imineys per que no cove que sia fayta prosompcio a lu am aquesta medicina, quar fort leu fara a tu accidir mort.	And sometimes swelling occurs in the end of the vertebrae of two, and it is caused by that dislocation; and it is that bone which now causes so that there should not be made protrusion to him with this medicine, because strongly he will cause death to you.
Capitol .xxxi.	Chapter .xxxi.
De curacio de anca dislocada.	Of the treatment of a dislocated hip.
Sapias que la junctura del ancha e la junctura del muscle no endeve sino dislocacio tant solament, e no accideys ad aquelas aquo que accideys a las autras juncturas de petita remocio e concavitat.	Know that the joint of the hip and the joint of the muscle do not occur unless dislocation only, and it does not happen to those which happen to other joints of small removal and concavity.
E la junctura de la ancha es dislocada segon quatre manieyras, quar es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, o a las partidas defora, o a las partidas denant, o a las partidas detras.	And the joint of the hip is dislocated according to four ways, for it is dislocated at the inner parts, or at the outer parts, or at the front parts, or at the back parts.
E majorment es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, e pauc a las partidas denant o a las partidas detras.	And mostly it is dislocated at the inner parts, and seldom at the front or back parts.
E senhal de la dislocacio de lu a las partidas de dintz es quar, quan tu ajustas la camba del malaute sana am la malaute, es pus longua e·l denolh es pus heminent que de la sana, e·l malaute no pot doblar le sieu pe deves le lenguonar, e es le loc que siec le lengonar apostemat de apostema caut, per so que·l cap de la coyssa ja es pervengut aqui.	And the sign of its dislocation at the inner parts is that when you straighten the patient's leg with the leg, it is longer and the tendon is more prominent than of the healthy one, and the patient cannot bend his foot due to the tongue, and the location which the tongue comes from has become pus-filled here.
E·l senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio es a las partidas defora, es que les accidentz de lu so contraris ad aquest accident.	And the sign of that to which dislocation happens at the outer parts is that its accidents are contrary to those accidents.
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas denant es quar expan la camba sieua segon compliment, mays empero no dobla aquela ses dolor que es en le denol, e si se perforsa ad anar e no pot sobre aquo a las partidas denant; e la urina de lu es retenguda e l’engonar de lu es apostemat, e deves la ambulacio de lu sobre le talo.	And the sign of that to which dislocation happens at the front parts is that it expands his leg according to compliment, but it cannot bend without pain that is in the tendon, and if he goes forward and does not bear weight on his foot; and his urine is retained and his tongue is pus-filled, and he bears weight on his heel.
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas detras es que no expande le denol, ni no puesca doblar aquel denant que doble le engonar, e la camba de lu es pus breva que l’autra, e l’engonar es mollificat, e·l cap de la coyssa es deves aquel loc.	And the sign of that to which dislocation happens at the back parts is that it does not expand the tendon, nor can it bend without that which bends the tongue, and his leg is shorter than the other one, and the tendon is softened, and the head of the hip comes from that location.
Mays reduccio de las specias de aquesta dislocacio es que tu consideras, lahoras, si la dislocacio es vetusta et antiqua, que ja es anticada am le havent aquela aprop tu aministras reduccio de lu e roman segon la sua disposicio, lahoras no es en aquela curacio de tot; e adonc no cove que en aquela sia fayta prosompcio.	But the reduction of the kinds of this dislocation is that you consider, then, if the dislocation is old and antique, as it is aged by having been given for a long time, then there is not in that a cure at all; and thus there should not be made protrusion to him.
Mays en aquel del qual la dislocacio es recent, e es una de las quatre specias de dislocacio, lahoras te coyta ad aquo que volvas la junctura e extendas aquela a las partidas dedintz e a las partidas defora, e mau aquela a la dextra e sinistra, quar fort leu retorna e no indigeys de autra cura.	But in the case of a recent dislocation which is one of the four species of dislocation, you must apply to the joint what makes it return and extend it to those on the inside and outside, and especially to that of the right and left, for it quickly returns and does not need another treatment.
Mays, si no retorna en aquesta manieyra, lahoras cove que tu prepares ministre fort e extendas la camba de lu de la partida pus dejos, o am las suas mas, o am liament lo qual es liat sobre la camba desus le denol; e autre ministre extenda la ma de aquel desus enayssi que meta las suas mas dejos les titillics de lu; e aprop strenha am liament leon sobre la razit de la coyssa, e tengua autre ministre ters le extremitat del liament.	But if it does not return in this way, then you must prepare a strong minister and extend the leg of him from the part most below, or with his own hands, or with a bandage which is tied over the leg above the pain; and another minister extends the hand of that one above so that he puts his hands below his ticklish parts; and then tighten with a lion's hide over the root of the thigh, and have another minister hold the end of the hide.
E sia extencio de lu o de la partida dedintz a l’angonar a la partida de la furcula, o de la partida detras a la partida del dos.	And it should be extended from within to the angle of the breastbone, or from behind to the part of the chest.
E sia la extencio de totz aquels en una veguada entro que·l malaute sia elevat am le sieu cos de terra e que romangua pendent.	And all of these should be extended while the patient is elevated from the ground and his tongue is hanging out.
E aquesta specia de extencio es specia cominal a totas quatre.	And this species of extension is common to all four.
E donc si la dislocacio retorna am aquo que havem dit, sira bo; e sino, lahoras es necessari a tota specia aquo que dire de la propria curacio.	And if the dislocation returns with what we have said, it will be good; and if not, then it is necessary in every species to direct the appropriate cure.
En la reduccio de lu propria, quan es dislocada, e la dislocacio es a las partidas dedintz, cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre le sieu latz sa; e aprop pausa les liamentz sobre la razit de la coyssa en aquel loc le qual entre le cap de la coyssa e·l loc que es dejos le langonar; e aprop exten le liament en sus de la part del angonar a la pus auta partida de la furcula.	In the proper reduction of a dislocation, when it is to the inner parts, the patient should be laid on his side; and then place the bands over the root of the thigh in that spot between the head of the thigh and the part below the tongue; and then extend the band up from the angle of the breastbone to the highest part of the furcula.
E aprop autre ministre fort prengua les brasses de lu, e amerme le loc gros de la coyssa malaute e extenda a las partidas deforo per extencio vehement, quar aquela retorna en le sieu loc.	And then another strong minister should take the arms of him and press on the large part of his thigh and extend it to the outside by violent extension, for that will return to its place.
E aquesta specia es de pus leugiera curacio am la qual aquest membre es reduzit que las autres specias.	And this species is the quickest cure with which this member is reduced compared to the other species.
Mays si es excusat sobre tu e no obezeys al entrament am aquesta specia de curacio de tot, lahoras cove que sian liatz les dos pes del malaute ensemps am liament fort, leugier, sobre amdos les talos e amdos les denols.	But if he is unconscious and doesn't obey you when you try this species of cure with both, then you should tie both feet of him together with a strong band, quickly, over both heels and over both toes.
E sia la longitut de quascun de son par la quantitat de quatre ditz, e sia la camba malaute extenduda mays que l’autre per quantitat de dos ditz.	And the length of each of his parts should be the quantity of four digits, and the leg that is dislocated should be extended more than the other by a quantity of two digits.
E aprop le malaute sia suspendut sobre le cap del fust, e que sia en la mayso; e sia la longitut de lu de la terra la quantitat de dos brasses.	And then the patient should be suspended over the head of the beam and in the middle; and his length from the ground should be the quantity of two arms.
E aprop comanda a un jove fort que minuesca le cap de la coyssa, e sia suspendut am le malaute autre jove, e l’autre jove minuent la coysa am fortaleza empellesca, quar la junctura retorna al sieu loc am velocitat.	And then command a strong young man to lessen the head of the thigh, and another young man should be suspended with the patient; and the other young man, lessening the thigh with strength, should push, for the joint will return to its place quickly.
Mays en la reducio propria, quan es dislocacio a la partida defora, cove que·l malaute jaga sobre pug segon que havem recomtat en le havent gelbozitat; e sia strenhut le liament sobre la camba malauta propriament e sobre le pietz de lu.	But in the proper reduction when it is dislocated to the outside, he should lie on his back as we have recommended in the part about having coldness; and the band should be tightened over the thigh properly and over the feet of him.
E aprop dos fustz sian pausatz, la un als pes de lu, e l’autre al cap; e aprop sian pausatz fustz ajustatz al mieg del pueg ficat sobre·l qual draps humitz sian envolopatz, per so que·l malaute no sia dampnajat per que·l fust sia entre las coyssas de lu, per que deves la extencio a las partidas dejos no sia atirat.	And then two beams should be placed, one under his feet and the other under his head; and then beams that are close to the middle of the beam that is laid over which dampened sheets are wrapped should be placed, so that the patient is not damaged by the beam being between his thighs, for then the extension to the lower parts will not be drawn up.
E aprop quascun ministre extenda a la sua part, e·l metge am la sua ma enguala la reduccio segon l’art.	And then each minister should extend to his part, and the doctor with his hand should guide the reduction according to the art.
Donc, si obezeys a revercio, sira bo grandament; e sino, pausa sobre aquela diligentment e ayssi quo havem dit en gelbozitat per aquela engualment.	Therefore, if he obeys when reversed, it will be very good; and if not, then pause over that diligently and in the way we have said to warm him, for that will aid him.
Mays cove que·l malaute jagua sobre les sieus latz sa quetament.	But he should lie on his side quietly.
E quan la dislocacio es a las partidas denant, lahoras cove que la camba sia extenduda leugierament, e es segon aquesta meteyssa narracio sobre pueg; e le metge pause la palma de la sua ma dreyta sobre·l langonar malaute, e aprop coarte aquel am l’autra ma, e am aquela coartacio pausa aquel extendut a las partidas dejos a la partida del denol.	And when the dislocation is to the front parts, then the leg should be extended quickly, and according to this narrative it is in this way on the beam; and the doctor places the palm of his right hand over the tongue of the patient, and then he shortens that with his other hand, and with that shortening he extends it to the lower parts to the part of the toe.
E si la dislocacio es a las partidas detras, lahoras no cove que·l malaute sia extendut a las partidas dejos, e es elevat sobre la terra; habantz cove que sia pausat sobre causa dura, ayssi cum cove le eyssament si l’ancha de lu es dislocada a las partidas defora, segon aquo que havem dit del jasement de lu sobre dos anchas; e es sobre la sua cara e les liamentz sian extendutz, segon que havem dit, no ha guayre.	And if the dislocation is to the back parts, then it is not necessary that the patient be extended to the lower parts, and he is elevated from the ground; but he should be placed on a hard cause, just as we have said when the shoulder is dislocated to the outside, according to what we have said about his placement on two beams; and he lies on his face and the bands are extended, just as we have said, without delay.
E cove que sia aministrada compressio am taula sobre le loc al qual yeys la junctura.	And let compression be administered with a board over the place to which the joint extends.
Donc cum la reducio es complida segon que cove — e·l senhal de la reduccio de lu no es amaguat a tu, e es que tu extendas del malaute doas cambas, e quan tu vezes aquelas enguals e le malaute extrenh la sieua camba e expandeys aquela ses excusacio, lahoras sapias que·l membre segon que cove es retornat — e lahoras tu ajusta doas coyssas e pausa empastre e extrenh am benda ayssi que la ancha no sia mauguda en alcuna de las partidas; e adheresca le malaute a repaus per tres dias o per quatre.	Therefore, when the reduction is completed according to what you have — and the sign of the reduction of him is not hidden from you, and it is that you extend both thighs, and when you see those angles and the patient stretches his thigh and expands with no excuse, then know that the member according to which he has returned — and then you adjust both thighs and pause compression and tighten with a band so that the broad part is not bruised in either of the parts; and let the patient rest for three or four days.
E aprop deslia le liament e l’empastre, e compara la una camba am l’autra.	And then loosen the band and the paste, and compare one leg to the other.
Lahoras, si vezas aquelas enguals en vustament, lahoras sapias que la dislocacio ja es fermada, e adonc layssa le malaute anar.	And then if you see those angles in view, then know that the dislocation is already stopped, and let him leave after.
E si vezas alcuna causa de mollificacio, lahoras tu retorna e emplastra aquel, e extrenh aquel segon la tua primiera strectura, e layssa aquel en tres dias.	And if you see any cause of softening, then return and plaster that, and tighten it according to your first tightening, and let him leave after three days.
E aprop deslia aquel, e fay aquel tardar en ambulacio sobre quascu per alcus dias, entro que sia confortat.	And then loosen that, and let him delay walking on crutches for several days, until he is comforted.
Capitol .xxxii.	Chapter .xxxii.
De curacio de dislocacio del denolh.	Of the cure of dislocation of the toe.
Le denolh es dislocat segon tres manieyras, quar es dislocat a las partidas defora, e a las partidas dedintz, e a las partidas dejos mays a las partidas detras; e a las partidas denant no es dislocat.	The toe is dislocated according to three manners, for it is dislocated to the outside, and to the inside, and to the lower parts more than to the back parts; and to the front parts it is not dislocated.
E le senhal de dislocacio de lu es que comandes al malaute que aplique la sua camba am la coyssa; lahoras sapias que·l denol es dislocat.	And the sign of dislocation of him is that you command the patient to apply his leg against his thigh; then know that the toe is dislocated.
E la restauracio de totas las manieyras de lu es que fassas cezer le malaute dreyt, enayssi que ja extenda la sieua camba, si pot sobre aquo; adherir le tieu dos a la cara de lu, e pausa le pe de lu entre les tieus pes; e aprop fay adherir le denol de lu am las tuas palmas, e rete aquelas entre les tieus ditz sobre le denolh de lu am fortaleza, e autre ministre extenda le sieu pe entro que·l denol retorne a son loc.	And the restoration of all his manners is that you make the patient lie straight, so that he extends his leg, if he can on that; have him adhere his toe to the face of him, and pause his foot between his feet; then let him adhere his toe with your palms, and hold those between your fingers over the toe of him with strength, and another minister extend his foot while the toe returns to its place.
E senhal de reddicio de lu es que la sua camba adharesca am la coyssa am levitat no-laboroza.	And the sign of redemption of him is that his leg adheres to his thigh with non-laborious elevation.
E aprop emplastra aquel e fay adhirir la camba am la coyssa, e aprop lia aquelas emsemps am una benda per tres dias o per quatre, e aprop deslia aquelas.	And then plaster that and let the band adhere to his thigh, and then have him lie those together with a band for three or four days, and then loosen those.
E no uze le malaute de ambulacio per alcus dias, entro que sia sanat e cofortat.	And do not use the patient for walking for several days until he is healed and comforted.
Mays si la reduccio de lu a tu es excusada, lahoras aministra fort extencio am liamentz dels quals en la curacio de la hancha precedit narracio.	But if his reduction by you is excused, then administer strong extension with bands of which in the cure of the shoulder preceding narrative was spoken.
Capitol .xxxiii.	Chapter .xxxiii.
De la curacio de la dislocacio del talo.	Of the cure of dislocation of the toe.
Le talo alcunas veguadas es remaugut per petita remocio, e alcunas veguadas es dislocat segon compliment, e la dislocacio de lu es fayta o a las partidas dedintz o a las partidas deforo.	The toe sometimes is bruised by minor removal, and sometimes it is dislocated according to compliment, and its dislocation is made either to the inner parts or to the outside.
E le senhal de la dislocacio de lu es que vezes le talo imflat procedent a la partida a la qual es dislocat.	And the sign of his dislocation is that you see the talus [ankle bone] swollen proceeding from the part where it is dislocated.
Mays la curacio de la remocio de lu es de leugiera reddicio, e es que sia extendut am facilitat am las mas e sia engualhat entro que retorne.	But the cure for his removal is a gentle reduction and that he be extended with ease by hands and wrapped while he returns [to his normal state].
Mays en la curacio de lu quan es dislocat segon compliment, cove que fasses cezer le malaute dreyt, e tengua aquel un ministre fort e valent de la partida detras del dos de aquel en le mieg loc de lu.	But in the cure of him when he is dislocated according to nature, one should make the patient lie down straight and have a strong and valiant minister from behind hold his hips in the middle of his back in that very spot.
E aprop te tu am la tieua ma dreyta le pe de la pus sobirana part, e am la tua ma sinistra de la part pus dejos del pe en le loc de la cavilha.	Then with your right hand take the foot from its highest part and with your left hand from the lowest part of the foot in the spot of the ankle.
E aprop atira le pe a tu am la tua ma dreyta, e aprop am la sinistra per dos veguadas, e aprop exten am la sinistra; e empelleys le pietz del pe am la dreyta deves la camba ses trebalh.	Then pull the foot towards you with your right hand and with your left twice, then extend it with your left; and press the bottom of the foot with your right behind the leg as you work.
E fay aquo doas veguadas segon que havem comtat.	And do this twice according to what we have counted.
E aprop empelleys le pietz del pe a la camba la tersa veguada, e tu es a la cavilha.	Then press the bottom of the foot to the leg on the third round and you are at the ankle.
Donc si retorna en una veguada o en dos segon aquesta manieyra, e si vezes le pe engualhat, es bo; e sino, lahoras sobre lu itera la operacio, quar aquel retorna.	So if it returns in one or two rounds according to this manner and you see the foot wrapped, it is good; but if not, then repeat the operation upon him until he returns.
Mays si a tu es prohibida la reduccio de lu am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras fay jaser le malaute sobre le sieu dos sobre terra, e estrenh un paysel mot en terra fermat, e que caja entre las coyssas de lu, e tu ja has envolopat sobre lu drap per so que no ledesca le malaute.	But if it is prohibited to you to reduce him with what we have recommended then let the patient lie on his back on the ground and stretch a mat firm on the ground and place a pillow between his thighs and wrap a cloth around him so that he does not turn over.
E aprop le ministre de lu tengua las suas coyssas, e aprop autre ministre extenda le pe am las suas mas o am liament que lie sobre le col del pe; e aprop extenda aquel quascun ministre contre extencio del sieu par, e le payssel sia extant entre las coyssas del malaute retinent aquel, per so que·l cos de lu no sia atirat a las partidas dejos deves la sua extencio.	And let the minister of him have his thighs and let another minister extend the foot with his hands or with an instrument that lies upon the neck of the foot; and let each minister extend against the extension of his party, and let the pillow be extended between the patient's thighs holding it there so that the body is not drawn to the parts below its extension.
E aprop le metge enguala la dislocacio am las sieuas mas, e autre ministre tengua la coyssa sana a las partidas dejos, quar la dislocacio retorna am la facilitat.	And let the doctor wrap the dislocation with his hands and let another minister hold the healthy thigh at the parts below, for the dislocation returns with ease.
E donc cum retorna la dislocacio e es declarada a tu la sanetat de la reduccio de lu, lahoras pausa emplastre e extrenh aquela am liamentz fortment, e ligua le pe am liament a la camba.	And therefore when the dislocation returns and you see the health of its reduction, then pause plaster and stretch that with strong instruments and tie the foot to the leg.
E cove que temes o te guardes dels nervis les quals so detras sobre le talo, per que le liament sobre aquel no sia vehement e leda aquel fortment.	And take care of or guard against the nerves which are behind on the talus that the instrument upon it is not violent and lead that strongly.
E aprop layssa aquel per dos dias o per tres; e si le liament es mollificat, extrenh aquel.	Then let him leave it for two or three days and if the instrument is softened then stretch it.
E aprop deslia aquel en le ters dia o en le quart, e prohibeys le malaute de anament per xl dias.	And let him loosen it on the third day or fourth and prohibit the patient from walking for 40 days.
Mays si es forsat de anar denant aquel spazi, no es fayta segurtat que la dislocacio no sia sobre lu dissolvuda e corrumpuda, e aprop aquo que no recipia curacio.	But if he is forced to go before that space it is not secure that the dislocation is not dissolved and corrupted upon him and let there be no cure upon him.
E si accideys a lu apostema caut, lahoras cove que tu aministre en la cedacio de lu aquo en lo qual precedic la nostra narracio, en autre loc de curacio e de embrocacio, entro que sia remauguda.	And if there happens to him pus by cautery then let you minister to the ceasing of him that in which we preceded our narration, in another place of cure and embrocation, until it is cleaned out.
Capitol .xxxiiii.	Chapter .xxxii.
De curacio de dislocacio dels ditz dels pes.	Of cure for dislocation of the toes of the feet.
Cove que aquel qu’es dislocat sia engualhat am pauca extencio ses trebal; e aquo que no es dificil, abantz es leugier.	Let him who is dislocated be wrapped with little extension without difficulty and before it is easier.
Mays si la dislocacio es en alcus nozes del dos del pe, lahoras cove que fassas cezer le malaute le sieu pe sobre loc engual de la terra o sobre taula, e sia estant ayssi cum si anava.	But if the dislocation is in any part of the neck of the foot then let him lie down with his foot straight on a flat place upon the earth or table and be standing there as if he were walking.
E aprop tu sta de pes, e pausa le tieu pe sobre aquo que imineys de las juncturas, e aprop calca aquel am le tieu pe am vertut entro que retorne, e que vejas aquel ja engualhat e no aparesca en le loc eminencia.	And let you stand on your feet and place your toe upon that which protrudes from the joints and let you press it with your foot with strength until he returns and see that it is wrapped and there does not appear in the spot any eminence.
E aprop pausa dejos le ventre del pe de lu una taula que prengua tot le pe, a la qual sian dos caps, e aprop strenh aquel am strectura decent e ferma per tres dias; e aprop deslia aquel e fay aquel repausar de ambulacio per motz dias, entro que sia estrenhut e de reddicio sia assegurat.	And let you place beneath the belly of his foot a table which takes up all the foot and let it have two ends, and let you stretch that with decent and firm strength for three days; then loosen him and let him rest from walking for several days until he is stretched out and his reduction is secure.
Capitol .xxxv.	Chapter .xxxv.
De las specias de dislocacio que sian faytas am plagua o am fractura o am quascuna ensemps.	Of the kinds of dislocations which are made by blow or by fracture or by any other impaction.
Quan accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, e tu te perforssas en la curacio de aquela e en la restauracio de lu, motas veguadas succezeys la mort.	When that happens for any cause and you are proficient in the cure of that and in the restoration of him, several times succeed death.
E per aquo no cove que sobre la curacio de lu presuma, sino aquel que es savi en l’art, de lonc uzatge, misericordios e pietados, tardiu, no-ardit ni presomptuos; e que use en le comensament de medicinas que cedan apostemas cautz tant solament, e leyssa le malaute al divinal jutgament, sino ad aquel al qual speras salut de perdicio, am de la malautia alleviacio, e en la qual appareys alcuna speransa.	And for that not let you presume upon the cure of him but he who is wise in the art, long experienced, merciful and compassionate, tardy, not hasty nor presumptuous; and let him use in the commencement of medicines which yield pus by cautery only, and let him examine the patient to the divine judgement, unless one from whom you expect salvation, from wickedness alleviation, and in which appears some hope.
E adonc esforsa te tantost far de lu la reduccio en le comensament de la causa, denant que endevengua apostema caut.	And therefore make haste to do the reduction upon him at the commencement of the cause, before he goes into pus by cautery.
E adonc si le membre retorna segon que volem, lahoras aministra regiment le qual ceda apostema caut e cura la plagua am aquo que conveneys a lu dels enguentz desiccatius.	And therefore if the member returns according as we will let you then minister regime which yields pus by cautery and cure the wound with that which suits him of the dry unguents.
E si dislocacio es am fractura e accideys en le os satagias separadas, lahoras tu perforsa le stement de lor, e fay en aquo so que havem dit en las malautias simplas de aquo que es precedit en les locz de aquels.	And if dislocation is by fracture and impaction happens in the bones separated let you be proficient in their setting and do in that what we have said in the simple maladies of those which are preceded in their places.
E guarda e esquiva segon la tua vertut aquel del intrament en las vias de temor segon que a tu es precedida la mia predicacio; quar aquo es milhor a tu deves le tieu Creator, e mays permanent a la tua gloria, e mays saludos al tieu cos verays aquels en le tieu temps.	And guard and avoid according to your strength that of the instrument in ways of fear according as my prediction is preceded for you are better before your creator, and more permanent to your glory, and healthier to your body will be seen those in your time.
Ayssi fineysso las paraulas de Albucasim perfieytament de las quals Dieus ne sia benezeyt.	Thus end the words of Albucasis perfectly of which God be beneficent.
Amen.	Amen.
